text: Bottle shared at brussels. Brown big off white head. Nose is... error 404 not found. Taste is low bitterness low sweetness some spicey phenols. Fast finish.

Brązowe, mętne, nalewa się z obfitą pianą. Słodki aromat suszonych owoców, rodzynek karmelu, w tle lekki alkohol i trochę fenoli. W smaku na początku słodkie, pojawiają się nuty świeżych i suszonych owoców, chleb i miód. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Przyzwoita nudna Belgia.

From 330ml bottle. Pours gorgeous amber-copper with a full pillowy head that eventually fades into a creamy cap. Nose is malt, sugar, dark fruit, lightly funky. Flavors are a delicious, creamy mixture of fruit, toast, caramel, spice. Lightest touch of bitterness comes in on the long finish. Yum. Buying more tomorrow.
Super rich and fruity. Love the dark red appearance. The taste is really surprising and fruity.
Draft Taproom 6/1/17. Amber in color. Aroma is floral, honey. Flavor is floral, honey, alcohol, fruit, yeast.
Dark red apperance. Slightly yeasty, caramel aroma. Very light, roasty taste. Neither very sweet nor bitter. Dry at the ens. Nice mix of amber and double style.

0.33l bottle. Pours in medium ruby colour with huge white head. Aroma of caramel, perfumes, flower honey. Medium sweet, lightly bitter, no sournees. Medium body, thick feel, nice balanced caramel sweet aftertaste
Had the 750ml from LCBO, as I was eager to try another legendary beer. Great first impression, gotta love that barley.

Zombie apocalypse will have the same effect zzzzzz zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz zzzzzzz zzzzzzz zzzz zzzzzzzzz zzzzzzz zzzzz zzzzzz zzzzzz 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Voor mij bijna zelfde smaak als zijn blauwe broertje, maar de blauwe versie heeft meer smaak. Al met al is dit best een lekker relatief licht biertje.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not very spicy, but a bit sweet, and bitter. Its a perfect belgian brown beer. The head is big at the beggening, but appears fast. The color cloudy brown.

A: Brown with a big beige head
N: Medium roast barley, caramel
T: caramel and toast, later a full blend of spiciest
P: Medium
O: Satisfying Belgian, but not as complex as many of the other Trappist offerings I have had.

Ar: Plums and raisins; hints of orange spice and black pepper; deep toast and cake. Ap: Slightly hazy deep amber; large off-white head with phenomenal retention, leaving a picturesque Belgian lace on the glass sides and a thick cap of frothy foam. T: Cake, cotton candy, and peach up front, with a low sweetness; medium-high bitterness, fairly clean, herbal and spicy; raisin and peach, with some tartness; tart peaches on the finish. P: Medium-light body with very high carbonation; big mouthfeel of carbonation, somewhat rounded; finish is dry. O: An abbey dubbel with all the classic flavors--plum, peach, toasted malt; bitterness is quite firm and noticeable, but stops short of any harshness; overall, a solid beer.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
XxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxcxxxxxccccccccgffX via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma caramel, cereal, toast, citrus, dough, banana, Pours dark amber with tan lace top. Taste is sweet with caramel malt predominating Body is medium as is carbonation. What surprised me was the relatively brief finish. Its not as heavy as the bottle it came in. A good rather than a great example of why Belgian beer is so special and different from the English version.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi

Clean aroma with fresh citrus in the beginning and a subtle caramel-malty end, also hints of yeast. The color is dark brown (cloudy) with resemblance to melted sugar, and the ale has a big frothing creamy top. The aroma is clear, but without a relatively short finish.

The taste is prominently sweet (medium) and malty through the beginning with a clear bitter (medium), but with a crisp freshness to it throughout. 

Not the heaviest of ales, but certainly not light either as it feels nice and fatty in the mouth. A lively ale which might help the freshness come through. 

The only negative thing I could find with this beer was the color being a little cloudy, which I personally isnt a big fan of. Despite being a fairly heavy ale it was almost as drinkable as a light lager, which was surprising considering its sweetness. The tastes were clear and pleasant, but with more complexity to it if you are in mood for some searching. No wonder people join monasteries!
Aroma marcato con ottima schiuma persistente unottima birra trappista bevuta in bottiglia

Aroma: Dark berries and toasted cereals.
Appearance: Very dark brown color with hazy sparkilin liquid and white head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with light sour notes.
Palate: Medium body with creamy texture and lively carbonation. sweet astringent finish with alcoholic touch.
Overall: Not my kind of beer but it is understandable why it has the stamp of "one of the best". The sweetness and even the alcoholic touch don´t make it too hard to drink.

Reddish brown color, a little hazy. Bright white head, very carbonated. Floral and dried fruit aroma, figs or plums. Very carbonated, fizzy off tongue, body is full but carbonation makes it feel lighter. Plum, pear, banana, spicy flavor, malty flavor, with toffee or caramel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
nice brownish color and a big cream head. yeasty, malty and fruity taste. i did like it

Colore ambrato scuro, schiuma corposa e persistente, carburazione media. Sentori di malto e ferro che svanisce con la bevuta. Al palato malto, crosta di pane e albicocca. Finale amaro, birra molto equilibrata e molto bevibile.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2017 3 ans et 8 mois avant DLC. Brune ambrée col de mousse magnifique et tenue exceptionnelle, carbo importante. Arôme malt toasté et raisins secs et alcool. Bonne rondeur, malt grillés, légère amertume. Bonne bière.
Grumset brunlig ale med kort beige skum. Duft af malt, tørretfrugt i form af rosiner og figen samt krydderier. Smag af karamel, marcipan og krydderier.
Aroma marcante com ótima formação e persistência dá espuma. Cerveja ótima, leve e refrescante

750mL corked & caged bottle - VERY old - 07/08 vintage? Label has seen better days.
Bugger to get the corked out but presented with a gorgeous looking beer - deep ruby body, small but dense beige head persists.
Aroma subtle but intriguing - dried fruit notes of date, sultana, prune, vinous red fruits, honey & caramelised sugar/fruit.
A sultry silky smooth ride on the palate - soft fine carbonation, texture is velvety, perhaps lost a bit of weight with age but ethereally light, tremendous balance.
Palate is just sensational for an aged beer - starts sweet with those caramelised malts, good weight upfront then slims down with stacks of sultana & date and porty nutty rancio notes on a long spicy yet supremely well balanced finish.
The joys of great ales with maturity behind them - better than any fresh Chimay Red Ive tried!
pičkové pivo, podobně jako vechny Chimaye. Exluzivní pivíčko po vech směrech.
A toned down version of The Grande Reserve, but just as enjoyable. Pairs excellent with Chimays cheeses and bread.

330ml bottle. Pours with a good head and lacing. The aroma is pleasant, yeasty, fruity and malty, some banana as well. The taste is similar but is surprisingly flat. Not in terms of carbonation but flavour. Quite a subtle taste, good but could be better.

Bottle as gift. Pours hazy ruby brown with thick beige head. Aromas of strong barley sugars, green herby freshness with gentle, bittering, piney hops. Tastes as nose with a light peppery yeast. It has a sharp lively carbonation and a light body. Its light and refreshing with a bitter moreishness.

Bottle. It poured a murky brown with a frothy ivory head. The aroma has dark fruit - raisins, cherries, and plum - with apricot, Belgian yeast, and spices. It has an astringent finish, but overall is a very nice ale.

Aroma is more yeasty than malty. The head was good, but not as large as I expected. The flavor is extremely smooth with one of the best finishes I have ever experienced. More drinkable than I expected, I could have a few of these.
75cl bottle feom Carrefour. Hazy brown/red with a small head. Yeast, bread, light spicy aroma. Flavor is not as complex as I expected to be. Notes of bread, yeast, sweet.

backlog

smell is dark fruits and some yeasty notes. Taste is the same with nice carbonation.
Ottina birra. Per me una delle birre più equilibrate nel suo genere. Anche facile da bere.

Chimay Rouge

With a clickerty clack I swizzle my BBbarfly bottle opener into action and as the top pops there's a momentary fine mist. Already a hint of what is to come the malty fragrance begins its charm. As I pour the hissing fluid a foamy one finger white head forms and is soon spent and settles to a gossamer layer. I hold it to the light and inspect it's hazy mahogany hue that has the look of a quality merlot. 

Gently swirling the goblet I further release the redolent richness. There is nothing overpowering, the complex aromas need time to flood the nose... mmmm malty sweet fruits hints of raisins, cherries bread yeast and is that alcohol or spice?

Imbibing the libation brings your attention to its medium body and with just enough carbonation to send the feel and flavours of the warming fluid around the mouth. Yes! Cherish that cherry note, revel in the raisins and mellow maltiness. The follow through gives a hint of herbs and slight tingling on the tongue. A balanced beverage that intrigued and passed a pleasant moment.

Vintage 2015 - Drafted with the fizzics. Hazy brown with thick white head. Clean malty nose with hints of liquorice and caramel. Taste is strong liquorice and herbal subtones. Finish is mainly malty... Great wins with time...

33 cl. bottle (purchased from Rind Liquor Store, Kadıköy). A bit hazy dark amber/copper coloured with a nice beige head. Good lacing. A bit yeasty aroma consists of dried fruits, caramel, toffee. Some orange flavour in taste. It is mostly sweet, a bit bitter and a bit sour. Silky mouthfeel is superb. This beer has indeed very pleasant taste and palate. It is medium to full bodied and creamy textured. Carbonation is average. Slightly bitter dry finish. A beer to return to. Very nice.

Bottle from Auchan. Pours hazy copper, with a nice beige head. Aroma is filled with malts, brown bread, dried apricots. Full body, thick and crisp. Taste is malts, dark fruits. Also sensing a bit of hops, which make it spicy. After a 10 minute rest, you get a flavor of sticky candy. Some yeast also present in the end. Finish is dry and dusty. Taste is enriched by the warmth of the alcohol. Good, complex.

Butelka 330ml. Ciemno-brunatny kolor. Piana obfita,palona,,opada powoli. Rodzynkowo-drozdzowy aromat ,suszone owoce i karmelowa slodycz w aromacie. W smaku ciemne suszone owoce, slody ,drozdze, rodzynki,karmel. Dosc slodkawe o dobrze ukrytym alkoholu.

A bottle from Jasons near NCCU, drunk at home. Aroma: bready and malty, with some grass. Appearance: poured at room temperature, head was gigantic - settled to 2-3mm. of tan lacing. An inviting, cloudy brown. Palate: full-bodied and thick, average carbonation, long, complex finish. Taste: bitter predominates, malt is always present. Another good one.

Colore ramato. Schiuma fine e persistente.
 Gusto fruttato e lievemente tostato. Carbonatazione abbastanza vivida. Rimane al palato abbastanza dolce. Un ottima birra

33cl bottle.
Poured dark with a reddish shine, white dense head.
Aroma is malty, light caramel, dried fruits.
Taste is malts as well, caramel, but some fruits in the end again.
Soft mouthfeel, soft balanced taste.
Botella de 33cl. Aromas a levadura y malta. Cuerpo medio y ligero amargor. Final seco y persistente. De las buenas. Para repetir

Beer with taste and remarkable. THE brown Ale Chimay is one of the very traditional Trappist beers makers. Everyone has to try 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dubbel dAbbaye brune limite rousse transparente, bien claire, avec une mousse ivoire stable et fine sur 5mm tout au long de la dégustation. Le nez est superbe, dominé par un malt caramel de haute volée avec des notes de chocolat au lait et de miel. Le fruit nest pas en reste avec de beaux arômes de pomme cuite, dabricot, de fraise, de mûre, de pêche, des notes de poire, de raisin sec, de banane, de pruneau mais aussi de cannelle et de vanille. En bouche, bonne carbonatation, un bon houblon aromatique (Hallertau comme spécifié, donc très classique mais diablement efficace), très bonne arrière-bouche sur les céréales blondes, la texture est souple et moelleuse, typique des Dubbel (et Doppel Allemandes dailleurs), lalcool est au niveau sans que ce ne soit non plus extase, tandis que lamertume est finement exécutée, bien dans léquilibre. Le final un peu plus mince par contre, mais la longueur est bonne et sarticule sur grande levure bien droite, noble. Une excellente Dubbel avec tout ce quil faut de qualité(s). Après rien ne me renverse réellement, mais cest une bière gourmande qui ne redemande quune seule chose : à être bue une deuxième fois, une troisième fois, une quatrième fois etc. Cest ce quon appelle un classique ! Bouteille 75cl, V&B Grenoble.
Earthy aromas and malty. Nice carbonation as well as head retention. Peach ruby-like colour.
Bottle at home. Pours clear, dark ruby with frothy white foam. Aromas of yeast, fruit, light caramel. Spicy and quite dry. Slightly acidic, with lively carbonation. Sweet and ok hoppy. Good.

The foam is porous. Colour dark ruby, like a strong tea. In aroma and taste pleasant of yeast, fruits, something of dried apricots and a little hop. Not as cool as the bleue, but is still very decent.

330ml. bottle in The Beer House, Vientiane, Laos. Pours a cloudy copper colour. Aroma of fruit, yeast and hops. Slightly acidic. Spicy and fairly well carbonated. A bitter finish but the balanced flavours make this an excellent brew.

Off white creamy head stayed well on a murky walnut coloured body.
Malty, tobacco & candy aroma.
Medium to thin body. Creamy. well carbonated. very airy. Dry on the aft.
Malt, caramel, demarara sugar - but not too its not sweet, toffee & yeast.

Pours hazy, brown colour with small, beige head. Aroma is fruity, plums, caramel, spicy. Really pleasant. Taste is malty, especially caramel, then some fruity notes. Low bitterness, medium body. High carbonation. Balanced taste, which is neither too dry, nor too sweet. Some light alcohol in the end. Im really impressed how Abbey Dubbels are tasteful and complex.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017 Pours a lovely hazed brown topped by a fluffy off-white head. Smells of sweet clove and honey and maybe a touch of banana. Taste starts out surprisingly dry, the Hallertaus offsetting the Belgian sweetness with a medicinal undertone. Fruits show up as it warms, giving up fig and dried apricot and honey-slathered toast, yet the pilsner malts maintain a firm bottom line. Hefeweisen bananaclove eventually pops up, and the finish seems both too bitter and too sweet. Not my favorite Trappist ale, but drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2017 Gran cerveza de abadía. Un aroma interesante aunque demasiado suave. Una apariencia espectacular. Color marrón oscuro con una espesa espuma de color amarillento que se mantiene constante. Un sabor suave pero intenso que mezcla lo dulce con lo amargo. Tiene notas de café y caramelo. Y posee un paladar amargo que convence.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text: Prima dubbel, met een hartige pilssmaak, gecombineerd met wat rood fruit en kandij. Aroma is fruitig en zoet.

Very welcoming aromas of fruit, figs, freshly baked cookies, spices. Heavy on the carbonisation, but its fine bubbles and essential to the balance. Pronounced fig flavours. Plums, raisin bread, yeast. Pretty striking and characteristic. Excellent. Could be really stunning if the sweetness were slightly less.

Aroma is dark fruit, spice, woody, yeast, dry, maybe some clove. Appearance is reddish brown, light tan, almost off white head, hazy. Taste is spice, clove, wood, barrel, dark fruit, raisins, booze, eh. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, woody boozy spicy aftertaste. Overall, its not as balanced as I expected, which is unfortunate because theyre usually spot on.

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma media grana beige persistente, colore ambrato carico, al naso malto speziata, in bocca malto e caramello, carbonatazione media, leggero amaro e buon corpo, lalcool è ben bilanciato, dolce e buona persistenza nel finale. Chimay, una storia, una garanzia.

Bottle. BB date Dec 2011; Drank Jun 2008.  Reddish-brown in colour. Fruity (dark fruits, raisins, plums, apple). Malty (caramel, toffee, honey, hint of chocolate). Spicy (cinnamon). Yeasty (lots of floaties and sediment). Well hopped. Quite dry. Tasty, mellow, spicy, subtly fruity, yeasty, slightly sweet beer with smooth finish. Very drinkable, especially for ABV. Nice beer! (2010-01)
Vöröses-barna szín, illata átlagos. Komplex sör, amelyben az ízek harmóniája érvényesül. Megjelenik benne a komlós keserűsége, ugyanakkor némi vaníliás édesség is jelen van. Kiváló trappista sör.

0.33 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with lovely Anja. Murky amber to brownish, lasting creamy off-white head. Light dry fruits, honey, sugars and light yeasty. Spicy, toasty and biscuit flavor. Medium body, warming, alcohol hidden, bit light. No major flaws, although some compromising.
330 ml bottle from Colruyt. Malty caramel aroma with a slightly bitter finish. Aftertaste is nice, but not intense. Medium carbonation. Fine palate. Good Dubbel, more character than Chimay Bleu.
Nice all round beer, dark copper colour, small creamy head, fruity flavour, smooth and silky

Bière trappiste brune. Un arôme de grillé, torréfié, pas mousseuse. Dun brun assez trouble, elle garde bien ce goût de grillé au goût, et reste pétillante malgré son manque de mousse. Elle na pas cette amertume de la bière brune traditionnelle. Cest une bonne bière pour découvrir les brunes et les trappistes. Je recommande
poured from bottle reddish brown with a fluffy off-white head and lacing. The aroma is cherry, and alcohol. The taste cherry, raisin, and wine.

Barwa rubinowo brunatna, z bia??, puszyst? pian?, wysok? i bardzo trwa??.
W aromacie g?ównie ciemne owoce, s?odkie wi?nie i czere?nie, w tle delikatnie ?liwki. Po ogrzaniu do przodu wychodz? nuty ziemiste, piwniczne.
Smak: tutaj ponownie owoce, nie tak s?odkie, jest lekka wytrawno??, ponownie nuty ziemiste, a na finiszu odrobina lukrecji. Goryczka niezbyt wysoka, ?rednio d?uga, w charakterze zio?owo piwniczna.
Nasycenie wysokie, szybko powoduje uczucie syto?ci.

Bottle. Copper. Huge head that dissolves rather quickly. Aroma is subtle. Malts, sweet nuts, dark fruits and a some yeasty bananas. Taste is fruity, sweetish, malty, nutty and brrady. A hint of belgian yeast. Finish is bitter and a tad bit sour. Medium to strong carbonation. Spritzy and creamy at the same time. Dangerously drinkable. Very balanced.
One of my all time favorites. Perfectly balanced , nice appearance with its creamy foam. Long lasting aftertaste that remains the same and slowly fades away.

Tipica trappista, "never disappoints"! Colore intenso, schiuma corposa. Si nota da subito un odore fruttato che si riscontra anche nel sapore, ben equilibrato con un retrogusto amarognolo. Davvero buona.
taste was strong. cloudy buthe it was a cold temperature. but not over strong and goodl colour

The beer which I hold over all others. From the aroma of first opening the bottle- buy the larger bottle with the cork- The sublime smell that brings peace to mind. Allowing it to breathe for the briefest of moments, pouring slowly into the appropriate glass and smell the mild fruity aroma ( i disagree with the apricot I.D., but I have no words to fit the description)The copper tinted beer pours well into the glass- collaring a perfect head of just-off-cream colored (and textured) froth. The fast is balanced- beginning with a sweetish malty-ness and ending with just the briefest bitter. I search out this bottle wherever I shop, and when its been too long- demand it. Worth the cost. Worth the experience.

Bottle at Den Engel, Leek. Pours a slightly hazy deep amber colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma of red fruits, cherry, apricot, some blackcurrant, slight Belgian yeast, a little brown sugar and subtle wood. Taste of red fruits, cherry, Belgian yeast, some bready malts, slight metal, a little brown sugar and subtle spice. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, subtly yeasty, fruity bitterness in the finish. Not what I was expecting, a lot fruitier than a regular dubbel. Subtle metallic hint is a put off but its so drinkable and light for a 7%er. Decent.
Dimmig brun öl med beige skum. Doft av kryddig jäst, mörka frukter, banan, karamell och honung. Maltighet och viss beska tillkommer i smaken.
Drank the Premiere with meal of cold and smoked meats, a perfect accompaniment. It is all you could expect from Chimay. Only down was too much foam at the recommended temperature.

7% ABV. Belgian ale.

Poured out amber. 16°SRM.

Nose is Belgian with dusty wood and stone dust. Mothballs. Not unpleasant but just for me so "Belgian".

Mouthfeel is beery. Palate is nutty with chestnuts and acorns, wheat toast with light honey. Palate is bready with wheat bread coming to the fore the most obviously.

Finish is alcohol then sweet then off.

Little stone dust bitter with a hint of raw minerality.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours reddish brown with a fluffy off-white head and lacing. The aroma is toast, cherry, and alcohol. The taste is toast, cherry, raisin, and wine. Its pretty smooth. This is good but overrated and a bit overpriced.
Not sure why this a top 50 dubbel. Not actively unpleasant, but inoffensive to the point of bland: A Belgian from central casting
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this. Thought it would be a gung-ho power show of a beer but it was actually very subtle and easy to drink. Over the course of an evening this would make it extremely dangerous. Smells of red wine abound, a beautiful full and smooth palate with lovely tastes of blackcurrant and fruity malt.
Butelka 330 ml. Słba piana, szybko opada się i rozrywa. Barwa brunatna. Aromat drożdżowy. W smaku pełne, ale nie do końca, czuć alkohol, ale nie do przesady.
Prima dubbel, mooi donker, fris door de koolzuur, vol van smaak: mout, wat gedroogd fruit en een tikje chocola

Lockerer aber cremiger Schaum der lange anhält
Nussbraun(gleich wie Flasche)
Feine süssliche Note un leicht austrocknend
Ganz am Schluss minim bitter auf der Zunge

Miedziane z białą pianą, która dość szybko się redukuje. Aromat słabo intensywny, toffi, karmel, rodzynki, trochę estrów, cukierków. Dość słodkie, estrowe, z niską goryczką. Wysokie nasycenie, niska pełnia. Rozczarowujące, niewiele się dzieje.
Pours amber with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of caramel, ripe apple, raisins, toffee. Taste is malry and sweet with roasted notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Poured from 330ml bottle in France with massive big foamy head and medium retention. Appearance is a deep brown amber and murky. Aroma is sweet, complex, and a bit boozy; very interesting. Tastes like a Belgian triple but a shade sweeter and very slightly gassy.
The beer even when warmed up suffers from a lack of complexity its Triple sweet but not much else. Wouldnt bother drinking it again

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Malty caramel and dried fruit (plum, raisins). Sweet, fruity and malty. Very high carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 Taste caramel malty, some licorice, not as "warm" as its blue cousin but more sweetish and fruity ( dark ones ), dominated by the high carbonation and some un-subdued alcohol though. Expected more of it.
Bottle - reddish brown, slight ting on tongue and in mouth. Strength hits you straight away, fruity, slightly too sweet. Another Belgium to sip
Arômes de caramel, mousse blanche, robe marron trouble. En bouche, caramel, un peu damertume, pain. Beaucoup de corps et bien balancée.

Bottle 330 ml, Bucharest, at Bistro GUXT, poured in Chimays special glass.

Nice dark copper color, rich foamy white head withgood retention and lacing.
Aroma is caramel with a touch of honey, raisins, apricots, flowers. Hints of spices, biterness, bread, some nuttyness. No alcohol in the aroma.

Taste is mirroring the aroma: caramel, discrete bitterness, fruits, flowers, spices. Nice integration of the alcohol.
Dry aftertaste with fruity and some acid and mineral hints.

Medium carbonation and body. Mouthfeel is velvety and warm, really pleasant.

A good example of dubbel style. Well balanced, complexe, tasty.

Butelka 330 ml. Wybitna piana, bardzo obfita, zostawia takiż lacing. Barwa brunatna. Aromat drożdżowy. W smaku pełne, ale nie do końca, czuć alkohol, ale nie do przesady. Chyba gorszy z klasztornych Chimayów.
Pours a nice bronze/copper color with a significant head (into a tulip glass). The aroma is a bit fruity and the taste is sweet w without being overdone. Chimay always delivers!
Aroma: fruit, bread. Dark brown with medium head. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Heavy body. Long finish.
Denne brown ale har et lidt uklart brunt udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en sød mørkere maltet aroma og smager deraf med karamel og noter af chokolade. Medium karbonering.

Thanks to whoever posted the most rated beers thread made me realize plenty of easy ticks still left that I always assumed I rated. Ruby colored fine thick head. Nose is toffee and flowery. Tastes of toffee, malt, yeast, flowers. Decent carbonation alcohol not noticeable.
Endnu en god øl fra Chimay men fortrækker dog den blå... Men bestemt ikke dårlig Brown Alish...

Koperkleurig, troebel, licht crèmekleurige romige schuimkraag, veel koolzuur langs het glas. 
Aroma: Fruitige geur van rood fruit en bessen. Kruidnagel, licht gebrande mouten en banaan en kruidigheid uit de gist.
Smaak: Donker fruit en daarvan zoetig, kruidig als kruidnagel en peper, tikje wrang/zuur wat wel eens vanuit de gist zou kunnen komen.
Medium body, redelijk actief Koolzuur, afdronk is kruidig en licht bitter met een tikje warmte.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2017 W aromacie fenole, drożdże, rodzynki, figi, zbożowo, przyjemnie. W wyglądzie czerwień wpadająca w brąz, solidna beżowa piana, zdobiąca szkło. W smaku całkiem wytrawnie, owocowo, lekko rozgrzewająco - alkoholowo, nieco wodniście, pijalnie, wyczuwalne drożdże, do tego zbożowość, całość ładnie ułożona. Ogólnie solidny dubbel, bardzo fajnie ułożony ale też nie będący jakąś petardą.
Dimmigt brunorange med tjockt beigevitt skum. Doftar torkad frukt och lite halm. Smaken fyllig och söt. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång med vinösa toner på slutet.

Bottles over the years, first tried in 2008. Pours a dark amber brown color with medium head that didnt hang out too long. Notes of Raisins, plum, fig, oak, and cherry marzipan. Ultra warming in the chest. Good Belgian but prefer the blue.
caramel, toast, citrus, banana, amber, sparkling, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium sweetness,

33cl-fles in les Zytholoog in Syntra te Kortrijk. U: Lichtwazig bruin met beige schuimkraag. G: Karamel, zoethout, banaan, appel en peer. S: Gedroogd fruit, kruiden, banaan en een lichte hint van chocolade en wat koffie. Een goede dubbel, maar dubbels zijn voor mij net niet uitgesproken genoeg. M: Zwakke carbonatie en medium body.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Bouteille versée dans un beau calice. Look cuivrée avec une mini-mousse légèrement onctueuse. Arômes discrets de noix, de fruits séchés. En bouche, micro-effervescence plutôt prononcée. Goût discret de grains et de dattes. Une amertume un brin ferreuse, ça je pourrais m?en passer... en tout et pour tout, une dubbel bien correcte. Sans plus.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung). ziemlich klares Rotbraun im Glas mit mächtiger Schaumkrone. Malzig, ohne süß zu wirken, im Antrunk. Vielleicht etwas überbewertet.
A sweet sugared Trappist. Taste of dark malts, yeast and sugar. Bit fruity and light dry bitter finish.
Light and sweet malted body with ester and floral notes, kind of a bitter head

Large 750ml bottle acquired at Surdyks (I think). Shared with commonshawn and samadouche. Moeder Lambic. Cloudy and gives the appearance of sediment. A lighter brown color with a hint of copper/amber. Nose has a hint of traditional Belgian dark fruits you want from a dubbel. Taste is a near perfect rendition of the style. Notes of raisin and a slight tart characteristic. Pleasant sweetness working well with a big alcohol presence towards the end. Great mouthfeel. This is basically as good as it gets for a dubbel.

Pours a cloudy, brownish dark amber with a huge, frothy beige head. Aroma of grapes, dark berries, pepper, belgian yeast, slightly nutty, raisins, caramel malts, hints of alcohol, brown sugar. Taste is light to medium sweetness, lightly sourish, almost no bitter notes present. Body is malty, creamy, but feels almost light. Bubbly, fizzy carbonation. 
Great balance of aromas that just fit very well together with a beer that, for its weight, feels light. Carbonation is kinda fizzy, but works for the malts. Good, very good.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Bottle at home. Pours light brown with large off-white head. Aroma is roasty with yeast, booze and nuts. Taste is quite light malts with some wood. Quite carbonated.

Yellow/brown/red complex, cloudy color with finely textured and creamy white head
A small bite on the tip of the tongue, with tingling acidity, but cleans up in the middle through end
Moderate weight, with a long delicate finish
Flavors of cedar, spices, apricot, grapefruit, and a touch of honey

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle. Brown with an off-white head. Dark fruity notes of raisin and date persuasion, earthy, spicy, brown sugar. Not particularly sweet. Very good dubbel that I waited far too long to try.
Murky copper to brown coloured, small tan head. Aroma of honey and caramel. Taste is slightly hoppy, fruits and caramel, higher than average carbonization, silky mouthfeel. Well balanced. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours is amber to brown with big off-white head. Sweet, floral aroma, peach, peach, plum, dried dark fruits. Taste is light to moderate sweet, fruity mouthfeel. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.
Lovely dubbel. Pale ruby pour with a big frothy off-white head. Plenty of bready, yeasty, dried-fruity, Belgiany goodness. Reasonably light bodied, and very drinkable.

Bottle. Hazy dark amber in colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dried fruits. Taste follows it, the beer is medium sweet, bready-caramel like. Medium body, carbonation above average, finish is sweetish and bit spicy. Nice.

33cl bottle. Pours copper brown, slightly hazy, with a small long lasting creamy beige head. Aroma: fruity, yeast, wheat, some mild spices. Taste: as the aroma, slightly sweet fruit, caramel, yeast/wheat, mild spice, tiny hint of alcohol, bitter finish. Silky smooth mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbonation. Surprisingly drinkable much more so than Bleue, so I actually enjoyed this one a little more.

A really classy and tasty beer. Highly recommendable.A fine hazed caramel/nutty color with a fine tan head. The head never gives up. Looks really nice. Good intensity in the aroma. Nice round and mellow sweetness and just a bit to high carbonation. But the carbonation level did not mess it up. Fresh and easy to drink.Toffee, some dried fruits, mild spices and some yeast in the flavor. Well masked alcohol. Ok complexity. Well done![Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Norway]
Nice appearance, discrete aroma as is the taste. It lacks of persistence and doesnt excite.

Bottle. Pours brown with pale tan head. The aromas are mostly caramel, fruity and some cinnamon-like spiciness too, yeast. In mouth, a slight alcoholic feel, although not overpowering, high carbonation with yeasty and spicy flavours. The texture is thin and oily, with a medium to full body, somewhat short finish with some lingering bitterness. OK.
Bottle. Color: Taste: Medium sweet. Lightly roasted malts, little sweetness. Hints of red fruit, chocolate and plums. Bitter earthy finish.

Aged bottle. Not sure how long but at least 3 years. Some oxidation is present in aroma (wet cardboard) and a bit in the flavor but still drinkable. Probably past its best. Taste is of caramelly malts, brown sugar and dark fruity esters. Body has thinned out a bit and carbonation is low for a Belgian of this style. But bitterness and expected astringency is right on and there is no harshness present. In appearance the only thing different is the thinner and rapidly dissipating off white head.

Belle robe marron clair avec mousse peu persistante.
Arômes subtiles de prunes et fruits secs.....La saveur est très équilibrée entre lamertume,lacidité et la douceur que cette Chimay laisse en arrière bouche.
Excellente bière trappiste!

Goûtée dans un verre neutre "tulipe".
Robe brune avec une belle mousse persistante.
Le nez est sur les fruits secs et la prune.
Le goût est à la hauteur avec une balance idéale entre douceur/amertume/acidité et des saveurs légèrement épicées.
La finale est longue et renforce limpression dharmonie.
Une grande bière trappiste.
16.5/20

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Color marrón medianamente claro, turbio, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación presente, sin pasarse. Aroma frutal e incluso floral, muy fresco. Invita a meter la nariz una y otra vez en la copa. El sabor viene de la malta (no capto nada de lúpulo), incluso se percibe muy mínimamente un regusto a tostado. Afrutada. Toque mínimo de amargor (el justo para que la cerveza no pueda ser denominada como dulce). La carbonatación en boca es muy placentera. Otro acierto de Chimay.
Butelka, ten czerwony towarzysz był znośny w tej trójce, ale czegoś tu brakowało, najsłabszy alkoholowy z trójki, owocowy aromat.

The aroma of yeast, Mazarin, grass and dried fruit. The taste is alcohol, yeast, dried fruit and lightly fruity. Very carbonic acid. Decent bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Difficult to drink because of its alcohol taste. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Bière brune, mousse beige, rien a voir avec la Chimay Bleu. Cest une bière forte Belge. A tester quand même.

My favourite Belgian - this beer never disappoints. Beautiful copper colour and creamy head gives off light fruit notes with a promise of something almost plumb-like underneath. The taste is complex but finishes clean.

Deep cloudy brown color with an amber hue, and a powerful amount of activity. Slightly creamy and frothy beige 3 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, making a good amount of legs. Flavors of ester fruits like pears and apples, dark fruits like plums, yeasty, coriander, clove, molassy, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Smooth slick medium body with champagne like carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with a faint smoky molassy feel, thick fruity and bitter yeasty tongue coat, with lingering oaky barrel aged and grassy feel. Overall this is a very good craft with tasty flavors and a quality finish that I find better and more complex than the other Chimays. Good freshness and a well balanced rich sugary taste, yet quite dry and bitter with a strong boozy vinous feel.
Cloudy amber liquid,big white foam. Yeast and slightly fruity aroma. Watery with soft carbonation. Nice bitterness.

Pours a deep bronze with a thick long lasting beige head that leaves lacing. Nose is toast, spice, fruit. Taste is dried fruit. Bosy is medium-thick. Very little bitter aftertaste. 11.2 oz bottle Bring back the 12 oz bottles, use cans.

medium and sweetish aroma - fermented fruits, overripe peach/apricot, flowers, honey, honeycomb.
medium and very fruity taste - overripe and juicy peach, honey, lot of flowers, springlike herbs, some cherries with alcohol, some corn juice with hop bitterness.
good!

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Pours clear deep amber with a huge beige head. Nose of spice, smoke, toast, yeast, caramel. Medium sweet with some light sourness to back it up, very light spicy bitterness on finish. High carbonation, medium body, a bit of alcoholic warmth on finish, some stickiness. A lovely dubbel, but there are better ones.

AppearancePours a murky orange brown, even though it had been sitting in the fridge for a month, with a thin, bubbly and weak off-white head that disappears quickly 
Aroma Cooked vegetables, bread, liquorice, medicinal herbs, alcohol, acetone 
Taste Very sweet, no bitterness. 
Palate Watery, thin and fizzy.
Nice red beer. A bit to much CO2 in the one I tasted. A beer you can drink every day.

[backlog] 19-01-16 / bottle bought in Belgium, drank at home. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 3.5/5

Aroma: malt a bit chocolate.
Appearance: dark brown color, minimal head.
Taste: malt, caramel.
Palate: medium body, minimal carbonation.

From a small bottle into a Rodenbach Grand Cru stem glass. Pours brown with significant head and lace. Aroma of grains and roasty malts. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich malts, grains, minerals, caramel, tropical fruit rind, powder sugar, Overall rich, flavorful...not my favorite Chimay fresh or aged, but respectable.

Have tasted this one many times before, but surprisingly never rated it. Pours caramel colored with abundant creamy foam. It is indeed a Chimay, with aromas of caramel, toffee and butterscotch and a first taste brings them to the front. It is a mouthful, creamy and rich, thick like an ice cream soda. 

This is a great beer.

Bottle (750 ml). Ruby-brown color with light tan head. Some raisin aroma. Plums and raisins followed by cherry notes. Chewy mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Pours clear mahogany with a large beige head. Smells of dark fruits and caramel. Taste is sweet fruits, hints of caramel. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and lively mouth-carbonation, Chimay Rouge (Première) finishes with a bready yeastiness.

19/08/2016 - 33cl bottle @ Eenvoudig Bestaan, Kerkhove.
Redbrown with nice white head. Nose is dark malts, caramel. Taste is dark malts, caramel, raisins, some roast, bit sourness, light bitter ending. Perfectly balanced, but complex.
Apricot and fresh baked bread aromas. Taste is fresh bread, apricot, raisin skin, and honey; all with a tingly mouthfeel.
330ml bottle, very lively. Dark, reddish brown with a foamy beige head. Slightly sour, fruity aroma, flavour is caramel and fruit cake. Good, but not my favourite dubbel

330ml bottle. Pours dark hazy copper color with big/medium white head. Aroma is a bit sour/fruity - apricot. Taste is sweet with a light aftertaste of bitterness. Great body, fine texture and carbonation, well balanced.

Bottle 
Aroma-floral
Appearance-dark amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly sour, medium bitterness, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Tummanpunaruskea olut poreilevalla paksulla, mutta kohtalaisen nopeasti häviävällä vaahdolla. Tuoksu hiivainen ja hieman mausteisen hedelmäinen. Maku pehmeä, hiilihappoinen, hedelmäinen ja mausteinen. Keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma. Hieno olut, vaikkei toki ihan Bluelle pärjääkään. Makua saisi olla hieman enemmän, ehkä tämä on hieman yksiulotteinen olut.
Not the best and no where near as tasty as the triple they produce. Would not buy it if i did not have to. Pours dark brown and very mild hops taste
I was not amazed, but it was decent. An honest beer I would not buy but would not object to drinking.
Bottle, 330 ml at Beertija, Zagreb. Pours brown with reddish haze, small beige head. Caramel malty, some yeasty notes, dried fruit. Moderate sweetness. Smooth. Medium body. Nice.
Dark brown color with dense beige head. Nice aroma of fruits, raisins, bananas and little spices. Taste is smooth, continues the line with the aroma. Light bitter, silky finish. Awesome stuff!
Redelijke trappistenbier. Karamel achtige smaak met een afdronk die veel minder lang blijft hangen als die van de blauwe Chimay.

Caramel, touche de levure belge épicée et fruitée, corps moyen tout comme son effervescence en bouche, beau col, facile à boire. Rien dexceptionnel, mais très bien équilibrée et ne présentant pas de défaut.

De la Abadía de Nuestra Señora de Scourmont(BEL) esta Chimay Premiere o mejor conocida como Chimay Rougue una cerveza fabricada o monitoreada por los monjes Trapistas de dicha abadía ubicada en la región de Chimay en Belgica,  Chimay Rouge es una cerveza de estilo Abbey Dubbel con un 7% ABV, para que un producto se considere trapense debe de cumplir con ciertos rubros, se debe fabricar dentro del monasterio o en sus inmediaciones, la producción debe de tener la participación monástica o por lo menos estar supervisada por ellos, por ultimo la producción se debe de enfocar a la subsistencia del mismo monasterio y las necesidades básicas de los monjes, las ganancias sobrantes son destinadas a diversas obras de caridad, estas normas son reguladas por la Asociación Internacional Trapense que es una institución creada por los mismos monasterios para regular y otorgar el sello ATP(Authentic Trapist Product) que garantiza la autenticidad y procedencia del mismo producto, actualmente hay 11 cervecerías trapenses, de esas, 6 se ubican en Bélgica, las demás se reparten en Italia, Holanda, Austria y E.U.A., su popularidad y buena reputación se a disparado puesto que se a denominado a la Westvleteren 12 como la mejor cerveza del mundo, esta se fabrica en la Abadía de San Sixto ubicada en Belgica.
Las cervezas trapenses y en general las cervezas Belgas se caracterizan por una generosa corona de espuma y excelente retención y esta Chimay no es la excepción, de perlas muy compactas con una tonalidad arena, el color del liquido es un cobrizo profundo lleno de turbiedad con una amplia de destellos rojizos, el cuerpo se puede apreciar de forma plena en las paredes del cristal donde se sirva.
El aroma es complejo de principio a fin, lo principal es un dulzor excéntrico de azúcar no procesada, caramelos, ligeras notas a granos tostados, muy frutal, se aprecian notas a pasas, dátiles, fenoles a manzana, especias como pimienta, mas ligeramente un carácter herbales, la intensidad del aroma en general es muy bueno.
El sabor es igualmente que el olor, tiene un poco de todo, lo principal es un dulzor muy fuerte parecido al de la azúcar morena que acompaña de inicio a fin el trago, nuez tambien muy perceptible, pasas y frutos secos, ligeros toques de manzana, especiada considerablemente mas parecido el carácter a la pimienta y clavo, jerez, el alcohol hace presencia y aunque no es tan fuerte(7% ABV) la levadura potencializa esta característica, siendo es una cerveza muy dulce al final proporciona una sequedad inesperada, me parece de las cervezas y estilos mas auténticos y complejos.
Kuparinen tuoksu, makea tahmea, maltainen. Hapokas ja hedelmäinen jälkimaku. Kerta kaikkiaan hieno.
Roodbruin, beetje troebel bier . Aroma is kruidig. Smaak is beetje caramelachtig en ietsje bitter. Smaak ebt snel weg.

Ein Feuerwerk. A real Dubbel Masterpiece. Unwiderstehlich in vielen Momenten, malzig, trockenobstig und mit viel belgischer Hefearomatik gesegnet, haben wir es hier mit einem echten Knospenspalter zu tun. Wow, da kann man zwischen den Schlückchen ruhig mal ein Päuschen einlegen. Der Trunk ist extrem aufregend und vielseitig. Süß und scharf trocken, natürlich in säuberlich zerteilten Abschnitten präsentiert. Achterbahn!!!!! Fläschen für unter eins fünfzig aus einem belgischen Supermarkt.
Közepes hab, sokáig megmarad. Testes, savas, alapvetően komlós, fűszeres íz, kis gyümölcsös mellékízzel, közepes kesernyésséggel.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón con algunos destellos cobrizos a contraluz, se observa ligeramente turbia y cierta actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color beige de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas.

AROMA: destaca mucho la levadura belga, notas especiadas como clavo y pimienta, además azúcar no procesado, ligeramente caramelo, nueces, así como frutos rojos y oscuros maduros.

SABOR: al inicio del trago de siente dulce, nuevamente el carácter de la levadura belga bien presente con notas a clavo y ligeramente pimienta, azúcar morena, azúcar no procesado, frutos rojos, frutos oscuros maduros, nueces y un ligero gusto ácido; el retrogusto es seco y nada astringente, ligeramente amaderado.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero casi medio, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: Una buena dubbel trapense.

This beer has a good combination of different sweet aromas (caramel, fruity) and some bitterness (especially in the after-taste). I would reccommend this beer, but I wouldnt say its one of the better Belgian beers.

Colore bruno, schiuma bianca fittissima e persistente. Aroma di malto e cereali. Gusto di malto, caramello, lievemente fruttato e alcolico. Al palato discretamente amara, erbacea, maltata. Abbastanza complessa come gusto e aroma, è bella corposa. Merita unalta valutazione.

Large bottle served in a chalice. (From Nov. 2011 notes)

My favorite Belgian, as of a few years ago, but never rated and not sampled for some years. 

Pours a hazy reddish-brown with a grand, creamy tan head that reduces to a durable top coat. Full lacing washes down the side of the glass with every sip. The head, at least, deserves a 5. 

Plenty of fruity yeast in the nose, with some sweet malt, a hint of tartness, and light notes of cloves and dark fruits. 

T: a tart and fruity dubbel, featuring fig and apricot notes, with a fine balance of sweet, sour and light bitter. Some mild alcohol esters complement rather than detract from the flavor. Hard to criticize, but perhaps a tad more yeasty and earthy than ideal in the finish -- or this can be part of its charm. Improved with some warming.

M - rather lively carbonation, but perfect for the medium-full body. Slight dryness in the finish.

Aroma: malt, caramel, fruit. No hints of hop aroma. Hints of yeast. Hints of citrus and alcohol aromas.
Appearance: deep amber to brown color, hazy. Great thick slightly creamy beige head, with above average retention. 
Taste: medium sweetness, light-to-medium bitter, light sour.
Palate: medium body, average carbonation, 
Overall: very nice appearance with great color and head. Great fruity aroma and nice maltiness-sweetness-caramel flavour balanced with an interesting citric touch. Long medium bitterness finish. Good interesting beer.

Cor âmbar escuro com tonalidade caramelo e um pouco turva; espuma bege, cremosa, de altas formação e persistência com excelente lacing.
Aroma de frutas secas e nozes, delicado aroma floral, de pão e álcool.
Sabor de frutas secas e nozes com final picante, amadeirado e de leve amargor; retrogosto amadeirado, adstringente, alcoólico e picante.
Corpo médio e carbonatação média.
Cerveja muito equilibrada e de excelente drinkability apesar do teor alcoólico.

Mahogany color with off-white head. Nice spicy aroma with some estery fruitiness. The taste is awesome with spice, banana and a hint of caramel, very little alcohol. Medium mouthfeel, slightly sweet. Great one.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso appartiene a luppolo e fruttato. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è ragguardevole. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine medie si fa ricordare per il pizzo finale. Laspetto del liquido è opalescente. Il colore è ambrato carico. Il corpo è strutturato ma duttile. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di birra beverina. Il finale è lungo, secco e pulito. In bocca laroma riporta sentori di resina, fiori, pane, frutta, frutta secca e agrumi.
Niezle ale 1,65? bym nie dal za 0.33l. Goryczka, zapach calkiem spoko. Nie wiem co wiecej napisac, wszystko juz chyba zostalo powiedziane.

Hazy brown pour with a thick and fluffy off-white head. Aroma is sweet, slightly alcoholic. Flavor is smooth. Its sweet with some nice caramel and malts. Alcohol is masked. It has a traditional taste. Some fermented fruit at the finish.

Bottle @ Friends/chef. Appearance: pours slightly cloudy copper-brown with good tan soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, bread, brown sugar, light dried fruit and spices. palette: medium yeasty aroma, average to sparkling carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and an oily texture. overall: Nice fruity notes, but not quite the malt profile i was expecting in a dubbel

Pours ruby with delicious creme brulee aroma.  Unfortunately the flavour is quite a bit more bitter than i like, and more bitter than the blue and white chimays. Only hints of the estery trappist goodness. Short finish  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Aroma : fruity clean
 Appearance : Brown thick foam
 Taste : a little sweet bitter fruity malty
 Palate : medium body
 In swiss great belgian beer

(Cas)
Se trata de una cerveza negra bastante turbia que presenta un sabor muy dulce y levemente afrutado. Contrasta bastante con otras cervezas negras ya que en esta predomina el aroma frutal frente a otras en las que el caramelo y/o el café es lo más común (dentro de mi experiencia).

(Gal)
Trátase dunha cervexa negra bastante turbia que presenta un sabor moi doce e levemente afroitado. Contrasta bastante con outras cervexas negras xa que nesta predomina o aroma froital frente a outras nas que o caramelo e/ou o café son os mais comúns (dentro da miña experiencia).

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Świetny dubbel. Barwa morelowa, z lekkimi przebłyskami. Ładna drobnopęcherzykowa piana, która po kilku minutach redukuje się do małej obwódki. Niezbyt intensywny zapach, da się wyczuć morele i rodzynki, w tle majaczą nieokreślone przyprawy. 
W smaku festiwal suszonych owoców, dalej przyprawy, delikatna słodycz i w posmaku rodzynki i dobrej jakości tytoń. Do tego idealnie dopasowane wysycenie. 
Świetny dubbel.

Butelka 330ml (12.2020). Piwo zmętnione o miedzianej barwie. Piana w kolorze ecru jest bardzo obfita, drobna o kremowej konsystencji, trwała a opadając oblepia niemal całe szkło. Aromat delikatny z nutami owocowymi, karmelowymi, suszonych owoców, delikatnymi nutami fenolowymi w tle. W smaku owocowo-tostowe, ciut karmelowe z nutami suszonych owoców. Sredniotreściwe, delikatnie słodkie z wyraźnym wytrawnym, ciut alkoholowym, winnym finiszem. Piwo jest dość wysoko wysycone niemniej całkiem gładkie w odczuciu z dobrze ukrytym alkoholem, który tylko nieznacznie rozgrzewa od środka.
Ikke den bedste af Chimay, men en god intens smag, let brændt og middel humlet.

330 ml bottle. Pours brown with a large beige head. Aroma is rather faint - yeasty and fruity. Medium to full body and quiet lively carbonation with an alcoholic feel. The taste starts moderately sweet with some bitterness and fruity acids coming in in the finish. Pretty malty - caramel and notes of dried fruits and honey. Very balanced beer.
For me is one of the best brown beers I had dunk.it doesnt have too much aroma. It has a toast brown colour, just see the beer you want to drink it. The flavour is very, very tastee
Pours hazy red copper with a thick foamy off white head. Fruity malt aroma. Taste is dark fruit, sweet malts and yeast. Very good.

Pours a thick beige head with candy and light hops aromas. Dark Amber to brown colored body. Sweet and long malts in mouth with hints of toasted bread. Perfectly managed balance with quite low alcohol and torte faction. An example 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 0,33l. Nos  gruszka, suszona śliwka, lekka pieprzność, suszony banan, trochę miodowości. Smak  miąższ dojrzałej śliwki, karmel w stylu toffee, lekka owocowa kwaśność, delikatna goryczka chmielowa (ziemista). Znakomicie ułożone, wzorcowy belg.

A nice reddish brown translucent appearance with a thick foam that disappears quickly. Aroma is dominated by the yeast but has lovely notes of some spice, fruits and brown sugar. The taste is a bit one-dimensional but still extremely enjoyable, malts and caramel. Light bitterness in the aftertaste. Scarily easy to drink, will definitely buy again.

Pours a hazy copper-brown, very nice, stable two finger head. Has a yeasty aroma, traces of fruit, caramel malt. A mix in flavor of caramel toffee, dark fruit, something citrusy, definite yeast notes. Some finishing bitterness, a touch dry, slightly high carbonation.

Bottle Ed bought me and I cellared since Sept. 2013. Brown to dark amber, clear, with huge head and good lacing with a off-white head. Aroma is yeasty, toasted, toffee, light fruity. Medium body, low carbonation. Taste is medium sweet, low to medium bitter, texture is oily.
Bottle from market. Light brown color with 1 fingers creamy head. Some malty and yeasty taste but little bitter.
Bottle from local pizza place. Brownish red pour with little head. Thick yeasty nose with light cherry. Taste has the slight sour fruit show through. Tangy. Solid. 14
bottle @ supermarket (brussels) brown colour, heavy body but also silky, tasty bitterness for my mouth. very good belgian beer!
Pours two fingers of head on a cloudy light brown body. Aroma is spices, molasses, earth and a little caramel. Taste is brown sugar, dirt and lemon. Smooth body.
Nice brown colour and tiny bubbles with small white head make this beer very good looking. Even the aroma and caramel sweetness make it good. But its taste is just awsome. Just enough bitter.

Gorgeous brew, deep hazy dark copper pour with ultimate off-white pillow of tiny bubbles. This is how I envision beer. Aroma is malty with some biscuit and caramel. Just a touch of candi sugar sweetness. Flavor is about the same. Probably Im late in the game, but this is not as impressive as Id hoped. Still looking for the best dubbel, but starting to believe this may not be my style as much as I love quads and some (completely different) trips.

Beautiful pour and nice malty aromas. Somewhat of a metallic aftertaste that wasn't very appealing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Hazy brown liquid, small beige head. Lively carbonation. Aroma of malts and yeast, notes of banana and raisin. Medium to heavy sweetness and heavy bitterness. Very good.

On tap. At some point I thought Chimay Blue was the end all be all of beers. Its still a classic and one of the best beers in the world, but somehow I overlooked this dubbel. Beautiful pour, slightly lighter and more transparent than the Blue. Aroma is fragrant apples or peaches with some spice. Extremely smooth beer that is both light yet complex. Silky with notes of raisin, sweet sugar, and minimal yet pleasing bitterness. Fantastic. Chimay is truly one of the best in the world.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2016 I?m not sure which one i prefer between this one and Chimay Blanche (White), but it?s a solid choice for every occasion. Of course this is not as good as the Blue one, but it?s very delectable. Very light aroma of red fruit and that specific Chimay taste that never disappoint. Very cool. APPROVED BY TAVERNY?S BLACK METAL CREW !
Espuma blanquecina compacta y permanente, color ambar cobrizo y bastante turbio, aroma ligero en nariz, sabor donde se combinan tonos dulces con amargos y notas picantes con regusto sabroso
Cerveza de color marrón con una cabeza grande de color blanquecino. Aroma a malta con una gran cantidad de levadura. sabor afrutado con un toque de amargura.Excelente.

Brown hazy beer. Descent head stays. Nice sour, hoppy aroma. SLightly bread and bitter taste. You can feel hops and few notes of honey as well in taste. Medium body, actually quite light. Good beer, but nothing extraordinary.
Copper turbid pour with small off-copper head. Nose of sweet stone fruit, yeast. Taste is sweet with mild tart edge, yeast, vague warm spice, mildly bitter hop finish.

Murky brown colour, average head, dense, no lacing. Aroma is caramel, yeast, dark fruit hints. Taste is dominantly sweet with a caramel malt base, sugar, dark/dried fruit notes. Maybe a slight hint of earthiness. A bit too much on the sweet side for my liking. Medium body, soft mouthfeel,slightly prickly on the tongue. Lacks character
Akkurat TAP snorungarna i sin KIA. Lovande arom tilltalande färg tror tamefan Akkurat diskar glasen pga fin laceing. Chimayarom. Balanserad tilltalande med ett drag av päron och vete i eftersmaken.

330ml bottle @ Estaminet de la Longue Croix, Herdeghem, Belgium. Paired with a speculoos mousse desert and cassonade sugar. Pours deep, hazy copper with off-white head. Aroma is fruity, some spice. This was undoubtedly served too cold so much of the flavours were unfortunately lost on me. However, the spicy fruity yeast and caramel notes did go well with the ginger in the speculoos desert. Will have to re-rate this.

Its good but not amaaazing like so many of the big Belgian names--esp after it warms, the aromatic hop notes are quite strong for the style and some metallic rusty malt elements help to distinguish it from its better cousins

Served in a tulip glass from a 330ml bottle. Hazy ruby colour with diminishing off-white head. Aroma is caramel, bread, yeast, dark fruits and malts. Taste follows the nose very closely: malts, bread, caramel and dark fruits notes, bitter-sweet with a hint of sourness, slightly bitter finish. Medium body with lively carbonation. Not bad but not the best.

Cloudy brown body with a foamy head. Aroma of malts, grains, bread and some caramel and fruits in the background. Taste of caramel, wine, dried fruits and yeast. Medium body with a thick texture, noticable alcohol and soft carbonation.

0,33l bottle. Hazy dark copper/brown colour with shrinking big foamy off-white head. Aroma: Candy sugar, banana, fruits, notes of yeast. Well made. Taste: Sweet malty start with honey, than light bitterness, almost nothing. A bit sour but pleasent and well balanced. Creamy texture, warm feeling. Lively carbonation (surprisingly), medium body. Sweet, slighlty bitter finish. One of the best dubbels.

On tap @Buskers Pub (Rome). Pours deep coppet with a big and persistent off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, toffee, yeasts, esters, fruits. Flavour is unbalanced, very sweet and one-dimensionale, light bitter notes in the end. Medium body, medium carbonation. I expected more...
Tasted a lot like a wheat beer...bananas, caramel etc, but not very sweet at all, unlike a lot of belgian brown beers.

Bruin bier met beige schuimkraag en invallende grote bellen. Geur: moutzoetig, deeg, rijp fruit. Smaak: brood, moutzoetig, kandij. Medium koolzuurprikkel en redelijk volmondig. Afdronk: zoetig met wat bitterig.
Stability, trade, security. When you take a Chimay Judicators secure and always win. The trick, my part is to get a good temperature in order dsfrutar much of a beer fantastic.

World Beer Festival Raleigh It pours brown in color. There area aromas from a good malt base, fruits, and earthly elements. It has flavors of fruit, caramel, and earthly elements from the yeast. It has a dry finish.

Tasted from the 750ML bottle, part of the three pack. Cloudy copper color. Fruit and hops on the nose. Silky creamy mouth. Good hoppy finish. 7%alcohol lends structure to this well balanced Trappist ale. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Brown/red color with tan head, nice balanced malty and carmel aroma. Taste balanced between malt and yeast, sweet. It is a really good beer.

Bouteille de 330 ml

Couleur : Brune ambrée avec une bonne carbonation et une faible effervescence

Arômes : Au nez cest mélasse, alcool, levure belge et raisins secs, et une bonne présence de pommes vertes également.

Goût : En bouche cest pomme verte et caramel. On sent également un petit arrière-goût dépices, ainsi que la levure belge toujours présente.

Appréciation Pas la belge avec la plus grande buvabilité alors quon goûte pas mal lalcool malgré ses 7%. La complexité est toutefois au rendez-vous, avec toute la profondeur des saveurs senties par cette bière.

0,33 bottle. Pours brown/copper color with large white, mostly lasting head. Fruity aroma, bake. Flavor is light sweet, medium bitter. Finish is medium long with warm alcoholic notes. Body is medium, average carbonation.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours hazy brown. Aromas of roasted malts, banana, cloves, resin. Sharp and bitter to taste at first, becomes sweet and malty by end of sip. Feels like I should be tackling it with a knife and fork.

Pours dark amber to brown with a creamy, lasting white head. The aroma contains fruits, malts, yeast, dough and caramel. The taste is less sweet than youd expect, light bitter too. Fruity, dry finish. Medium body and pleasant carbonation. Quite an easy drink. The other Chimays are better and more complex, though.
Bottle. Chestnut color, hazy liquid, tan head. Aroma of raisin, alcohol, oak barrels, whisky. Taste is light medium sweet, medium bitter. Very good, but I have expected more.

aroma bread, malt , little alcohol, herbs
color brown hazy lot bubble
taste light sweet , medium bitter

Muito boa!! Faz juz ao nome. 
De aroma doce e que lembra bastante a cereais. Tem uma delicada doçura no paladar que faz toda a diferença.

Sampled from a bottle the beer poured a cloudy red-brown with a large pillowy ivory head. Once it had died down it left some spidery lacing along the glass. The nose is comprised of malts, caramel, hints of chocolate, fruitcake, and spicy Belgian Yeast. Taste has the same flavour profile with dark fruit, caramel, molasses, a nuttiness and hints of chocolate at the end. The sweetness gives way to light hop bitterness at the finish. The beer is medium bodied with a pleasant creamy and smooth feel. The carbonation is refreshing but not aggressive.

Originally rated on 7/1/08. A deep amber body, almost murky. The head was rather thick and white. There wasnt much aroma, slight hint of fruit. It was sweet and a little spicy flavors of fruit were also present. Well carbonated, thick creamy mouthfeel. Nice warm finish, its worth a try. Although this is a really good beer, I like the other chimays are a little better.
Bottle - Brownish copper color with a small head. My first thought drinking it was - sugar! Some malty, fruity, sour notes as well. High carbonation. Not really my cup of tea.
not for me this one got it from ales by mail beer club dont think i would have it again father in law liked it though

Pours hazy copper brown with average white head with good lacing. Aroma is cereal, cookie, apricot, basement aromas, brown sugar, hint of sulfur. Medium sweet, medium bitter, average long aftertaste. Body is medium, palate is almost creamy, carbonation is average.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2017 Bottle 33. Brune foncé avec beau col blanc "cassé". Nez : chocolat, fruits rouges. La bouche est toastée mais je lui trouve un manque de corps, de caractère et de longueur. Encore un bon produit de Chimay, gage de qualité, mais jai plus de sensations avec "la bleue" et surtout "la blanche" ! Re-rating : superbe bière basée sur les fruits ; je me demande comment je ne lui avais attribué que 3,1 à mon 1er rating ---> réparé
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Sobrevalorada, aunque no está mal. Tiene azúcar añadido. Eso es trampear la cerveza. Cuerpo medio. Buen sabor inicial.

Pours copper colour with frothy 2 finger head. Lovely aroma of cooking apples, dates, slight spice and a little sweetness from the malt. Taste of deep luscious stone fruit, cinnamon apples followed by subtle hop bitterness and a malty sweet finish. Medium body with good carbonation. Beautiful beer.
Not as nice as the Chimay blue, but still very good. One of my favourite belgian breweries.
Je ne sais pas quoi dire...cette bière me laisse perplexe. Au nez la levure, le goût fruité impossible pour moi de savoir quel fruit, un peu de caramel, sinon se nai pas lamertume habituelle....

It pours a red,almost brown body with a one finger off white bubbly head that leaves a ring for quite some time.It smells yeast at first and as it warms dark fruits and caramel imerge.The body is medium with a lot of carbonation.The taste is warm and sweet with fruits,bubblegum,banana.There is a discrete bitterness at the finish which balances the overall sweetness and as it warms the bitterness becomes stronger.The aftertaste is sweet.Overall nice beer ans rather complex.

One of my all time favorites. Best served cool, not cold 10C max. Not sweet like some browns. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heavy yeast in the aroma and a hint of sour. Very pretty dark red color that is almost see through. Fluffy cream colored head. Slightly sweet flavor, slight bubblegum and banana in the background. Very nice palate; the carbonation is spot on. Dubbel is not my style but I still enjoyed this one immensely. Drinkable, definitely worth a try. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle. Hazy brown colour with white unstable consistancy head with bubles. Aroma of yeasts,malt. Taste is sourish at first than caramel sweetness. High carbonisation. Goood

Bottle to tulip. Copper turbid pour with small off-copper head. Nose of sweet stone fruit, yeast. Taste is sweet with mild tart edge, yeast, vague warm spice, mildly bitter hop finish. Prickly carbonation.

Bottle at home. Pours reddish brown with a medium white head. 
Modest aromas of caramel and plum. Hints of coffee and some herbs in the background. 
Medium bodied with a light carbonation. Perfectly balanced. 
Taste is sweet caramel with a hint of sourness and a barely noticable bitterness at the end. Medium-long lasting aftertaste.
Sweet fruit aroma, this has a really complex flavour, with both sweet and sour notes. Still very good.
The aroma is a bit disappointing, but still good: mostly caramel and dried fruits. Taste is very smooth, dry with no noticeable alcohol despite high abv.

Helder mahoniekleurig bier, een beetje wazig met mooie beige schuimkraag.
Aroma is fris en fruitig met kruidenhint.
Smaak bevat een mooie zoetheid met karamel, chocolade en kruiden.
Mondgevoel is ruim met sterk koolzuur en licht bittere afdronk.
Una cerveza con un sabor intenso pero a la vez suave en paladar. Siete gradazos que entran sin querer.
Mycket av allt, men tydligt tunnare än den blå. Vid rätt tillfälle en fullträff som värd uppmärksamhet.

Flasche 0,33l: Helleres Mahagoni, leicht trüb, sehr kräftiger fester mittelporiger Schaum; sehr frische, fruchtige Nase, kräftige Würze, schöne Süße, Malzzucker, deutliche Hefearomen; im Körper schöne kräftige Süße, kräftige Würze, Malzzucker, sehr cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, sehr malzig, leichte Röstaromen, leichte dunkle Fruchtigkeit; angenehmer würzig-milder Nachgang

Dark brown colour, small head and sizzle centres going around the top. Nose can feel caramel, cinnamon, cardamom, dried fruits, raisin. Mouth receives some sourness, caramel, metal, nuts, cinnamon, plum. Good and classic Belgian beer!

Bottle 33cl. Nice dark brown color, thick and long lasting head. Taste has some sweetness but not too much. Lightly bitter. Beer is fizzy, long finish. Overall, very nice Chimay although I like the White better.

I got this 75 cl bottle together with a huge order from @Beergium. 
The cork says its bottled in 2015. Best before December 2019. 

The beer pours hazy, red-brown with a huge, fluffy yellow head. About two finger high in my new Trappist-glass. 

Nose: Caramel malt, fudge, dried fruit, plum, floral and herbal spices. 
Taste: Sweet chocolate, nuts, caramel, coriander, molasses, oak and plum. 
Mouthfeel: Creamy, silky and smooth. Light carbonation. Complex texture. A nice smooth bitterness at the end.

Another excellent beer from Belgium. This dark ale is very rich in aroma and spices. Pours a dark amber colour with a big, light beige head that lasts quite long. Aroma and smell is mostly caramel and biscuits. High content of alcohol is somewhat masked by the sweetness - but it does hit hard. Loving it.

Draught at SBWF 2015.
Big and lasting beighe head. Woody and phenolic aroma. 
Small wheat aroma and a mild phenolic taste.
Solid beer nothing more than that all the reviews have hit the highlights solid overall but too much in the aftertaste for me to drink a ton of.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Fruity! Taste of dried fruit which I cant named of. Sweet and good alcohol, zero bitter! 

My favorite berry / dried fruit juice that contain some alcohol
Pours clear copper with a tan head. Nose is dark fruit and a little spice and yeast. Flavor is gentle and similar to the nose with a plum sticky finish. A little light for the style but good stuff.

This Trappist brew is a subtle middle-intensity malty ale, with caramel and fruity brown sugar malty notes, along with some yeasty sweetness. The appearance for me was a weak point, my bottle poured a hazy ember red hue with a minimal fizzy head, nice color but nothing exceptional. On the other hand, I loved the nutty and barley-caramel malt aroma, reminiscent of a baked apple pie. Taste is pleasantly fruity and sweet, Belgian yeast notes are present but understated. Enjoyable overall, but not my preferred abbey ale.

Bottle into wine glass. Burnt orange, bit of a mongering gem head. Nose is fruity, baked Apple, apricot, grape and yeast. Taste Id similar,a rich malty red with just a touch of sweet. Mild hops in mid and back keep it refreshing and from being sticky. One of my first Belgians many years ago along with the blue, and still one of my favorites
The hops is floral. Taste little bitter, little sweet, chocolate. Just so so, but the price is cheap.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a big frothy to creamy head that leaves little lacing. Aroma of yeast and malt. Flavors of non-citrus fruit, banana and toffee. Way too much carbo in the beginning, medium body, light bitterness, some sticky sweetness and a sense of balance.

Butelka 750ml z 2013 roku (warka, L13-472), temperatura degustacji 14-16 stopni +, szkło firmowe (trappist glass). Aromat: bardzo fajnie się ułożyło przez te trzy lata, podbudowa słodowa karmelowo-tostowa, alkohol ułożony wyczuwalny w postaci lekkiej nuty rumowej, estry - głównie ciemne przejrzałe owoce( śliwka, figi) i rodzynki, próbowałem doszukać się fenoli których niestety nie wyczuwam. Wszystko doskonale się komponuje, brak wad sensorycznych. Barwa: ciemny bursztyn z czerwonawym odcieniem, klarowne. Piana: biała delikatnie przybrudzona, zbudowana z średnich pęcherzyków, obfita, średnio trwała, opada do cienkiej warstwy, leasing słaby. Smak: słodkie, suszona śliwka, podobnie jak w aromacie (figa, rodzynki) goryczka niska nadająca wytrawny finisz, alk dobrze ukryty, wysycenie średnie, dobra pijalność, piwo degustacyjno-deserowe (do codziennego picia za ciężkie, i cena ponad 30pln za butelkę trochę wysoka).

Degustata in bottiglia da 75 centilitri. Ottimo aspetto, buona schiuma persistente birra ambrato scuro abbastanza torbida. Bisogna fare attenzione alla temperatura di servizio non bevetela subito dopo tolta dal frigo non appena in temperatura il gusto viene esaltato e laroma diventa più deciso.
33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy brown with a beige head. Aromas of malt and some caramel. Taste is sweet with hints of alcohol. High carbonation. Good stuff.
330ml bottle. Dark amber, pours with an off-white head. Aroma of red berries and sugar. The flavour is soft, comprising of floral flavours and a taste not unlike the scent of soaked hay.

Note to myself: do NOT pour this in an IPA glass. Makes for a huge head and almost completely flat beer. My fault I assume. So, the aroma is malty, some nuts and caramel, not too complex but smells nice. Tastes sweet and the alcohol merges well. Hopefully to re-rate it soon in proper conditions.

Bottle. Mitchells Wines, Sheffield. Poured into a Chimay glass, that needed a good clean, its that long since Ive used it. Whatevs. Reddy brown. Quite hazy. Pock marked, scummy white head. Nose has fruity toffee. Banana chews. Pick up some chocolatey notes. Dried stone fruit. Takes me back a bit, actually, which is nice. Taste is fruity sweet. Hint of stone fruit bitterness. Foamy soft palate. Light bitter finish. Hugely drinkable.
This is one of my favorite beers. at fisrt taste like a Duvel but with a much great aroma. is very balance on the flavor.
caramel, chocolate, dough, brown, cloudy, frothy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, thick feel, average carbonation,

Очень вкусное и ароматн& пиво от монахов. В аромате проявля& вкус сухофру& таких как изюм и черносл& Согрева& пиво с приятны& послевк& Пиво со слабо выражен& вкусом содержа& алкогол& при крепост& в 7 процент&

Head dissipated though care taken with glass. Almost fizzy. Tart, slightly sweet, rich. Alcohol is there, you know it will hit you. Argues with the mouth for a swallow or two, then begins to beguile. An almost indecent pleasure.
Pours amber with a tan head. Aroma is grain, fruity malt, and spicy yeast. Flavor is grain, caramel and fruity malt. Finish is spicy yeast.

Pours from the bottle red brown with a creamy beige head. A relatively subdued aroma of plum, cherry, and dried fruit greets the nose. The first taste is dry with a prickly carbonation, yeasty, and lightly fruity. A light aftertaste of cane sugar lingers on the lips. The alcohol taste picks up in the second half, but this never turns boozy. A good beer, not quite as excellent as I remember, but perhaps a year of forebearant aging in the cellar would have enriched the tasting.

33cl pullo, BBE 2018. Todella iso hutera vaahto viskilasissa. Tummanpunertava väri. Huteraa hiilihappoa vaahdon läpi, paljaaltaan mietoa alkoholia. Suutuntumassa kuohuvaa vaahtoa, kirpeää alkoholia, makeaa hedelmää, sammutettu väkevä jälkimaku. Ihan kiva.
330ml bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a big beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, alcohol. Taste is dark fruits, nuts, booziness.
Aroma og malt, syrup, spice and bread. Taste the same but sweet with a low bitterness. Alcohol is present. Medium + carbonated. Next time I must try to store this one for a year.

33cl bottle, served in trappist chalice. Poured a dark brown with a huge three finger white head. Aromas of fruit, wood, earth, some caramel.
Sweet taste of strawberries, caramel, banana, hazelnuts, dark fruits.
A medium body, with a bittersweet finish. Overall a good dubbel beer.
Pours translucent/cloudy in a trappist glass, Lots of sweet fruit without the hop kick. Accessible and easy drinking with a slightly bitter finish.
Brownish color, creamy head. Taste is dark caramel, some nuts, ripe fruits, quite one dimensional. Easy drinking Belgium classic. Well made but a bit boring at the same time.
33 cl bottle. Pours a cloudy brown with a tan head that lasts. Aroma is of fruits and alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet. Palate is medium body with a dry aftertaste. Overall great beer.

33 cl bottle from Vrutak, served in a tulip. Brown to dark amber, clear, with huge, stable, good lacing, off-white head. Aroma is yeasty, toasted, toffee, light fruity. Medium body, low carbonation. Taste is medium sweet, low to medium bitter, texture is oily.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2016 Aroma is not strong. Long big white head. Balanced sweet and bitter. Body and finish is a bit thin.
20.12.2015-Flasche-0,33L. Rötlich-dunkelbrauner Körper, cremefarbene, stabile feinporige Krone, Aroma grasig, malzig, hefig. Antrunk malzig, dann Rosine, Trockenpflaume, gegen Ende alkoholisch.

330 ml bottle. Bought in a Leclerc in Strasbourg. Nice looking dark amber beer with a large creamy head. Lots of flavours here, dark fruit, caramel, pepper, peachy hops, almond, little yeasty banana. Good taste, but little waterish for me, need that extra punch in the beginnig, al the flavours go to the end of the taste.

Bogaty aromat, lekko winny, rodzynki, suszone owoce, delikatnie chmielowy. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, lekko wiśniowy, klarowne. Wysoka beżowa, średniopęcherzykowa, powoli opada do średniej wysokości obwódki. Smak pełny, suszone owoce, delikatnie karmelowe, przypalona skórka chlebowa, no i wyczuwalny alkohol. Piwo dosyć słodkie, niska, alkoholowa goryczka. Wysycenie wysokie. Bardzo dobre piwo, gdyby jeszcze alkohol byłby bardziej ukryty...

Bottle from Drinkshop. Hazy reddish brown colour. Slightly yeasty (imagine raw yeast) both in aroma and flavour. Now that I look at the commercial deScription, I am not sure what 0,1% of anything is doing there. Weird... Other than that it is a balanced brew, initially on the sweet side and turning to dry hoppiness in the finish, though with almost no hoppy flavour. Alcohol pokes out in late finish. All in all it is a good beer, but not remotely worth its score here. At least not what I got in this bottle IMO.

0,7 l Bottle - Apperance Cloudy reddish brown colour, with a medium sized tanned head.
Aroma: Sweet malts, caramel, dried fruits, some peaches.
Taste:sweet, fruity (peaches, green apples,prunes, raisins) , yeast, low hop bitterness in the end. Medium body, soft carbonation, silky texture,but sweet sticky finish. Great dubbel.

33 cl, bottle conditioned. Slightly hazy, nice dark amber colour, thick tan head, nice rolling carbonation. Aroma is subdued, but dark fruits are coming through. First sip attacks you in a very aggressive way. Carbonation and bitterness are up front. Dark fruits, toffee and alcohol in the middle. Very pleasant cherry toffee notes in the back. Verdict: too carbonated, too much alcohol flavour to hit my top 10 list.

yeasty, carameel aroma, some fruits (peach, dark fruits); amber/brown, hazy, medium long-lasting off-white foam; medium bitternes and sweetness, slightly sour; full- body, creamy feel, average- carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: rich aroma and taste, balanced, very good

Dark ruby pour, a bit hazy, dark tan head with medium retention. Smells like caramel and dried fruit. Tastes like dried fruit - figs, prunes, raisins - caramel, traces of Belgian yeast. Smooth mouthfeel.
Flaske. Farven er kastanjebrun og skummet er tæt flødefarvet. Aromaen er abrikos, solbær og æble og smagen er samme med en let bitter eftersmag. Alt i alt en skøn øl.
Copper color with large beige head. Very nice aroma of yeast and malt. Taste caramel, spices, bread.

11.12.2015, şişe İstanbul.

Görüntü: kırık beyaz, yarım parmak kalıcı, kremamsı köpük. Bardağı sarıyor. Bulanık kırmızı-kahve renkte.

Koku: maltsı, kuru kırmızı meyve, tatlı, mayalı. Keçiboynuzu, pekmez..

Tadım: orta gövdeli, topraksı, maya, baharatlı, hafif alkol yakıcılığı hissediliyor. Kalıcılık çok yüksek değil.
Prima dubbel, niet heel krachtig van smaak. Beetje waterig. Maar wel fijn en subtiel. Backlog from 2015/03/28.

Bottle - Cloudy reddish brown colour, medium sized tan head, dood retention, lacing. Sweet malty nose with some caramel, dried fruits, some peach, raisins. Taste is sweet, fruity notes, some peach, green apples, yeast, low hop bitterness in the end. Medium body, soft carbonation, silky texture, sweet sticky finish. Great dubbel.

33cl bottle on 08-Nov-2015, poured into a stemmed Trappist chalice glass. Hazy reddish brown colour with a tan coloured head. Aroma of apricot, malt and caramel. Soft carbonation and medium body. Flavour of sweet fruit, malt, and caramel sugar. Plum and apricot. Sweet fruity aftertaste.
