Fat på Örebro Öl & Whisky Festival. Mörkbrun vätska med fingertjockt beiget skum. Doft av belgojäst, micropop och smör tillsammans med kola, torkad frukt och lite kaffe. Ungefär samma i smaken. Lagom stor kropp.
Draft poured at craft beer market in Edmonton. Pours red with a white head. Smells sweet, like dark red fruit. Taste is complex: peppery, sweet and a little spicy. This works. I quite like it.

,33l pour from chilled bottle into stemmed pils glass all the way here in Almaty, Kazakhstan. Pours with a huge fluffy light-tan head, quite fluffy. Nose is sweet, fruity, apricot, raisin, plum, candied fruit. Smells delicious. Medium body, creamy, a little of a papery feeling. Taste is wonderfully layered and complex. Fruity notes, sweet notes, bitter notes, woody notes. Lots going on here. Love it every time.

Bottle from Beersnmore. So thats how good a dubble can be! Interesting and predominant malty malts, very sweet, some fruit (banana throughout), crisply carbonated, perfect balance between all that. A classic!

Bottle @home. Nose is brown, slight haze and a tan head. Nose is toffee, candy sugar, yeasty, blackcurrant and a touch of apple. Taste is toffee, fruity, malty a tiny touch of nuts right at the back end, nice.

Copper colored, unclear. Nice frothy head. Smells of vanilla, caramel, toasted bread, and a touch of yogurt. Nice smooth caramelly flavor. A bit on the sweet end, but enough bitterness to keep from being cloying. Not as much yeast fruitiness as Id expect, but good nonetheless. Well hidden alcohol.

Pours a brown tinged with copper from a bottle, thick crema colored head, lots of lacing, slowly dissipating. Aroma is difficult to discern through the head. Flavor is a slightly peppery, fizzy, spicy fruitiness with some nearly burnt toffee note hovering in the background. Not overly boozy, but lets you know that some alcohol is in here. Very good beer.
The perfect autumnal beer. Amber/red with a pale foamy head. Smooth liquorice with hints of apricot and a lightly smoked taste, followed by slightly bitter hops and a dry, but refreshing aftertaste.

duft. krydret, maltet karamel. 
smag: maltet karamel sød lidt sød rosin lidt sirup agtig.

Ambar oscuro con opacidad, buena espuma y retención. Lúpulo especiado moderado, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, ésteres a fruto seco bajo, licoroso ligero, metálico. En boca licoroso moderado, malta maltoso caramelo bajo, ésteres a fruto seco, ligero metálico, lúpulo especiado bajo. Final seco con ligero amargor, cuerpo medio, carbonatación baja.
Cloudy brown. White foam and lacing. Bready, slightly nutty aroma. Umami, lightly sweet and sour.
Tried this few times but never rated. Lovely foam. Strong fruity aroma. Bit murky color but maybe my lame pouring is to blame. Boozy aroma and slight booze in taste but still amazing quality.

A: ruby brown, perfect creamy ivory colored head, slightly hazy, bubbly high carbonation /

M: medium bodied, pleasant tingling from carbonation, creamy /
O: great beer, fairly complex, but for a trappist beer it is slightly dull

Flaska bishops Örebro. Mahognyfärgad vätska med stort beiget skum.
Doft av sirap, trä och torkad frukt. 
Karamellig smak med viss bitterhet. Ceder, russin, äpple och säd.

Marrom avermelhada, escura, turbidez média. Espuma abundante de longa duração. Aroma alcoólico de ameixas. Adocicada, levemente alcoólica, com notas de ameixas, passas e castanhas. Retrogosto ligeiramente amargo com uma nota cítrica ao final.
Pours dark brown with a thick white head that lasts. A light aroma. Bready, mostly sweet with some limited bitterness in the finish. Fruity and mildly hoppy. Very nice
Thick creamy cap. Light dark. Sour aroma. Tastes mildly bitter with some fruity nuances.

Licht bruine kleur met aardige schuimkraag. Weinig aroma. Prima smaak en zeer goed te drinken maar heeft in mijn ogen, in tegenstelling tot andere Chimays, geen volle, kleurrijke smaak. Deze is vrij neutraal met een licht bittere nasmaak.
Niet echt een uitgesproken smaak, maar wel een prima dubbel. Goed te drinken.
330ml bottle. Murky mahogany with a foamy beige head. Flavors are dough, brown sugar, honey, dried fruits and spices with nutty notes. Medium body, lively carbonation, slick texture.

Excellent beer to the palate. Very aromatic and tasteful. Blu chimay also very recommended

Pours a cloudy dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of raisins and dates. Taste is malty sweet up front with a taste of cherries in the finish. Smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Tap at bulldog downtown. Ruby with medium white off white head. Dark fruit smell. Dark fruit funk, decent yeast body. Sugary. Good balance. Classically great beer for number 700.

L14-795 Bottled.
25 srm. Blow-off bucket, fermx/co2/yeasty. Similar candy aroma as Westmalle Dubbel, just not as intense. Esters more of lighter color fruit, pears/apricots. Prominent taste of sugar. Mild body, smooth, pleasant astringency indeed.

aroma: banana, raisins, bubblegum, alcohol, 
appearance: coppery red, hazy, head forms quickly, white foam, is relatively lasting.
taste: Similar to aroma. First you sense banana, raisins, possibly bubblegum, some malt, alcohol. Smooth banana and alcoholic aftertaste. Couldnt sense hops. Too bubblegumy and banana flavor for my taste. Some diacetyl, light sweetness.
palate:medium body, slick feel, lively, long slightly sweet finish.
overall: Banana and bubblegum flavors and aroma is too strong for my taste. Did not enjoy it.
Classic trappist. Pours dark brown and hazy with a thick fine foam. Caramel, plum and yeasty nose. Taste is complex with fine notes of apples, raisins and banana.

Average frothy light brown diminishing head with hazy light brown body. Average malt caramel aroma and dough presence.
Medium creamy body with average carbonation.
Long duration flavor. Moderately sweet, heavy acidic and average bitterness.

Jo jo - endnu en dejlig øl fra Chimay. Men den når ikke blå Chimays højder. Men trods alt en dejlig mørk øl...
Sweet malty aroma; dark amber colour, big medium-sized off-white head; medium body; average carbonation; sweet malty and caramel taste; ester and slight bitter palate.

Purchased 1 bottle to compare to a recently finished homebrew that used Wyeast 1214 (belgian abbey). The homebrew had strong banana/clove esters despite fermenting around 63F / 17C. The Chimay red was much different than I remember from 15 years ago. Id almost compare it to newcastle brown, with caramel and raisin flavors. Below that I got some basement/musty and hint of dried cherry flavor. My bottle gushed slightly when opened. Color was medium amber with slight hazyness. Very smooth drinking, no hint of excess alcohol flavor.
Bottle from dans holland park, light fruity aromas, but a full explosion of flavours
Copper with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruit and spice. Taste is sweet and mild bitter.

Poznać zapach z butelki tym razem nie było tak łatwo, bo przywitał mnie dosyć silny gushing... Po chwili gimnastyki z butelką udało mi się wreszcie wyczuć ciemne słody, karmel i gumę balonową. Piana bardzo wysoka, beżowa, drobna, i choć zwiastuje piwo przegazowane to jest bardzo ładna. Opada powoli. W barwie piwo jest ciemnoherbaciane, jasnobrązowe. Aromat ze szkła mocno owocowy, z wyraźną gumą do żucia, lekkim karmelem, nutami chlebowymi, korzennymi przyprawami. W smaku dosyć słodkie, co ciekawe lekkie. Wyraźnie fenolowe z bardzo intensywną gumą balonową i goździkowym posmakiem. Lekki alkohol w smaku jest wyczuwalny, ale jest szlachetny. Co ciekawe jest tu też obecna nuta herbaciana. Wysycenie straciło się na szczęście w czasie nalewania jest na co najwyżej średnim poziomie. Goryczki prawie brak - a jeżeli w ogóle to lekko alkoholowa. Wraz z ogrzewaniem coraz mocniej wychodzi na wierzch owocowość zmierzająca w stronę suszonych jabłek/gruszek.
Znakomite piwo
Cloudy mahogany. Huge frothy beige head. Bread and hazelnut in the nose, also a bit of butter and banana. Banana is highlighted in the taste. A bit of alcohol, bitter wraping the inherent sweet.

Pas mauvaise mais la moins intéressante des chimay pour moi.
Corps assez puissant, très caramelisé. Fin plutôt forte dans une amertume très passagère.
La levure est très présente avec le sucre ce dont je ne raffole pas...
330ml bottle at home. Very good Belgian dubbel, well balanced. Dark amber color and good foamy head.

Aroma is sweet, malty, Belgian esters, toast, caramel, averagely complexed and averagely intensive. Apperance: dark amber color, nice foam - quite high, creamy, medium stiff. Taste: Belgian esters (dried peach and quince), sweet, little bit of balanced good quality alcohol, caramel, very low bitterness, overrated a little bit. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation, finish is a little bit bitter and also semi-sweet.

6.5 year old bottle. Found during rotbox dive prior to big move. Pours a reddish copper brown hue. So little head an english shiremane would be proud. Aroma offers sweet figgy berry sherry. Twangy raisin and ripened plums. Bit of grape drank cough syrup. Attenuated enough to be reasonably drinkable. A bit oxidized. Lowish carbonation, but enough fizz for the style. Not a favorite style of mine, and from an old bottle stored in less than ideal conditions. Better than expected.
Aroma is fruity malts and a little yeasty with dark fruits. Taste is sweet malts with honey and figs plums. Warming finish.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 (7,3,8,4,14) Avermelhada, espuma de boa formação e pouca retenção. Chocolate, frutas vermelhas, uva passa. Paladar transparece leve o álcool, chocolate. Corpo médio, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste persistente, só achei que faltou um pouco de corpo, mas muito saborosa. 

Dessa vez a espuma apresentou melhor persistência (aumentei para 4). Aroma se manteve, trazend novamente tons adocicados e alcoólicos (aumentei para 8). Paladar seguindo o aroma. Demais notas e descrições se mantiveram.
Beer with dark red color, medium body, medium bitterness, (bought a 33cl bottle in Brugge supermarket).

Very nice. Balanced. Beautiful appearance. Easy to drink. Good beer. Love it.

Bottle 0,33.
Copper color, nice foam. Aroma: rich - fruits, spicy, caramel. Taste: well balanced, enjoyable.

Robe brune à la transparence rubby et légèrement orangée (trouble).

Mousse blanc cassée, grossièrement alvéolée (grosses bulles) et tombant rapidement sans coller au verre (étonnant pour une belge).

Nez de cannelle, de poivre, douceur, fruits rouges, rondeur maltée, équilibre.

En bouche, de léquilibre, du malt doux et calme, des menues épices.

Beaucoup (beaucoup trop ?) déquilibre, de maîtrise mais avec au final peu de palette, peu de profondeur mais un corps sans faille, moyen-solide, constant, bon.

Sans fausse note mais sans joyeuses fantaisies non plus.
Bottle in Brussels. Red body with slight head. Nose is sweet, malty, yeasty. Taste is sweet, toasty and roasty with fruits and malts. Medium body and carbonated.

Bottle. Hazy light mahogany colour with a huge off-white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, fruit and spices. Full sweet taste with light bitterness and notes of fruit and spices. Medium body, very lively carbonation, and a long and lightly bitter finish. This is a very tasty dubbel with just the right amount of sweetness.
One of the best Ive tried recently. Not too dry. Lots of aroma - perfect Belgian taste. A must!

Big off white head, drops quickly and clings to circumference of the glass. Hazy amber colour. Dried fruit, prune, fig, spice, brown sugar aroma. Matching flavours with dark fruit, beautiful malt and yeast esters. High carbonation. Med-light body, finishes dry with lingering light sweetness.
Pours a dark hazy amber body with a beige head. Delayed flavour bomb of sweet caramel and malt, and with a dry, almost coarse, yeast followup.
33cl bottle. No proper glassware was available when trying this one.Dark amber with huge head.Burnt caramel with red fruits and some metallic notes. .High carbo.

Lovely dark brown ale with close persistent foam. The scent is berries, caramel malt and light hop. Furthermore, it smells a little flower. The flavor is sweet and has a typical Belgian touch. Initially felt a little coffee, but it is sweet caramel that characterizes most. Soft fruit retains sweetness, but also impart a slightly sour tang until hops maintains a long finale. Its a really beautiful dubbel.

75 cl bottle. Dark red with beige head. Great aroma of dark fruit and sirup. Surprisingly easy drinkability. Slight bitterness

Dark red color, slightly hazy, off-white to beige head. Caramel and sugar on the nose, with the typical Belgian yeast notes. Taste is sweet with burnt caramel, sugar, dark fruits, yeast. Medium body with high carbonation.
Huge aroma of a sweet prune fig and red grapefruit. Taste of rich dark fruits and medium grain malts. Finishes very champagne like in the palate. Nice subtle sweet fruits in finish.

Hazy brown, moderate head. Aroma of champagne, dry fruit, roasted malts. medium body high drinkability despite the ABV. Thin to oily texture. Bittersweet taste, notes of white wine, roast, dry fruit & grassy hops. Light to medium bitterness. Long finish with growing hoppiness. A sample Dubbel

Great beer. Enjoy the triple more, but still this is a great beer. Dark brown in colour, pours lively with a sizeable head. Surprisingly the foam disappeared quickly - but lacing stayed to the end. Loads of carbonation hides all initial flavour, followed by a flavour bomb of sweet malts balanced by the high alcohol. Nice - but will choose the Chimay triple instead.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 a classic of belgian beers. availability of this beer makes easier to love it. a classy dubbel.

Pours a two-finger white head on top of a somewhat cloudy, mahogany coloured body. Aroma is yeasty, malt caramels, and some hop menthol character. On tasting the phenols are present but restrained enough to allow some hop bittering to close out a dry finish. Fairly high carbonation. Nice.

WHAT GRATE BEERS BELGIUMS NOW COMPLEX AND FRUITS AND SPICES. UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, bread, Belgian yeast and dark fruit.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque orange/brown with slight yeast and with a medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and dark fruit; ends slightly dry with bread.

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. The Belgian yeast from Chimay makes everything so unified.
Poured from bottle. Fruity citrus aroma. Pours a cloudy red with white head. Taste is a light sour. Medium body, creamy texture, livery carbonation, with an astringent finish. A nice brew.

Bottle. Reddish-brown color. Aroma: caramel and toffee, cane sugar and molasses, dried fruits and dried apricots, perfume, complex fruity esters. Taste: warming, malts, spices, caramel, dried fruits (apricots, raisins, prunes), toffee, nuts, biscuit and cognac. Excellent balance.
Ruby color with medium lasting cream white head. Fruity malt and yeast aroma. Sweet malty flavour with notes off yeast.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy ruby with a large, creamy, long lasting, beige head that laces. Sweet malty aroma with dark fruit, yeast and spice. Sweet malty, dark fruit flavour with yeast, sugar and a dry, spicy finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent dubbel.
Acobreada,turva,creme bege volumoso,no aroma frutas vermelhas,secas e caramelo,sabor adocicado com álcool aparente mas não agressivo. Boa cerveja.
From draft. Beautiful copper color...long sustaining head...nice lacing. Too bitter for my taste, wouldnt seek it out. Still a nice pour though.

Ambar rojiza, de espuma blanca. El aroma tiene bastante de caramelo y de frutos secos, sin faltar la levadura belga. Bien de cuerpo y de carbonatación. Y el sabor sigue al aroma, con buen equlibrio entre dulce y amargo. El alcohol no es muy aparente lo que la hace bebible.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2015 Well, a classic. Brown with a medium white head. Aroma and taste aramel, toffee, yeasty aftertaste. Quite sweet. Excellent ale.

Best een goed biertje. Vol van smaak. Flinke schuimkraag erop. Toch zou ik er geen 2 achter elkaar van drinken. De smaak is best overheersend. Niet vies maar meer in de zin van teveel van het goede is ook niet goed.

Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, medium body, nice carbonation, candied fruits, caramel, malty, milk coffee, some berries, cherry at the dry end, nice one but overrated I think, but for this price here in Belgium great beer.

Dark amber on glass.
Very drinkable a definate do again.

Typical aroma of Abbey Dubbel - spices, bubblegum. Pours hazy brown with beautiful white head. Taste is sweet and sour, fruity - cherry, plum, peach with low to medium bitterness at the finish. Overall very nice one.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Found one!  Id take a Coconut Abbey from Kalona Brewing Co. over Chimay any day.  June 5, 2015: Cant dock this one much since its the Belgian Ale I grew up on 35 years ago. I still cant find any domestic micro-brew to match. But on certain batches, New Hollands Black Tulip has yeast/Michigan beet sugar settle to bottom while other batches have none -- something to bring up to the brew master. Chimay, though not that high an ABV, should be a staple in any beer cellar like my canning storage room where cases of limited release barrel aged craft beers are aging.
Bottle donated by my friend the Belgium chef. Pours champagne conditioned with smooth light head. Red brown colour. Perfect mouthfeel, lightly hopped, sweet malt balanced. A wonderful beer to savour.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Bottiglia. Molto equlibrata e piacevole al palato, persino in accompagnamento ad un buon formaggio stagionato

T:

O:
My fave Dubbel

This was a 330ml bottle that was dated best before end of 2018 and poured into a Chimay goblet. It poured a very hazy brown colour with a very nice thick cream coloured two finger head that dissipates very slowly but when it does, leaves a nice curtain lacing. Aromas are fruity, mainly of dark fruits like plum, cherry, and fig. There is also some pear, apple and candied sugar and a hint of nuttiness. Fruity cherry and plum tastes upfront with hints of banana and pear. Theres also some light malt caramel and bready sweetness followed by a nice light bitter finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth creamy and slightly sticky. Admittedly, I used to think that this was just ok but Ive grown to enjoy this beer the more I drink it. When I first tried it maybe ten years ago, Chimay Blue was far and away better and so I mostly bought that. However, clearly my taste changed and the last few years Chimay Red became one of my staple beers.

Copenhagen 31/5 2015. 33 cl bottle from Fakta. The chummy little chubby bootle from Chimay. Very foamy upon opening slightly overflowing. Pours hazy orange brown with very big white head. Settles very slowly to a 1 cm thick creamy layer of foam. Intense aroma of characteristic Belgian yeast combined with fruity sweetness. Plum and caramel and a little spice. Medium carbonation. Taste is of caramel and yeast with a mild sour bitterness in aftertaste. Distinct notes of alcohol. Very Classic Belgian Bruin.
Deep orange brown pour, nice brown head. Aroma of figs, cloves, bananas and yeast, flavor of spices, bananas, belgian yeast, figs, dates and orange. Full body. Fantastic.
Levemente adocicada, espuma de longa duração, coloração ambar, quase nao se percebe os 7% de alcool. Top!!

Bottel from Auchan, Luxembourg. Pours reddish-brown, hazy, nice white head. Nose is intense and fruity; I could discern cherry, lemon, cinnamon and plums. Taste is well balanced, fruity and not oo alcoholic, slight bitterness. Creamy and silky mouthfeel, long finish. Will drink again.

Bottiglia. Colore rosso - bruno, con abbondante schiuma beige, cremosa, ma non molto persistente. Aroma straordinario, al naso è un tripudio, con caramello, frutta candita ed albicocca in evidenza. Anche banana e cioccolato, in minor misura. Gusto dolce ma bilanciato, lalcol emerge sul finale. Al palato, nonostante la carbonatazione, è velluto. Finale che lascia soddisfatti. Sempre unesperienza.
Predominantly sweet, with malt and caramel notes to it. Its a nice beer, but with just few more cents I can get much better Blue Chimay.

Robe ruby sombre et un peu trouble, petit collet persistant. 
Aromes fruits noirs et chocolat. 
Ronde en bouche mais moins que la bleu.
Nice chocolate-like aroma with cloudy dark brown color and minimal white head.heavy sweetness and light - fizzy palate and overall great experience

Bottle. Hazy amber pours with a bubbly off white head. Aroma is fruity and yeasty with light metallic notes. Bready, fruity and malty flavor.

Right out of the bottle it smells amazing, the color, a dark red calls the first drink. Great taste in the mouth and just a little feel of the alcohol at the end. We can feel the sweet taste of fruits and caramel.

Bottle 0,33l. Cloudy, dark amber colored beer. Fantastic aroma of fruits, apricots, apples, caramel, bread. Flavor of liquid caramel, silky and delicious, semi-dry, moderately bitter, medium bodied. Just great!

Bottle 0.33l (many thanks to my sister). Hazy orange body, high white head. Aroma is marvelous. Caramel, fruits, carrot, apricot, sweet cream, flowers, rowensberries, gooseberries, sunflowers. Everything in balance with grains. Very delicious taste is sweet at first, semi-dry second. Silky caramel. Full body, medium carbonation.I would like to swim in this aroma! Just amazing one.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2015 Better than I remembered. Although not as good as others. I still prefer the Westmalle and Rochefort 8 above this one. Taste: Malts, Fruits, Caramel, Spices. In the finish a long lasting tingling ?peppery? sensation. Mostly at the back of my mouth. Medium cardo and body.
light brown beer, malt,toffee not much else, not as nice as the chimay blue
33cl bottle. Pours red-brown color with medium head. Nice cereal and fruity aroma. Taste is malty with medium carbonation and light bitterness in the end. Nice beer, but nothing special.
33cl bottle. It has light brown colour and huge foam what disappear quickly. Taste is quite simple as sweet malt and earthy hop dominate. You can feel caramel feeling at the end of gulps.
2015-04-28 - Now this is a good beer! One of the better ones I have ever tasted.

330 ml bottle from Sobeys Liquor, served in a tulip glass. Chimay is the one name that comes up most often when you mention Trappist ale, or so it seems. Pours a nearly opaque pumpkin-orangey brown, with a couple of visible, fine streaks of carbonation and a milky head that goes from creamy to pearly and leaves spots of lace in its wake. Aroma delivers a payload of bready malt with hints of caramel, while the hops bring deep red, winey fruits and an undercurrent of dusty herbalness. Flavor is gentle overall, focusing on its fruity, grapey, lightly sweet, vinous character on top of its toasted malts, with a touch of carbonic bite and alcohol warmth. A bit chewy with a slightly lingering finish. Subtly flavorful when it comes to its winey facets, never entering a distasteful malt liquor territory. Still, this beer puzzles me. I had expected explosions of thick malt and flurries of hops akin to Duvel Tripel Hop, but it was all a restrained, yet likeable, knock on the doors of my tastebuds. Puzzling.

Bottle bought at Delhaize. Pours red/brown with a medium white head. 
Taste is watery with caramel notes, hoppy bitterness in the back of my throath, roasted malts, little sweetness, abricots.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 2018, Pours deep cloudy, dark amber to brown liquid, big frothy tan head, Aroma: fruity, red fruits, yeast, warming alcohol, , griotte cherry, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, fruity, malty, candied fruits, caramel, Palate: medium to full body, creamy to oily texture, soft carbonation, long light fruity finish, Overall: nice aroma, simple but adorable smooth taste, very drinkable, enjoyed.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2015 Compra: Carrefour

Opinión: De las mejores trapenses, y ademas barata y facil de encontrar en cualquier supermercado

Btl pours a hazy light brown-red color. Big off white head, with big bubbles that fades fast leaving no lace. Aromas of fruits:prunes,old plums, banana, and a hint of citrus. The smell of caramel,alcohol and fresh baked muffins hit the nose. Tastes of fruit,figs,sweet caramel,earth,yeast and dark bread. Medium body,lively cabination,soft mouthfeel and a sweet yet slightly alcoholic finish. Very good beer,it has a nice malty character that is rich and bold. It has an effervescence about it that makes it very drinkable. I like this beer it is fantastic!

From 75cl, corked/caged, has about 4 inches of headspace in bottle, poured into 16oz Belgian tulip glass

Aroma: sweet fruity, malty

Appearance: amber, clear, massive tan head with good retention

Taste: Medium sweet

Palate: medium body, creamy or sticky texture, lively carbonation, short sweet dry finish

Overall: Im not a big fan of Dubbels, but this one is exceptional. The aroma has lots of fruity like smells. At first, I thought it was cherries, but after reading the description saying apricots then Id assume thats more accurate. The color and body is nice. The taste is malty, smooth, sweet, creamy, and well balanced. If I had to choose one Dubbel, this would be it. Fantastic beer.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2016 330ml bottle. Brown body with a brief minor head. Caramel, dark fruits, herbal notes and a hint of banana. Loads of co2.
Bottle at Bishops Avenyn. Very balanced and good beer, smoth taste and easy to drink. Very god!

Big beige frothy head with very good retention. Hazy dark amber/coppery colour. Aroma is fruity, prune, caramel, molasses and peach. Taste is fruity (peach), caramel, toasted malt, some alcohol evidence and sweet bitterness finish.
Muito boa! Sabor bem frutado, aroma de caramelo....amargor moderado. Uma cerveja muito agradável!

Cest une bière agréable. La mousse est légère et sa robe est cuivre foncée. Je lai sortie fraîche du frigo et le mieux est plutôt de la boire à 12 degrès, fraîche sans trop lêtre. Il me semble que le carameal ressort avec un goût dalcool prononcé. Je préfère quand même la chimay bleue.

Pours a hazy orange brown with a thick head. Body is medium with moderate carbonation. Aroma is fruity with lots of apricot and subtle hint of nuts and some banana. Taste is mildly spicy, with a hint of apple and a hit of cloves. Good beer!

Fairly large off white head, though it diminishes quickly. Beer per se is a tawny color and quite cloudy. 

Aromas are bready and doughy, along with some fruit, perhaps plum or apricot. Hops are quite mild.

Body is medium to full; there is a fair amount of sweetness, though it is masked by pretty lively carbonation. The alcohol is quite apparent. Seems fairly acidic, though it may just be the carbonation. 

A good beer; interesting in that the yeast seems as prominent or more than the malt.

Uitgeschonken in Chimay bokaal. Donker amberkleurig bier met royale beige schuimkraag die stabiel is en lang in het glas blijft. Aangename geur van Belgische gist, karamel en donker fruit. De smaak volgt de geur: karamel, rozijnen, iets van perzik/abrikozen. Verder relatief droge smaak, opvallend bittere toets van hop in deze uitstekende dubbel Trappist. De afdronk is licht droog medium lang zacht bitter. Zoals eigenlijk elk Trappistenbier is De Rode Chimay een kwalitatief uitstekend bier, met een fraai eigen smaakpallet.
Aroma a caramelo y frutas, sabor a caramelo y cereal. Gran cuerpo, espuma persistente.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Tumbler. Supplier: Carrefour (Lézignan). Earthy with passing fruity bitterness.
UPDATED: DEC 20, 2016 Dark amber colour. Aroma of caramel malt and dark fruits. Similar are flavours of malts, caramel, dark fruit, and herbs. Low carbonation and bitterness, with sweet malty finish.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Not much pleasure drinking this. A little flat. Nothing to worry about but nothing great either. 5-3-6-3-12=29

Rerate 2016/29/02. Needs to sit 15mn in the glass to get warmer and loses the overcarbonation. An ok belgian dubbel, not very expresssive but quite balanced. 6-3-7-3-13=32
Classic Belgian trappist beer. Tastes great, fine aroma, great hops, could do with a little less carbonation, though. Classic label, too.
Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, caramel malt, & dark fruit; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit, and spice; Nicely balanced; Pretty decent.

It looks, smells, and tastes delicious. So smooth and creamy. Very flavorful yet easy drinking. Complex, dark fruit, caramel, malt, hop, a lot of subtle flavors. Easy to drink quickly but best to relax and truly enjoy the outstanding quality of this excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 33cl. Sparkling copper with a foamy offwhite head and very nice lacing. Sweet fruity aromaa with hints of citrus and Belgian yeasts. Medium to robust bodied with fizzy carbonation. Sweet with moderate bitterness. Pleasant fruity malt character with a complex finish. Very nice,
Pours a dark red with a rapidly dissipating head. Overpowering pine with a hint of cherry. Really a disappointment for a beer rated this high.
Chimay chalice. Wonderful, smooth drinking dubbel. Has a bit of hops, unusual for a Trappist product, a yeasty smell and a dark fruity taste. Robust, complex, thoroughly enjoyable entry from Chimay.

Pours a dark cooper colour with a creamy off white head. Hints of apricot like aromas and tastes.Very malty at the back end with slight hints of scotch flavour. Carbonation is good. Mouthfeel is very structured. Not for the faint hearted.

375 ml bottle purchased at The Beer Store, Nashua. Dark brown without much head. Aroma is dark fruits, brown sugar and a mild Christmas like spice, pumpernickel bread. 
Took me forever to get around to trying this simply because it is so widely available and I didnt have a desire. Its really quite good but If I buying Chimay I reaching for the blue label. Anyhow... The flavor is like the aroma with a very nice yeast character. The finish is on the sweet side but balanced by spice. Body is on the fuller side. Jeez, for the price this a GREAT grocery store brew.
Bière brun clair trouble, bulles moyennes, mousse abondante. Goût caramélisé, torréfié assez fruité. Bière brune agréable, bien que sans caractère propre.
375 ml bottle poured into a tulip glass..red wine color with a fluffy off-white head..aroma of dark fruits,bread,spices..dry,malty,fruity,caramel flavor..good but overrated.
Riecht eigentlich gut, fruchtig, Geschmack ist auch ok, aber einach ein wenig langweilig das Ganze.

Cloudy reddish brown. Huge ivory head.
Fruit scents (cherry, banana); coffee, caramel.
Both powerful and silky, well-structured, medium-lingering.
Overall, very nice. A good way to get into trappist beer.
Botella de 33 cl tomada en la antigua internacional de Oviedo en mayo 2003. lote 196 hasta fin de 2004. 7 vol. bastante buena.
Brune plutôt claire, léger fruité, légère amertume, léger caramel, ensemble très équilibré, un poil en retenue. Facilement trouvable en grandes surfaces en France, du moins dans les grandes villes.

Bottle, 330ml. A clear reddish beer with a medium size frothy head. Intense aroma of malts, spices, nuts and alcohol. Taste is biiter with a strong malt character. Some carbonation and moderate astringency. Medium bodied with a slightly alcohol finish. Clearly a first class beer.
Tåkete brun med høyt beige skum som legger seg som en tynn hinne ettervert. Lukter lett karamell, mørke frukter og aprikos. Bitter med noe søt bakgrunn. Brent sukker og tørket frukt. Mye lullsyre.

This smells like as close to a caramelized eye-fillet as a beer could be, but with a hit of malt and oak come across. The palate is more caramels and toffees, and chewy; it's still crisp and delicate, but packing some punch. This is a great Belgian.

Rot - braun mit einer ordentlichen weißen Schaumkrone. In der Nase säuerlich, Beeren. Geschmack: leicht süß, etwas Säure, etwas metallisch. Malz, zu stark geröstete Nüsse. 
Nicht schlecht, aber irgendwie unrund.

Pours a cloudy chestnut brown with big beige head. Malty, slightly roasted bouquet with some herbal scents. Medium bodied palate with low bitterness and good finish. Rather like a blue Chimay in miniature as expected.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella. Marrón brillante densa con una corona beige clara. Buen lacing. Aroma y gusto a frutas, maltas, con un dulzor y amargor equilibrado. Muy sabrosa. Me gustaría probarla on tap.
Mørk brun og uklar med et høyt skum som forsvinner fort. Bananer, overmoden melon og belgisk gjær i duften. Smaken er svak av banan og noe nøtter med en behagelig ettersmak av karamell.

Brown body with hints of red in the light, a nice light white head. Aroma is sweet and the taste matches with a grassy taste and slightly bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle intl signature chalice, bottled on 8/31/2013. Cork popped itself off when I uncaged it. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy reddish copper color with a 1 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, pepper, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, light chocolate, light nuttiness, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, pepper, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, light nuttiness, light chocolate, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Moderate amount of yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, pepper, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, light chocolate/nuttiness, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible complexity and robustness of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth and moderately creamy/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming lingering after the finish. Overall this is an incredible dubbel style! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.
Coaba oscuro, espuma canela compacta. Aromas de frutas confitadas, piel de naranja, anis. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce afrutado, naranja y final seco.

Bottle 330ml. Pours amber brown with a dense cream colored head. Aroma of malt and yeast. Medium bodied with gentle carbonation and some tanginess. Tastes quite sweet with good balancing bitterness and very light sour notes. Flavors is lightly hoppy, with sugary caramel and malt flavors, light citrus, plenty of yeast, slightly bready, and some bitter herbal notes. Some alcohol is present as the beer gets warmer. Quite sweet but not sticky and well balanced. Let the beer lose some of its chill before pouring.
Excellente beer though it is not as good as blue. Anyway it deserves some attention by the beer lovers indeed.

Bottle. Dark brown color with huge steady beige head. Aroma is pleasant, but light: fruits notes with bubblegum. Taste is lightly bitter, mild, easy to drink, medium carbonized. Finish is surprisingly short. Good beer.
Onde of the best beers Ive drunk. Its a lttle bitter and smells good. Not too string (7%).
15.4.2014. Aroma of malts and Belgian yiest, quite full-bodied, taste has caramel, malts. Not as good as other Chimays.

A nude dubbel style beer. Pours a very cloudy, slightly muddy red with a soapy white head. Smells of apricots, banana and cloves. Tastehsd lots of banana and apricot and more fruit, with a creamy finish. Had in the bottle.

Pours an hazy amber topped by a finger of creamy head holding a little tan and showing pretty good retention and lacing properties. The nose is a bit too subtle with some almonds, apricot and milk chocolate. The taste puts the nutty matls center stage along the fruity apricot element. Foamy mouthfeel, the brew still brings it to town with a moderate sharpness and medium finish with the Hallertauer pushing the sweets aside. Simple and efficient is how I would bes resume this beer. Cheers!

Bottle from Hop City Birmingham. Pours a hazy coppery with a white head. Aroma of malts, plums, raisins and and other fruity flavors. Taste is light fruity and light sweet, with hints of dark fruit. A bit bitter aftertaste. Full body. Really good beer

Bottiglia da 0,33. Birra di grande personalità. Schiuma voluminosa che lascia spazio ad un sottile strato persistente. Colore scuro ambrato. Carbonatura importante forse un po eccessiva. Aroma complesso e lievemente fruttato. Gusto amarognolo finale deciso e secco. Consiglio 8/10
Greet beer. Dark amber coloured. The foam is thick and creamy. The most of the foam disappears, but a nice layer stays on top of the beer to massage your lips. A great beer, like all trappists.
Pours nicely, sweet caramel taste. Not as good as chimay blue but still a very nice beer.

Bottle. Pours a nearly clear copper, tan head. Little retention/lace. Aroma of apple juice, caramel, yeast, light ester. Taste is sweet, fruity, apple juice, caramel. Palate is dry, soft, slick, sweet finish.

Pours a hazy coppery with a fluffy, fairly large head. Fruity aroma with malts, plums, raisins and sweet candy. Taste is well balanced, light fruity and light sweet. Subtle bitterness to round it off. Creamy texture and just above avg co2 levels. Full body. Light alcoholic sting.

Bottle 0.33 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnorubinowe, mętne piwo obfitej puszystej, w miarę szybko opadającej ale pozostającej w postaci kożucha pianie oraz słodkawym, owocowym, lekko biszkoptowy, aromacie. W smaku złożone i ciekawe ale nawet lekkie, zbalansowane pomiędzy słodkim a wytrawnym, początkowo czerwone owoce z pestkowymi aromatami, następnie palony, lekko czekoladowy finisz.

NOTA DE CATA: 
Coronada por una espuma cremosa, Chimay Brune (Roja) desprende un ligero olor a melocotón procedente de la fermentación. Su gusto, que deja una sedosa sensación en la lengua, es fresco gracias a un ligero toque de amargura. En cuanto al paladar, aquel que la pruebe notará una agradable astringencia que completa armoniosamente las cualidades gustativas de la cerveza.
A solid Trappist style ale, a little thin for my tastes but easy drinking, and easy to find.

12oz bottle into a chalice. Pours a deep garnet with a pillowy beige head. Dried fruit, caramel malt and some light flowery nose notes, well balanced sweet flavour, light bitter finish. Rich and very pleasantly creamy on the palate. Gorgeous; happy its available in town again.

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought in delhaize, brussels. Dark spicy ale.



 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Caramel, dried fruits, brown sugar, fruits and some yeast in the aroma. Deep amber with a off-whit head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall a nice brew, rich in flavor, some warming alcohol in the back, but still quite easy to drink.
Poco da dire sulla splendida rouge dei padri trappisti di Chimay. Rotonda, corposa, fruttata al naso, piena al palato con malto caramello e frutta, un finale perfetto appena secco. Super.
Bottle at home. Yeah so like I said, Im falling in love with Abbey Dubbel. Great maltiness. Well balanced sweetness. Strong yet mild. Superb :P
Ottimo aspetto, schiuma abbondante e persistente con perlage molto fine, odore caramellato e fruttato, sapore dolce caramellato, amaro nel finale con note tostate leggermente astringenti.

Robe brune, assez claire. Nez élégant sur des notes de fruit, dépices sur un fond de levure et caramel. Bouche à lattaque fraîche, bulle moyenne, amertume qui domine la finale. Un bière plus élégante que puissante.
Tap at the Grub. Sweet caramel, berries, cherry drop sweets. Aroma is yeasty, floral. Better than I remember.
Bottle. Pours cloudy/ruby brown with generous white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of candied red fruit. Taste is subtle: a bit of caramel on the back end of candied fruit (cherry?). Very good.
330 ml bottle. Brown orangy ( Copper ) coloured with creamy head. Fruity, small bitterness and spiced. A really enjoyable beer.

For me Chimay trappists represent a certain technical perfection in brewing. There are not even hints of off flavours or unwanted aftertastes. Chimay rouge has a rich perfumey aroma with red fruit and malt. The beer pours a generous, stable foam. The colour is a nice dark amber. The taste is rich, malty and fruity with a gentle bitterness. The lower alcohol content with gentle carbonation gives the beer a light and refreshing feel on the palate.

Pours a slightly hazy brown color, topped with a decent white head. Malty aroma, notes of caramel and some alcohol and a bit yeasty. Sweet and malty, some caramel notes with again some alcohol. Also a bit yeasty in the taste. Not my favourite.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Re-Re-rating: Same old beer but I think my tastes have changed after rating more and more beers. Still a great beer, but not what Im looking for in a beer these days I guess. Still was glad to be able to share with family during New Years. Re-rating: More or less the same, after having this again in bottle form, I toned down the overzealous score. Still a great beer though. 330ml bottle bought at Masuyos Liquor in Asagaya, Tokyo. Poured into a stemmed tulip glass. Huge soapy head with good carbonation. Hazy caramel brown color. Strong aroma of fig and prune and clove. Extremely well-balanced beer. Bitterness from hops and maltiness are both present but neither overbearing. A bit of spice on the finish as well...maybe nutmeg or cinnamon. Overall a beautiful beer.
330ml Flasche. Klar und rotbraun. Kleine Schaumkrone. Malzig, leicht fruchtig. Süsslicher Nachgeschmack.

33cl bottle of chimay rood/ rouge. Less strong as the blue one, but great taste. As all the Trappist beer the best of the best in the beer landscape. Also the fact that the profits go to charity makes you want to drink this beer over and over again!
Bottle. Sweet nice Belgian ale. Reddish-brown color, rich taste of fruit. Good.

Bottle - pours a hazy brown with a large bubbling beige head which gradually fades. Aroma of malts, a little chocolate and yeast. Taste of malts and chocolate followed by yeast, a little clove and some cinnamon. Medium body. medium carbonation. Probably my least favourite of the three but still quite incredibly.
Definitely one of the best belgian beers. Red Dark color, very tasty, smells a bit caramel, alcohol is present but subtle.

Chimay never disappoints and it's been years since I've had one. The red/amber color is gorgeous with a white head the lingers in a swirl in a tulip .... The aroma is caramel and floral with a bit of yeast and fruit. The caramel comes through the sip with a hint of cherry before being taken with a bitter finish that's light and not overbearing. With a creamy palate that has a nice linger. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2015 Red / brown beer with a white head, medium carbonation.
Taste is caramel, fruity (cherries), spicy and some alcohol.

When you actually get to try a hyped beer and it lives up to it, that is a nice feeling. A limited example of the Chimay line was available here during my fledgling foray into beerdom and I didnt appreciate the beast that Chimay Blue was. So I was quite joyous to try this one, dark copper red with a nice, thick fizz of off white resting on top. A curious whiff grants the sniffer with toffee, raisin, plum, vanilla, biscuits and leather. Like drinking a dark fruitcake that strikes a captivating balance. A mouthfeel both fizzy and oily, chewy but thin, this is a beer to be sipped and to ruminate about.

This was the first ever Trappist beer I have ever tried. The beer had a lot of smoke and poured a ruby color that was hazy and had a medium white head. The head is very creamy. The aroma is dark fruits, sweetness, slight bitterness, a great aroma. The taste is dark fruits, slight bitterness up front, some alcohol burn but mild, white bread, and a creamy texture. This beer has a strong flavor and a minor underlying sweetness to it.
0,75l Flasche. Rötlich braunes Bier, kleine schaumkrone. Intensiver malziger, fruchtiger Duft. Schmeckt leicht nach röstmalzen, nach getrockneten Früchten.

Chimay Red, 33cl bottle as part of the tasting set I got for Christmas and so served in the matching Chimay glass. It pours a deep opaque brown and was a slow gusher on opening then had a creamy looking off-white head of foam that lingers a long time and coats the glass as it subsides. The nose is classic belgium ale, fruity, bready, plums, a bit of booze but the overall impression is truly of liquid bread. The beer has a surprisingly raspy effervescent and lively carbonation dancing on your palate while digging in its sharp heels. The flavor is chewy bready malts, sweet stone fruits, some wine like booziness plus a bit of nuttiness and some spice. A complex yet delicately balanced brew, theres a reason these guys have been around for ages.

I tried it at a local beer fest. It reminded me of a Hefe Wiezen in color, body and taste. It was OK but considering the price I prefer a less expensive German beer that has a similar if not better taste. Id drink it again but its a little too expensive to drink often. I think its actually somewhat over rated.
Purchased from Malt Shoppe. Deep red/amber color, light brown, creamy head. Light aroma. Smooth beer - slightly bitter at the end. Pricier - would buy again but not often.

Bra huvu! Brunröd färg. Söt, maltig doft & torkade frukter. Smaken är fascinerande. Kandisocker i smak så söt & fin. Karamell ton, toffe, & torkad frukt. Mums!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In Brussels for business I tried two beers a night. Little to add to what others have said, this was a knockout and likely better by not having been shipped transatlantic. Not quite the lingering maltiness of the Chimay blu, which I prefer, but a proud, world class brew.
Oh Chimay, you feisty little red head, you packs a punch. Take your aspirin before bed because this little ginger will knock you out.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Good balance between smoothness and maltiness. Very well balanced and well made.
How: bottle Appearance : dark red, off-white head. Aroma : cherries, caramel, prunes, spice Palate : medium body, average carbonation.

Pour is amber with a two-finger off-white cap. Nose is apricots, prunes, bread, spice and alcohol. Taste is far less sweet than I expected, in fact its downright dry, with a lightly bitter finish with lingering spice and alcohol warmth. Nice, but I think I prefer the blue.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 Good balance between smoothness and maltiness. Very well balanced and well made.
0.75 l bottle from Alko. Big head, amber colour. Taste is butterscotch with some hints of chocolate.

Al naso si presenta come una classica dubbel. Aromi di caramello e frutta secca. Nel bicchiere si presenta di un colore bruno con una bella schiuma abbondante , mantenuta tale dalla carbonazione importante. In boca agli aromi già avvertiti al naso si aggiungono piccole note fruttatee, sul finale, sentori speziati portati dai luppoli. In complesso una birra adeguatamente bilanciata. Grazie allaggiunta di zucchero in bottiglia e allelevata presenza di CO2 la birra è piacevolmente secca e beverina nostante limportante maltazione ed il corpo deciso.
Una birra di carattere nata dai mastri birrai più importnati al mondo.
Uma bela breja, mas não me impressionou demais. Boa espuma, cor pouco opaco e aroma agradáveis com sabor lembrando cereja e leve toque spicy
Red with white head. Aroma is cherries, Beligan spice, candy, citrus and some caramel. Fruity and sweet palate. Aftertaste is caramel, dry, floral, citrus and fruit juice. Overall: Nice! Enjoyable,

Poured into a stem glass. Colour is copper red with generous off-white head. Nose is subtle cinnamon, clove, citrus, and spices with caramel malts in the background. Flavour is citrus, sweet malt, banana flambé, caramel, and light hops. Moderate body. Yummy strong ale!

Pours copper red with a huge and frothy off-white head that made my bottle overflow. Sweet aroma of malt and citrus with a touch of red apple, brown sugar and fruity yeast. Medium body, thick feel, average carbonation. Taste starts off with cherries, toast, dark chocolate, some licorice and a bit more of the brown sugar to complement the aroma. Refreshingly dry and bitter finish with herbs.

33 cl bottle. Murky coppery brown with a big bubbly light beige head that drops rather quick. Lacing good. Nose is burnt sugar / caramel anddried apricots, prunes, also sugared and spiced nuts, and cinnamon. Some alcohol coming through the foam. Overall its a very nice sweet, spicy and (dried) fruity, delicate and nuanced aroma. Taste is caramelly with notes of prunes and cherries, not overly sweet, with a slightly herbal bitter finish, accompanied by the alcoholic warmth. Body medium, carbonation on the thin side but quite active.

Bottle. Nice ruby color with thick cream colored head. Very fruity up front with red plums, dried Apple, strawberries. Sweet cake notes with a touch of vanilla, brown sugar, almonds. More apples, some cider notes. Light sweet with fruity tartness and a light dry bitter finish. Full carbonation. Really good.
Uma cerveja totalmente aromonioza no sabor e aroma, coloração bem turva, excelente cerveja trapista.

Yes, this is a malty brew but the killer is the hoppy finish that sets me into a quirky spiral of curious speculation. What is that I taste? There is something that doesnt make this a sure ringer. Whelp, it simply finishes bitterly and I do not like bitter beer. The combo here does not work wonders.

Bottle BBE: 2018. Chilled. Some gushing upon opening. Opaque, reddish brown body with a towering, pillowy off-white head. Some dark brown yeast sediment. Sour cherry, red apple, coarse grain, and a little vinegar on the nose. Pleasant light/medium sweetness, a light developing bitterness and a very subtle sourness to taste. Medium body with a prickly yet smooth texture. High carbonation and a long, lingering finish. Outstanding.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a hazy copper colour with a tan head and lacing. Aroma of biscuit, amber malt, and some spice. The taste is dark malt and spices up front, with a biscuit backbone and dark fruit flavor over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lightly clouded ruby-brown, amber when held to the light. 3mm of tan, medium-fine head that fades moderately quickly to a nice fine film and ring. Aroma is huge apple pastry (delicious!) light cherry, pear, and some plum. Brown sugar, light caramel, hint of butter. Body is medium, oily syrupy with a very fine moderately intense carbonation that actually contributes to a slightly gritty texture. Flavor is bread crust with a bit of cherry flavoring (like cherry cough syrup!) and light brown sugar. A tad hot on the exhale, and slightly medicinal. Toast in the aftertaste tingles the palate pleasantly. The slightly medicinal cherry flavor is unique to me on an otherwise excellent (and rather fruity) Belgian backbone. Plenty of caramelized (or brown) sugar without being too sweet per se. Also, any banana presence is rather light compared to what I might expect from the white. Really neat!!
Reddy brown, little lasting head. Aroma is brown bread, malt loaf and fruit. Medium body and carb. Taste has a malty base with dried fruit and brandy butter. Whats not to like?
Nice head and nice color but I am not fond of the taste. Not bad trappist beer

Bottle. Hazy dark copper color with white head. Caramel plums and ripe fruits in aroma. Taste is malty with a long caramel finish. Flavors of chocolate, caramel, malt, ripe fruits and some alcohol warmth.

the aroma is caramel and fruity, with notes of plum, apricot and toffee... the taste is well-balanced, caramel with shades of different fruits - plum, passionfruit and red apple... also some hints of spices... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

0,33l bottle. Hazy copper with offwhite head. Fruity and sweet aromas. Peach. High carbonation and instant astringent hit, followed by fruity, sweet middle. Not what I expected. Challenging, in a good way.
0,75 bottle bought 2009 nearby Cmimay village. Bb 2014. Brown with XL head. Bready with nuts. Round soft bitterness with some sweetness. Some fizzy.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

11.2 oz bottle into a Chimay goblet, natch. 

A: Pours a murky dark brown color. The head is about a finger high, with a cream shade - it doesnt have good retention at first, but seems to last a while after fading to a thin film. A little bit of lacing is left behind. 

S: There are lots of apple notes from the esters that really mesh well with the strong caramel and brown sugar aromas. There are even slight hints of chocolate and cherry. So, the aroma is three parts caramel-coated apples and one part chocolate-coated cherries. How is that not awesome?? 

T: Didnt live up to the aroma, sadly. Apple esters hit the palate immediately and end up as the primary note over the secondary caramel and brown sugar flavors. The balance between these two notes is bang-on; its the lack of the depth (and the unwanted metallic notes) that kill its chance at greatness. Still, this is enjoyable enough. 

M: Very fizzy, as expected. The fizz bothers me here a bit more than it did in Chimay Blue, simply because this doesnt have the full body to help mask it slightly. But its as bone dry as can be, and that gives it rock-solid drinkability. 

O: As a straight-up dubbel/BSDA, it doesnt hit me the same way Rochefort 8 did. Its far from bad, dont get me wrong, but Im kind of nonplussed here. This is probably on the lower end of quality in terms of trappist ales.

Po przelaniu do szkła ukazuje się średniej wielkości biała piana otulająca trunek o miedzianej mętnej barwie. W aromacie wyraźna słodowość i przyjemne owoce - ciemne winogrona, brzoskwinie, dojrzałe czereśnie. Po ogrzaniu się piwa dochodzi zapach suszonych daktyli, fig i miodu. Nuty dzikich drożdży ledwo wyczuwalne, ale są. W smaku dość wytrawnie jak na dubbla, początkowy cukier w postaci fruktozy jest szlachetny, nienachalny, dalej dochodzi do głosu owocowość, która przechodzi w chlebowość razowca z rodzynkami, aby na finiszu przejść w głogowo-korzenną goryczkę. Nasycenie średnie do niskiego, ciepło alkoholu odczuwalne tylko głęboko w przełyku.
Bardzo ułożone i zbalansowane piwo, bez wad, ukazujące wszystkie zalety belgijskiego klasztornego dubbla.

Barwa głeboko rubinowa, lekko zmętniona, piana biała, średnio i grubopecherzykowa, nietrwała, dość obfita. Aromat słodowy i chlebowy, lekko wiśniowy. W smaku cierpkie, lekko alkoholowe, mocne. Nie zostawia posmaku. W ustach rozchodzi się w pełni, goryczka średnia, piwo na języku szerokie, wysycenie spore.
Had 2 bottles over xmas. Good brown beer with a deep copper color. Appearance is great. Not my favorite trappist, but overall very good and drinkable

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Medium tan head. Hazy reddish brown body. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, herbs and liquorice. Mostly sweet on the tongue. Pretty good, but far from the best trappist beer.
Flavour is very strong bitter fruits. Significantly worse than regular Chimay and Chimay White.

Belle robe noisette, légèrement opaque. La mousse tient bien.
Très maltée. Arômes de levure et fruits rouges.
Longue en bouche.
Très bonne bière.

Di colore mogano, torbida, forma un discreto cappello di schiuma ocra, cremosa, di buona persistenza. Al naso sentori molto pronunciati di frutta, speziatura da lievito, alcool, malto tostato. Corpo rotondo, carbonatazione alta. Al palato è dolce di malto, elegante e morbida; il finale è lungo, con note amare del luppolo ben bilanciate.
UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Draft. Pours dark red with no head. Nose is malty and slight sweet. Taste is mild malt and some yeast. Body is real thin. Not trappist worthy. Old keg.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: não lembro muito bem , mas lembro que achei muito boa, frutada, cor bem castanho (pela foto)

Cloudy amber pour, fluffy slightly tan head. Nose is dark fruit (raisins& dates). Sweet. Middle is caramelized nmalt, cherries, hint liquorice. Finish dries somewhat, slight woody taste. Lot going on here.

bottle: pours slightly hazy, medium amber-red color, white frothy head. Aroma is fruity, notes of grape, apricot. Taste is sweet, alcoholic, fruity taste (grape, raisin, dried fruit) with a dry, lightly tannic, lightly bitter finish. Smooth, light to medium bodied. Very easy drinking.
In bottle. Frothy, rocky, creamy head.Amber/coppery. Cloudy. At nose chestnut honey, raisins, dry plums, peache, biscuit, caramel. Medium body. Sweet with a bit bitter at the end. A bit astringent.

Pours a hazy copper red with a tan head and lacing. It has a nice aroma of biscuit, amber malt, and some spice. The flavor is dark malt and spices up front, with a biscuit backbone and dark fruit flavor over a medium body.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 Amber copper red almost a cloudy body. Cream of a light beige is permanent, generous, stable and remains in good glass a long period.
The fruity aroma is sweet with notes of caramel, nice Belgian yeast, cherries, apricots, prunes, bananas. Hops shown very light.
At first the caramelized flavor is average and gradually begins to resemble a cozy liquor cherry, with nuances of peach, apricot, honey, and that gives a spicy touch the mouth through very well set the whole alcohol. Surge in his throat a greater bitterness, however there is an excellent and pleasant freshness that urges the whole.
The palate has in its medium body a creamy texture, sticky, lively carbonation.
With a dry, short and slightly bitter finish that offsetting the initial sweetness.
Overall it shows a very different Dubbel with this very strong taste cherry liqueur.
Being perfectly honest I can not say if this peculiarity can bother most lovers of this style of beer, but I approved.
A beautiful and honest configuration Dubbel.

complex geurig aroma dat fris en fruitig aan doet. Redelijke schuimkraag die lang aanhoud en wolkig aan doet. Donker koper kleurig. Zacht op de tong met toch behoorlijk wat carbonatie, romig, fruitig en een zachte bitter. Minder complex dan de andere Chimays wel herkenbaar. De meest zachte en toegankelijke chimay.

Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Mørk brun, noe uklar farge. Stor boblende skumtopp og plenty karbonert. Lurt å ha glasset i nærheten når den åpnes. Smaker karamell, gjær,brunt sukker. Har et visst champagnepreg både på smak og futt. Ganske så god
Very little aroma. Deep copper in color. Sweet at first, well balanced with hops. Lots of carbonation on the palate. Starts to foam up in your mouth. Carmel type of finish.

Draft 0.15l at Chimay stand Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it dark reddish color with small white head.Taste and aroma of plum, candy sugar, caramel, red fruits and yeast.Full flavour and good balanced.
Nice red ale with a sweetish taste and champagnelike carbonation. In conclusion a bit boring but a very solid red ale.

Warning: Chimays beers arent that tame and will spontaneously come out of the bottle roughly one second after getting rid of their virginity cap ;) Top made of big bubbles. The kind of beer you can drink lots. The flavour still lives on after swallowing.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Owocowo - slodowy aromat, piekny, gleboki kolor, w smaku slodkie, owocowe. glowna wada to nadmierne jak dla mnie nasycenie (nawet ze dwa razy byl gushing - ale obie felerne butelki z carrefoura, wiec pewnie nie za dobrze sie z nimi obchodzili). Tak czy inaczej jak dla mnie najlepszy trapistowski dubel jaki mialem okazje probowac (lepszy od wyzej notowanego Westmalle. St. Bernardus Prior 8 i Ommegang Abbey Ale niestety nie mialem okazji probowac)zmiany po slepym tescie dubbli - szczegoly tiny.pl/gwtlqOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aroma en smaak: ijzertje, fruitig als banaan, zoet, caramel

Decent dubbel but nothing special. There are craft dubbels which are far less expensive and superior in taste and quality. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2016 It seems unfair to have Dubbel beers rated alongside lagers and such. To me it is apples and oranges But hey here we go. Rich dark colour with a thin head on top. The nose I get nut, toffee, yeast and maybe some soft candy. Upon tasting I get some summer fruits but mostly dark fruits and darker notes of toast and some malt. If you drink this ice cold you will not taste half the ingredients or indeed flavors. It opens considerably as the beer warms. That can be said of most Belgian beers I guess. Overall a fine beer and a good winter warmer with friends.

Ok well first off, from the date code on the bottle and a ratebeer forum that tells you how to read the code, This beer is 19 years old. My grand father passed his beer collection on to me. I decided to try one. The aroma is amazing! Slightly roasty, rich toffee and dried fruit, spices, yeast, similar to a barrell aged scent. Flavor is somewhat mislead here because it is nearly flat. There is carbonation but very little. It tastes like malta. Not quite as Intense but very much similar. Very, very light bodied and acidic. The smell is amazing. The rest is far past its prime. Not undrinkable, but not entirely desirable. Id say 19 years is too long to age this one. Ill have to try a fresh one to compare.
Large bottle from Alko. Muddy amber brownish color with a small rocky head. Honey and spices on the nose. Dry palate and not as full bodied as most other trappists that I tasted. Still a good one.
Bottle in Sherlocks, Middlesbrough. Cloudy ruby coloured with a thin off white head. Fruity with toffee and plenty of spice. Caramel too. Tasty beer.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Appearance: (in a Chimay Chalice) pours a two finger head that settles down to half a finger quickly, body is a rich dark nutty brown with hints of red, hazy and almost completely opaque.
Aroma: Nutty, dark fruits, spice, yeast, apricot, caramel, hops toffee, roasted malt, hints of hops, bubblegum and candy.
Palate: highly carbonated up front, slowly becomes creamier, dry medium body. 
Taste: Apricots, toasted malt, bubblegum, dark fruits, banana, spice, astringent with hints of sourness, more hops than I would expect from a Dubbel
Overall: A lovely astringent hoppy dubbel that still has plenty of sweetness, initially the taste was a little underwhelming but after a while in the glass to warm up it really began to open up and match the quality of the nose.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L13-651. AROMA: complex aroma with malty caramely background and fruity aromas reminiscent of pinneaple and apricot. hop aromas absent. APPEARANCE: semi-dark copper with material in suspension. medium ivoey head with average retention. TASTE: flavour less rich than the aroma with mild sweet caramel notes. low apricot notes. low bitterness with a medium-dry finish. PALATE: medium body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: a dubbel with very nice aromas but, alas, not so complex flavours.
Draught @ Poteaupré. Dark brown colour, big head. Aroma of caramel with some toffee. Sweet flavour and yeast. Very fizzy
Nice red color, little head. Very light aroma of malt. Medium body, average carbonation. Bitter taste, with hints of chocolate.

Opaque dark red, strong white head. Bread and roasted malt on the nose. Slightly overcarbonated. Bittersweet, but rather bland and watery. Bitter roasty finish. A pint is what this should be sold in. Okay.

750 ml bottle from the LCBO. Vertical tasting of 2012 and 2014 vintages side by side.
2014: Pours cloudy dark brown with lots of off white head. Herbal/peppery, citrus and floral hops hit the nose as well as the brown sugar/bread malt. The taste follows the nose with a pleasant astringency flavour kick that balances well with the malt.
2012: Slightly lighter in colour, with less carbonation and head. More fruit esters., yeasty malty than the fresh bottle. Astringency and bitterness is all gone. More wine-like, with notes of apple juice, dark fruit, sweet bread. Smoother than the fresh bottle, missing the hoppy/bitter notes.

Conclusion: Much prefer the fresh bottle and Im basing my raring on that.
Bottle bought in Calais. Iconic trappist beer, one of best dubbels. Full of aroma and taste. Thousands of revieweres are not wrong at all.
Bottle from Le Coach Brussels, Belgium. Loved it a bit more than Chimay Bleue

Chestnut color, beige head. Dried fruit nose, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, ginger, nuts. Caramel taste, roasted malt, yeast, dry finish, hint of alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol.

Bottle 33cl. Deep brown with a cream coloured head that fades quickly, especially if you accidentally pour the residu. The aroma is mainly sweet, but theres more that I cant clearly recognize. The taste is sweet too at first, but after that a sharp bitterness kicks in accompanied by herbs.
I enjoyed this beer a lot. Sweet, spicy and smooth after taste. Nice fruity aroma. Good looking crown.

On tap at Irreale, Madrid. Appearance dark amber, nice thick head. Aroma not too intensive, but very nice yeasty, typical belgian sweet honey-peach. The same taste: honey, peach, caramel, sugar, full body. Great, extremally drinkable beer.
couleur brun-rouge; mousse legère et assez abondante; arômes fruités; goût malté, fruits rouges; un peu trop sucrée; finale douce avec une pointe damertume

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2015 Una dubbel ben strutturata, corposa. Di colore ebano chiaro, con buona schiuma, al palato esprime molto il sentore di caramello e biscotto, con il lieve profumo dei luppoli. Forse legnosa a tratti, ma molto gradevole. Lunga persistenza, corposa, vellutata

A great Trappist beer and the makes me think of the classic Belgian Style...
A bit fruity and spicy, sweetness with an underlying peppery aroma.
Quite complex, layered and lots of flavour.
Highly recommended, a world class beer!
330ml bottle. A classic one has been revisited &, of course, enjoyed!! Sorry, my computer is dead. Tasting notes are coming soon!!
750ml bottle. Pours a dark copper colour with tan head which is retained for some time. Aromas of spices and caramel malt. Sweet aftertaste. A fine Belgian beer.

A fine bottle given to me by a friend from work after the completion of a month-long painful task, thanks Matt! Enjoyed at 8:58AM. Pour is cloudy, murky brown with a thin ring of beige foam - looks like water from the Wisconsin river. Aroma is loaded with banana bread, light holiday spice, caramel malt, and a light metallic note. Flavor is lightly sweet and minerally with light toasted malt up front followed by a dry yeasty kick then finished with banana and Belgian yeast flavors. Wonderful refreshingly effervescent palate.

Kolor brunatny, zmetnione. Piana niska, powoli opada do grubej obraczki i minimalnie oblepia szklo. W aromacie ciezko sie czegos doszukac, lekki syrop kandyzowany i suszone owoce, ogolnie slodki aromat. W smaku jeszcze ciezej sie czegos doszukac, jest smak syropu kandyzowanego i lekka owocowosc, na finiszu pojawia sie delikatny, szczypiacy alkohol. W odczuciu wytrawne, wysoko wysycone, ale jest to jak najbardziej na miejscu. W zasadzie jest pijalne, ale jest tak do bolu nudne, jednowymiarowe i malo intensywne, ze jest sporym zawodem.

0,33 l bottle. Clear, dark ruby with nice off-white, creamy and stable head. Fruity aroma of cherry, plum and raisins. Not as intense as I expected (and quite weak compared to a Rochefort 8). Taste follows the aroma but adds some alcoholic notes and some bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel, medium body, lively carbonation. Definitely a good beer but somehow I missed some deepness and complexity. Interesting at least that hop extracts are used.
Pours amber with a tan head. Aroma has malt, bread. Very clean tasting. Light body, highly carbonated.

750ml bottle from the LCBO. Deep brown/ruby red body overtop a huge foamy head which diminished quickly leaving almost no lacing. Huge apricot notes, some wine-like qualities on the nose alongside cherry, apple and plum. The finish is more alcohol warmth than hops. Medium bodied with elevated alcohol which is well integrated. More sessionable than most of the same style.

750ml bottle. Cloudy dark red copper body, big mocha head with decent retention, but watery lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast and spices, candy sugar, caramel malt, a tad mineral. Smooth and light taste: yeast, candy sugar, lots of caramel malts, herbs. A strange metallic aftertaste.

"malty, dark fruit and a little spice in the nose and flavor...more subdued than i was expecting. tasted with the blue and white-this was #2 or 3. good, but there are many doubles out there more interesting."

On tap at Vancouver Craft Beer Market in Vancouver. Served in signature stemmed glass. A very decent dubbel, though Im far more interested in tripels and quads generally. Slightly fruity, quite malty. 3.6.
By far one of the most unique and classic of the Abby ales. This is a standard in my house.

Buona birra, scura sullebano con schiuma color cappuccino. Odore di malto e vaniglia, uva sotto spirito. Non molto dolce allimbocco, non trovo malto ma solo un po di prugne e tanta astringenza, quasi resinosa. Buono il retrogusto , alluva. Birra OK, consistenza oleosa e corpo medio, rotondo. OK, niente di straordinario però. Buona beva

750ml bottle poured in its own chalice.
A: Nice bottle art, a classic. Imposing wired cork with a bright red label. Pours a cloudy dark amber to brown color with a medium beige head. Medium retention. It never disappears completely leaving not much lacings
S: Sweet on the nose. Brown bread, candy sugar, dark fruits (mainly plums), caramel malts and Belgian yeasts
T: Follows the nose. Brown bread, caramel malts, yeasts and a delicious hoppy and bitter end. Just a little bit of alcohol can be felt
M: Medium to heavy body. Creamy and molasses. Medium carbonation and reasonable bitter aftertaste
O: Delicious Belgian Dubbel. Mandatory to Belgian beer lovers
[ BA Review @ 4/25/2011 ]
Mnie osobiście nie zachwycił. W smaku i z wyglądu wodnisty. Zdecydowanie poniżej oczekiwań.

cloudy reddish-brown color; fspicy, dark fruit aroma; a smooth, fruity dubbel with notes of dark fruit, apricots, raisins, and cherries, as well as nice Belgian yeast notes; smooth and pretty easy drinking for the style; an extremely tasty beer
Hellbraun, schaumig. Dunkle Früchte, belgische Hefe, brauner Zucker. Am gaumen Dörrobst, brauner Zucker, Hefe, Kohlensäure. Gut.

Hipster, overseas. The champ!! Wheat here like in minimal quant. Almost cherry like alcohol on the back of throat. Champagne beer ...not miller...real champagne. Readily available so at your fav carne casa, it is there. Best with a big piece of red flesh and a creamy sauce.
Kinda sweet and fruity aroma. In the taste I notice a variety of several herbs.

11.2 oz. bottle from Cash Wise in Williston. Appearance: 2 fingers khaki head, good foamy, great lacing, head persists as film, copper color, cloudy. Aroma: molasses, light plum, perhaps light spice. Palate: average carbonation, medium body, alcohol thinness. Taste: sweet plum and full maltiness, sweetness lingers as a light alcohol warming finishes the taste. Overall, very good beer, think this is my new favorite dubbel. Love the maltiness.

Not bad head, yet no lacing. Cloudy. Banana & yeast on the nose, some coriander. Some fruity character on start, then alcohol and very long, warming finish. Moderate bitterness, good mothfeel. High carbonation as appropriate to the style.
cereal, brown, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---
