Pours a hazy orange/brown with haze and a tan head. The smell is rich malt, fruit, yeast. The taste is brown sugar, yeast, spice ending toasty and dry. The body is light/medium with average plus carbonation.

Bottle 750ml. Cloudy brownish-orange with quickly diminishing low beige head. When pouring from the bottles bottom it looks more cloudy and darker. Sweet yeasty aroma, honey and date honey, cherry notes, syrup, sweet tart, spicy. Very sweet date honey flavor, cherry, quite spicy, yeasty, bready. Lively carbonation. Medium to full body. Sweet sticky aftertaste.

0.33l bottle. Hazy amber color with medium browny head. Subtle aroma of caramel and some fruits. Taste is bitter and sour, more bitter than sour. It is a good beer, but I find it little overrated, just like chimay blue.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 Reddish-brown color with medium, but stable head. Yeast aroma, a bit sour, some caramel, but not too intense. Sweetish banana taste in the beginning, some spices, but after some time in the mouth, it doesn?t really taste of anything anymore. Foamy, smooth mouthfeel, but hardly any finish at all besides a bit of alcohol - maybe a little bit of sourness, but I have a hard time sensing it. I am not really convinced of this one, considering it?s a Trappist beer; I like the blanche/tripel and the bleue better.EDIT: slightly aged corked 0.75l bottle. Taste is with vintage hints, oxidized, sticky dry feeling. Not bad.
amber, clear, frothy, grass, barnyard, woody, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter,
Bottle. Pours hazy reddish color, white head. Aroma of cherries, yeasty, red fruits. Taste is medium sweet, cherries, caramel, bit yeasty and some alcohol.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, levadura, afrutado.
Brown with a reddish touch colour, off-white head. Nose is sour cherry, raisins, peach. Fruity and malty taste, with only a very small hoppiness.
Bottle @ The Bishops Arms, Helsingborg 19/9-14. Aroma: Malt, fruity, some yeasty notes. Taste: Dito. Body is medium, the finish is sweet and fruity.
Bottle @ The Bishops Arms, Helsingborg 19/9-14. Fruity, yeasty and sweet malty, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and yeasty.

On draught at ABV Public House. Bubbly dark amber color. Aroma is pear, apple, plum, and light yeast. Taste is prune, apple, pear, lightly spiced yeast, and slightly grassy hops. Quite effervescent, with lingering fruit flavors.

Foi a estrela da noite de degustação, precedida por uma Colorado Appia, uma Brooklyn East India Pale Ale e uma Affligem Blonde.

Realmente é uma cerveja menos complexa que a Chimay Blue, mas não faz feio de forma alguma.

Bela coloração avermelhada, bom creme, bastante persistente.

Frutada e quente. Um pouco licorosa.

Aroma frutado e médio.

Pours a copper color with a creamy head that disappears leaving a long lasting lacing. Very malty with a bit of hop bitterness. Has a bit of a fruity presence. The mouth feel is off. I have not noticed this before, so wondering if my bottle is past its prime. It leaves a bit of a coating. Reminds me of a fragrance that you accidentally get a taste of. and coats the roof of the mouth. I know I have drank this years ago and loved it, so might have to do a rerate on another bottle.

Transfer from BA review on 8-3-1-3-

 Poured from bottle into a Chimay chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a hazy copper-garnet color with a small tan colored head. The head fades rather fast leaving only a trace level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is fruity with nice smells of darker fruits. The fruits are mainly of a resin, plum and prune. Mixed with the darker fruit smells are some nice yeasty smells as well as some spice aromas. Rounding out the aroma is wheat bread and a banana smell giving it an overall dark Belgian aroma overall.

 Taste  The taste begins with darker fruit and a slightly biscuit flavor. The darker fruit are just as would have been expected from the nose being mostly of raisin and plum. Right up front there is a moderately spicy taste of nutmeg, clove and cinnamon which is quickly meet with some caramel and banana sweetness. Toward the middle some yeasty taste begin coming to the tongue while some of the biscuit disappearing. Toward the end, a tiny bit of alcohol comes to the tongue as well as a moderately strong molasses sweetness which when combined with all the rest, leaves a nice somewhat sweeter and warming taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is medium in its thickness and creaminess with lots of carbonation bubbles filling the body of the brew. The moderate body and carbonation make for a more crisp feel balancing out the sweetness of darker fruits and sugary tastes well. 

 Overall  Fantastically tasty and quite a pleasant drinking brew. This is renowned for a reason.

Burgundy, off white head, decent head retention, and lacing. Floral, fruity, mild raisin, and mild lemon aroma. Full bodied, mild syrup, medium lemon hop notes, earthy, and sweet fruit notes. Decent balance with watery, lingering bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chestnut brown colour, creamy beige head that nicely lasts. Sweet malted aroma (light) and taste with peach, cherry, caramel/toffee, raisins, vanilla, light chocolate. Good alcoholic warmth. Soft but quite complex mouthfeel with prickling carbonation and rounded flavours, good body.

Bottle at Wellington Arms, Bedford. Mid-brown, hazy, bit of cream head. Malty, doughy aroma with a hint of berries. Malty caramel taste: my God this tastes English! Lovely tingly carbonated palette. While not a patch on its older brothers, this is a solid beer.
Bruin bier met veel schuim. Smaak is licht zoet en bitter, chokolade en lichte koffie smaak. Blijft lang hangen.
75 cl. champagne-flaske. 7 % . Den røde Chimay er bare ustyrlig fantastisk god. Til den mørke sige, suveræn smag uden den mindste bitterhed.

Pours a dark, hazy russet color with an off-white persistent head. Smells vinous, w/ Christmas cake spice and stewed raisins, a little sassafras or cherry tree root. Perfect amount of carbonation. Thick, balanced malty midddle, w/ a yeasty, drier finish. Overall, a classic in the Abbey Dubbel style.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2016 BOTTLE 33 CL. Light dark fruit, light boozy spice, some oily nuttiness. Surprisingly dry, slightly roasty/roasty and spicy, nutty. Very smooth mouthfeel. 
 
-------- 

BOTTLE 33CL from dcmchew.
Look: hazy amber-brown, big beige frothy head.
Aroma: harsh phenolic spice, a littler alcoholic even, some dried fruit.
Taste: quite flat, phenolic, harsh phenolic bitterness. Had this beer, before and was not impressed, but this time it was like a bad homebrew. 7-3-6-3-14=3,3

Aroma frutado e caramelado. Coloração vermelha acobreada e translúcida, com boa carbonatação e alta formação de espuma (boa retenção da mesma). Sabor frutado, levemente amargo. Retrogosto levemente amargo e frutado. Ótima opção se dubel.

One of the three Chimay classics, the smallest one in terms of ABV and popularity, also tasted as Chimay Première on 75 cl. Creamy, very pale beige, equal, moussy head, very stable, colour a warm and autumn-like, brownish copper with orange hue, darkish but fully transparent, clear at first with a steady column of fine bubbles moving upward, hazy after adding deposit. Subduedly sweetish, appetizing aroma of candi sugar, fondant chocolate, orange, walnuts, faint and elegant wheat sourishness, gingerbread, nutmeg, gin, grapefruit peel and white pepper. Soft, well-rounded, full palate with sharpish carbo, dried fruits, citrus peel, restrained sweetness, caramel, soft sourish wheat presence, bit granular and a little bit oily, smooth mouthfeel, nutty maltiness hovering between dry and sweet, finish reveals leafy and somewhat peppery hop bitterness, tingling carbonation also continues, slick, some warming, gin-like alcohol, dry and even a little astringent on the tongue. My least favorite of the three but still a very enjoyable, elegant and inviting beer, less complex, leaner and more bitter than the big blue one. Ages very well in the Première version though, but even then it cannot compete with the Grand Réserve.

Bottle, at Peasant Cookery, Winnipeg. Very nice sweet fruit and vanilla nose, maraschino cherry and other candied fruit. Flavour is a little less sweet, some nice maltiness and dark dried fruit notes. One of the best dubbels I've ever tried.
Bottle. Hazy orange/red color. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Medium bitterness, very sweet. Fruity. Aroma of metal and blood. A bit strange.
Bottle tap room batley. Red brown beige head. Aroma is fruity yeast caramel dark malts taste is same nice sweetness some alcohol. Nice body prickly carbonated. Good stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2014 Bottle. Pours hazy brown with a big creamy, persisting beige head. Aroma of roasted malts first, ripe fruits, raisins, caramel, cane sugar, artificial sweeteners after a time. Yeasty. Taste is sweet with some hop bitterness and a little sourness to balance it. Medium bodied, oily. Medium long sweet caramel finish. The caramel is too sweet and not burnt enough, really. Nice Dubbel, deep sweet although borderline cloying.

Bottle. Pours cloudy amber, dense beige off-white head. Aroma is a lot of fruity estere, banana. Taste is quite sweet, nutty, molasses, light toast and dried fruits. Well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 Its copper color, very hazy, with enormous small bubbled head. Aroma is malty with delicate note of strong alcohol. In taste its also malty. Beside that its sweet and a bit alcoholic. So deep in aroma and taste. I had to grown up to chimay beer, but now I appreciate them very much.
Very fruity aroma. Heavier beer with a strong malt flavor with a very slight hint of fruit.

Bottiglia da 75 cl, colore ambrato intenso con un cappello di schiuma densa e persistente. Al naso saltano note di malto tostato e alcool, in bocca parte dolce con il malto che si fa sentire abbastanza per poi terminare con un buon amaro unito a alcool, il corpo è medio e scende abbastanza facilmente, buona carbonazione.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Big, spritzy and floral. Subdued Belgian yeast. Pleasant balance between astringency, acidity and bitterness.
Bottle to a tulip. Deep amber brown with foamy tan head and lacing. Belgian roasted malt, caramel sweetness and yeasty spice. Balanced, smooth, delicious. Top notch...
Pours with a nice cream head, aroma is nice with a apricot overtone. The copper color is pleasing. Mildly sweet with a slight bitterness at the finish. A great sipping beer before a meal.

On tap at Niks Wunderbar. Pours a cloudy red with thin head. Hint of dried fruits, figs, raisins. Dryness shines through as it warms. Not extremely complex but enough malt to balance the dry finish. Love it.

Bottle. Appearance- ruby/brown, quite dark, a bit murky. 1-2 finger off-white head which slowly settles down before disappearing. Aroma- yeasty, dark fruit hints, cherries, plum, a bit vinous, bready malts. Taste- lots of cherry, fruitcake, nutty hints, malty, medium mouthfeel, fairly short finish. More sweet than bitter. Very tasty.
Great. Nice bottle. Pour gentle otherwise too much foam. Great palate. Nice and bit complex taste. Enjoy it.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Nice light fruity aroma. Cloudy brown colour with no head. Very fruity melon flavour with smooth finish. Medium to heavy body with low carbonation.
Een heel lekker bier dat vlot binnengaat. Zeer lekkere nasmaak ook. Een aanrader

Murky red-brown. Ample carbonation. Taste is very malty. Caramel, raisin, toffee and some light bittering hops to offset the sweetness. Very good Trappist ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella 33cl. De color rojizo oscuro y espuma ligera, con sabor a caramelo que se va deshaciendo hasta volverse a tonos tostados. Gran sabor y muy buen cuerpo. Una agradable sorpresa.
Light copper colored pour. Sizable off-white head. Plenty of lacing. Aroma of malt, hops, yeast, sugar. Taste is a dry malt and sugar with just the slightest hop crispness in the back.

Bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a deep ruby, with a huge head that slowly dissipates, leaving good lacing. Nose is dark malt and caramel. taste is toffee and caramel, with a creamy mouth feel and long finish. The perfect dubbel, and a world class one at that.
Light brown with wery rich yelow cap. Mild sweet aroma. Moderate sweet taste (exctly as I like it!) with caramel sourness notes Reafreshing and easy drinkable.

Un épais nuage de mousse coiffe une robe cuivrée et trouble. Miel sauvage et sucre brun sont en vedette au nez. Les choses se complexifient en bouche avec lapparition de fruits secs confits. Assez ronde, lalcool ne paraît toutefois pas. Un classique toujours amusant à revisiter.
Flott rødbrun farge med et hvit skum, skummet la seg som en ring. Aroma av malt, kandisukker, karamell, moden frukt og gjær. Smaken følger aroma på en flott måte. Ettersmaken varte en god stund.

Bottle in Spain
Very bubbly with golden color. Aroma and taste are very Belgian, very double brown Trappist. Quite soft in palate however. A good one I an say!

Draft at Uber. Copper pour, dense creamy eggshell head, great retention and lacing. While I patiently wait for the head to drop off, I get to take a long time with the aroma. Very fruity, almost like tart apples and peach. Cherries, some candi. Taste: bread, caramel, fruit. Rather sweet, bready and slightly toasty. Cardboard. Palate: medium body that feels thin and watery, but Ive been imperial stouting it up so will give it the benefit of the doubt. Overall: Im guessing this is one you have to be in the mood for, or you drink again and again and acclimate to it, grow to love it. I could see that in this one. Not sure Im likely to get to that point, but its nice enough.

The wife of Freaky Tiki is a keeper. And this review will tell you why: my fav funk-soul-deep-blues St Louis radio station KDHX (check it out online) had an ad for a Belgium beer & mussels festival that had me jealous. Well lo & behold wouldnt you know she got a mini-festival going at home (having a 3 week old keeps you off the road) & this often drank but never rated brew was the beer we started with. Pours the colour of my retro modern couch: deep mahogany with a thin cap lounging on top. First thing I notice is a brisk carbonation. Flavour is candied plums, steady spicing & a slightly bitter finish. I like it but I dont like it as much as the 2nd bottle of the night thats waiting in the fridge: St Bernardus.
Köpte denna på carrfor i Serignan. Drack denna på uteplatsen i Portiragnes. Helt okej

Bottle. Pours ruby with a white head. Aroma: candy sugar, somewhat earthy. Taste: candy sugar, raisins, plums, dried apricot, earthy. Light-medium body, medium sweet, light nutty bitter in the finish.

750ml ($15.99) very good beer. taste is lighter than the blue grand reserve. Has good carbonation and flavor is very complex. Worth having if only once. but personally Ive had better and at a better price.
Deep red pour with a big frothy head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma of caramel, fruit, yeast. Taste is dark fruit, malts, yeast. Medium smooth body.

330 ml bottle. Ruby red, slightly hazy, with a huge, frothy and bubbly head, which disappeared very quickly. Strong and pungent nose, slightly perfumy, with notes of brown sugar, toffee/burnt caramel, sligtly toasted, some blood orange presence, a hint of booze. Fruity and slightly bitter in the mouth, plenty of dark berries taste, light dark fruits and sour black cherries, leaving a mild acidic edge in the background. Average to lively carbonation, medium body, slightly oily texture. Not my favourite style of beer, but definitely a nice sipper.

Absolutely love this abbey beer! The pour was a cloudy and deep burgundy with amber highlights. The head was thick and creamy white and the pleasing sweet malt character wi fruity notes of apricot and plums delights the tongue. It has smooth carbonation, medium body, is very tasty with a slight bitterness at the back. Very drinkable and not too complex. Suits my tastes perfectly!
0,33 pullo ms starilla. Pehmeä, hiivan ja karamellin maku. Tuoksussa hiivaa. Ulkonäössä hieman sameutta. Miellyttävä.

Bona cervesa, és equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es equilibrada y sabrosa.
Dark carmel color, rich apricot aroma. Strong sugars and very pronounced carbonation. Finishes well. More carmel and less leafy flavors
Had this in conjunction with another belgium dubble and ommegang. Found this to be the middle of the two. Like the style like the spicy fruity flavors.
Aroma of caramel, dates, and yeast. Opaque burgundy colour. Flavour of honey, figs, nuts, and soy sauce. Medium body with mild carbonation. Quite a tasty beer!

33cl bottle in branded glass. Brownish red with frothy, soapy head. Aroma of yeast, malt and some mud. Pours perfectly, and looks as a perfect Belgium dubbel should look like. Not transparent, thick and smooth. A taste you can distinguish. This is good, but I love the blue one more. Also, this is rather traditional dubbel to my taste, and when compared to, say, La Trappe, this is much nicer.

Wow! das ist ja lecker, sehr fruchtig, milder Hopfen, exterm süffig. Ein super Bier, ich bin von der 0,75 l Flasche angetan, sie sieht super aus, vor allem mit dem Korken drauf. Ein super Bier aus Belgien!

Bottle pour. Dark hazy amber with a large light brown creamy head. Light but pleasing aroma. Aroma is cherry, dark fruits, malts, and raisins. Medium body. Smooth initial dark red fruits taste, followed by a lingering light malty taste. No bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, earthy, soy sauce, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, umami, medium body, slick feel, fizzy, bitter,

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2014 Hazysh deep amber color, big white head with low retention. No lacing. Medium to full body, soft to average carbonation. Aroma of strawberry, yeast, malts, dark fruits, raisins, caramel, brown sugar, alcohol. Medium sweet taste with slightly dry finish. Very good but not my favorite Dubbel.

33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. This is not the first time I drink this beer and it is curious that in a year apart and from different places the beer varies both in color, taste and aroma... When drunk at Belgium was more red, aroma was very fruity and very noticeable the red fruits. The today has some aroma of red fruits, prune, caramel and some nuts. The head of the first was more white, from today was more beige and lasted less time, the level of carbonation is medium and medium body for both. Aftertaste is sweet and longer for the today beer.

Is promised a new trial in Belgium for the tie ...
From a bottle. Pours a deep brown, lasting head, distinct aroma with a hint of vanilla, very smooth and malty with no real bitterness.
Farmhouse and cherry in the aroma. Mild taste of raisin, cherry, and darker malts.
Nice red Belgian. Got in a sampler pack. Very carbonated, belgian hops and a little bitterness. Dont know that it is worth the price, but definitely an interesting brew.
Smell is weak but pleasant. Pours dark brown with medium head. Taste is medium carbonated with a pleasant touch of freshness. A pleasant sweet aftertaste guides through this excellent beer.

Very hazy brown with light brown head. Scent of yeast and alcohol. Taste of yeast. Pleasant mouth feel with crisp carbonation.I would recommend the blue chimay over this.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours a burnt red with a fizzing off white head. Malt, sugar, dark fruit, caramel, yeast and biscuit aroma. Caramel, raisin, fig, biscuit, toffee, sugar, wheat and malt flavors. Medium full body and lots of carbonation. Caramel, biscuit and malt finish.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2014 ASPETTO: Marrone abbastanza scuro, con tonalità arancioni, come se fosse un pelo di volpe scuro. Torbida. Schiuma di un giallognolo molto chiaro, finissima, abbastanza persistente e abbastanza abbondante.
AROMA: vinoso, più che altro di mosto di vino, uva fresca. Aroma fresco con un tocco di erbaceo.
GUSTO: prevalente il maltato. Si sente bene anche il caramellato, un caramello potremmo dire "tostato". Si avverte anche del fruttato e un leggerissimo acidulo. Carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa, con bollicine finissime. Retrogusto un po caramelloso. Corpo medio
CONCLUSIONE: birra equilibrata e gustosa. Appagante, se uno cerca una birra gustosa ma non particolarmente complessa.

Vöröses, meggybefőttet idéző színű főzet vastag, sűrű habbal. Illata meglehetősen visszafogott, az idő múlásával sem válik túlságosan részletgazdaggá, mintha összetettsége nem engedné egyik elemnek sem, hogy túlságosan hivalkodó legyen. Némi pörkölt maláta és egy kevés komló azonban érezhető benne, melyek határozottan jelennek meg lekerekített, gömbölyded ízjegyei között némi édeskés, vaníliás aromával és zárásképpen egy réteg komló kesernyéjével kiegészülve. Harmonikus trappista ale.
330ml bottle from Charter Mall, Chongqing Lu, Changchun. Pours a cloudy reddish brown. Very good Belgian ale and ridiculously drinkable for 7%.
One of my favorite standard Belgium ales. Ive been drinking this for decades and it never disappoints.

Pours a dark hazy body with a medium head. Uninteresting aroma and a very nice, well balanced taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It has a deep burgundy color with reddish amber highlights. The body has a light haze with a few small bits of yeast suspended in the liquid just above the bottom of the chalice. Its head builds up tall and thick with a creamy off white colored head. The head slowly recedes to a thin wispy covering that hangs on tell the finish and even leaves behind a small amount of lace. The aroma has a pleasing dark sweet malt character with lots of good fruity esters and earthy Belgian yeast. There is a slight phenolic presence as well. There is a good sweet malty body that is full of fruity notes like apricot, dates and plums that mixes with some earthy yeast. In the middle there is a very slight astringency. It also has some light herbal hops spice and a pleasant alcohol that adds depth and warmth. In the finish the sweetness fades off giving way to dry earthy yeast. The texture is smooth with a slid medium to full body and well balanced carbonation.
(bottle 19/06-2014) medium fading beige head, unclear brown color, high co2, slightly spicy taste, difficult to taste due to co2. BB date 2018.

Hazy copper. Lots of head but disappeared quickly. Small "foam" remained. Smells fruity and bit yeast. Tastes fruit, nuts. Bit acid. Not bitter for me. Medium+ body. Very little watery aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, herbs, red, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, long finish,

750mL bottle. Pours a coppery color, medium off-white head with decent retention and lacing. Nose is caramel, band aids, hint metallic, malt. Mouth is medium bodied, toffee, prunes, leather, band aids, oak, hint of vanilla, minerals, touch metallic. Decent, but Ive enjoyed other Dubbels more than this. Ive had this a few times over 10 years ago, but never rated it before. I do remember liking the Blue better thank this one though.

Cloudy brown color, minimal off-white head. Aroma is caramel, flowery oak. Very nice and sweet. Medium body, Id say even full body, but goes a little bit watery during the finish. Lively carbonation. Great dubbel. Cant taste the alcohol. 
(Vrutak 0,33l bottle)
On draft. Sweet malty aroma. Hazy cooper and slight orange color with thick white head. Sweet taste and slight spice ending. Good beer.
Hazy dark amber with off white head - Sweet malt aroma with some yeast - Good dark malt with sweet dark fruits and some spicy yeast - good sweet malt and fruity finish - This was real good

0,33 l, flaske, 7,0 % ABV, købt i Netto på Roskildevej i Valby, 3. juni 2014.
Mahogni-farvet med rødbrune nuancer og ufiltreret Trappist kloster Ale med 4 cm tykt offwhite-farvet skum med store bobler, som mindskes til ca. 1 cm. 
Aroma i næsen er typisk belgisk: tørret frugt og gær. Rosin, sveske. 
Denne øl virker en anelse mindre sød end de øvrige Chimay's. Omend lidt sødme kommer snigende gennem smagsbilledet. Samtidig virker den umiddelbart som den "svageste" i flokken af brødre og søstre. Mere vandet end de øvrige. 
Smagen er mere maltet og humlet end de øvrige, hvilket kan falde i nogle's smag. Og eftersmagen er en anelse mere bitter end gennem selve smagen. 
Som øvrige Chimay's er der skruet godt op for kuldioxid-indholdet, hvorfor jeg altid fristes af at køre øllet et par gange rundt i glasset for at få det til at bruse af. 
Eftersmagen er medium lang.
Kort og godt: en mere humlet trappist kloster-øl.
Aromas of nuts, grains, yeasty bread, dried fruits. Pours a beautiful dark amber color. Has a taste of roasted malt,fruits, and a slight bitterness which contributes to its overall drinkability.

Dubbel abbastanza commerciale, discretamente sbilanciata sul dolce e dominata da un grado alcolico rilevante. Non spiacevole, ma a parte il nome celebre non la preferirei ad altri prodotti dello stesso stile meno stellati ma più sostanziosi.

Hazy deep amber color with small white head. Arima is slightly roasty, malty, some yeast, nuts, maybe dark fruits. Medium body. Taste is sweet with some bitter notes, but very pleasant. Really nice one!

Rating #959, flaske fra Netto i Nysted. En brunrød øl med godt skum og klart ufiltreret. Duft af karamel og malt med et hint af chokolade. Tør smag med masser af malt, karamel og gær. Lidt chokolade og en medium bitter afslutning. Lidt metallisk bismag, som også findes i den blå chimay. Medium tykkelse. Øllen er som sådan god nok, men ikke overdrevet spændende og ikke i liga med mange andre belgiere.-- rated with beerbasher

Strong Belgium yeast smell. Highly carbonated on the tongue & light for the style. Mildly malty & fresh. A highly drinkable classic.

Rated by BrewTom

Pours a copper brown color, typical dubbel but slightly less darker, with average, quite creamy head (actually smaller head than other chimays Ive drunk). Very strong and pungent aroma I would say: extremly malty, sweet, nutty and spicy smell; maybe a bit too much aromatic for me. Taste is actually much more delicate: malts, nuts, cake, caramel and a touch of alcohol and a little sourness too. Actually what I probably like best about this beer its the finish: balanced, with perfect sweetnes and that smaaall hint of hops; nice medium/low carbonation. Overall a nice and enjoyable beer, but still not at the level of the best dubbels, maybe (also) due to my personal taste

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2014 Dark brown color, but with fast dissipating beige head.

Malty flavor, perhaps walnut and plums. Slightly strong on the palate, spicy and fruity notes, hops and yeast harmoniously combined.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 La Chimay rouge se présente sous l'aspect d'une bière ambrée aux reflets rouges cuivrés surplombée d'une mousse ferme et onctueuse. Le nez lui aussi est magnifique. On y retrouve les arômes de fruit développés durant la fermentation comme par exemple l'abricot. Des notes maltées sont également perceptibles. La bouche est surprenante: Les saveurs sèches de caramel bien contrebalancées par la jolie amertume finale. Une très jolie bière donc.
A nice caramel aroma with a crisp earthy finish. A very sessional beer even at 7%. :-)

330ml bottle from strait and narrow, Colour is brownish red with a light brown head. Nose is earthy fruit, berry, and grains. Taste is smooth maltiness, berries and fruits. Finish is smooth mild bitterness?

Murky reddish-brow beer with a light brown/white head. Aroma of yeast, alcohol, raisins, dried fruits and caramel. Lots of yeast in the taste but also both cherries, dried fruits and a quite notable alcohol taste for a beer of only 7%. Some bitterness in the middle, quite long aftertaste. Very drinkable but not as interesting as for instance Chimay Bleue

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée dans une SAQ. Dégustée le 6 mai 2014 (trappist glass). Bière brune voilée. Mousse énormément dès louverture, col beige-crème foncé, très épais, crémeux et persistant. Assez effervescente, bulles moyennes. Odeur dalcool, de levure. Assez douce, très sucrée, peu amère. Saveur de céréales, de levure, un peu de caramel en finale. Alcool bien caché. Devient meilleure (plus savoureuse) en se réchauffant. Texture un peu crémeuse.

Appears definitely mahogany, copperish. Large, creamy head. Nose is composed mostly of red and yellow fruit esters. You can easily smell lots of ripe cherries, plums, raisins and apricot. Some molasses, brown sugar smell and noble alcohol notes as well. Remembers me of cherry liquor candies.Tastes pretty sweet, with very light, wine-like, a little bit stringent bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel. Flavor is heavily implied by fruity esters, it is pretty, but not overly, complex and very tasty. I like it a lot.

Pours bronze with a dense head. Plenty of overly ripe plums in the nose. Creamy but quite sparkly on the palate. Raisins, liqourice and cherries in the mouth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This double is unlike other doubles. It's not as thick as other doubles. It's so soft but so tasty. The color is beautiful, light brown. The head is thick and the beer smells deliciously sweet. I love this double!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 Bottle, 330ml. Pours cloudy deep orange/red with around a finger of soapy white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma is a little hard to discern; getting mostly yeast with perhaps a little alcohol and fruity notes. Sometimes honey. Main body of the taste is taken up by bread and yeast, with notes of honey and perhaps banana and caramel. Small amount of bitterness on the finish. Medium mouth feel, carbonation isnt as excessive as Ive been told, though the thing did absolutely erupt upon opening. Pleasant enough, though I think inferior to Blue.
Bottle bought in Belgium. Copper red with big head, small bubbles. Aroma of yeast, a bit sour and apricot. Feels a bit overrated, but okay.
Bottle. Pours a dark red amber beer. Aroma is bread and a hint of fruit. Not much else. Taste is balanced but not much specific. A nice bitter and a bit to much carbonation. Ok.
Barva: kalná hnědooranová. Pěna středně hustá, ulpívající. Vůně: příjemná svěí sladová. Chuť: plné tělo, mírný říz, příjemná sladově karamelová chuť, hořkost střední, vyváená. VÝBORNÉ PIVO
Shared 33 cl bottle. Pours dark amber with a frothy head. Aroma is yeast, bread and honey. Taste is again yeast, sweet honey, dates. figs and some notes of orange.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2016 Bottle. Pours a hazy, dark caramel color with almost non existing foam head. Aromas of banana bread, cola, metal, bubblegum, yeast. First sip is metallic. Taste starts slightly sour, slight chocolate caramel taste. Light bitter development with strong banana flavour. Caramel malts and rye note in finish. Lacks depth of the Blue, but nice brew nonetheless.
Reddish brown with thick beige head. Mouthfeel is quite artificial. Dry and astringent on the palate. Apricot aroma.

Bottle at home. 
Spicy nose, notes of pepper. 
Reddish brown color, white head. 
Medium body, sweet, alcohol, pepper. 


:)
Bolton Brew.
Isteni finom. Annyira ízlet, hogy volt, hogy pókerben nem pénzt, hanem ezt nyertem meg :) Lágy gyümölcsös aroma, felejthetetlen kortyok.
Nicely poured, thisck creamy head, teste of brown sugar and black friuts, a bit sweet and reach,but very drinkable. Great taste!

11.2 oz bottle pours brownish red with a finger of light brown head. Nose is earthy fruit, bread, berry, cola, cherry, grains. Taste is smooth medium maltiness, earthy berry, fruits, plum, fig, date, dark bread. Finish is smooth mildly bitter creamy bready fruit and berries. Delicious!
Redish brown ale with amazing foaming. It tastes delicious and has a good smell. Certainly, one of the best samples of Dubbel style.

Aroma is fruity and of Belgian sugars. DArk fruits like plum and raison. Taste is a extremely nice amd sweet malt character paired with bgian sugars and a light hopiness. Body is a cloudy orange with a frothy head that retains well.

Foam, light brown, in which you can see medium to fine bubbles is moderately abundant and persistent. Chimay Red nose is medium intensity, low malty and fruity. Palate very light bubbly and fruity. 
Aromas of cassis.
Pours a nice dark amber color with off white head. Light fruits, dark fruits, and just a hint of sweetness on the nose; all follow onto the palate. Medium-bodied, and finishes sweet.
botella 0.33cl. color cobrizo oscuro, aroma a frutos rojos, pasas, en boca es equilibrada, con toques a ciruela. recomendable
Dark, murky and cloudy brown color. Caramely malt, kind of yeasty taste. Excellent.

It pours a dark orange brown, aroma of brown sugar, sultanas and spice. The head is good and lasts throughout with agitation, medium carbonation. The taste matches the aroma, very sweet (too sweet for me) with late tastes of alcohol. Its not very bitter.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours in with a hazy copper-brown color, small white head. The aroma is quite overwhelming, apple sauce and spices. Taste is slightly sour, very dry. Palate is creamy, with a sparkling carbonation and a bitter and malty fnish. 

The taste was a bit disappointing, not as rich as expected. But I think I will rerate this beer soon.
Drank from bottle, 33cl. Pours a cloudy, orange/crimson colour, with a deep fruity aroma. Smooth on the palate, with a tangy and rich flavour

Flaske købt i Netto, 33 cl. 20 kr. er billigt for så en god øl, helt klart speciel, med dejlig duft og smag, flot i glasset med sin fyldige brune farve og flot hvidt skum, dejlig smags palate, med god balance imellem sødme og bitterhed, er på 7% vol. uden at være stærk/ sprittet, det er sq lækkert. Thumps up fra mig :-)
Hoppy nose, great head, beautiful appearance. Slightly bitter taste, but not that complex. Difficult to nail the right words. Citrus flavor?
The color is dark and clear. Toasted malt smell. Sweet, strong bitterness, malty and banana tasted.

My first Chimay. Pours a lovely blood orange color with a thick white head. Moderate lacing left behind.
Aromas of red fruit. Im decidedly underwhelmed by the aromas in general.
The palate is more lively and in addition to the red fruit there is a subtle toffee undertone.
I was expecting a bit more from my first Chimay given the reputation that precedes them.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 A Blend of caramel, malt and dark fruit on the nose. This is a smooth and rich Strong Belgian Ale, featuring caramel, a hint of banana, figs, and malt in the taste profile. The balance reflects the skill of the brewers and the medium body and fine effervescence add to the quality and blending of this beer.

Nutty caramel aroma. Nice medium brown colour. Big well rounded flavour and strong tasting. Packs a punch 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Considering this is the entry level Chimay offering, it is still outstanding. When I'm feeling a bit more casual, the Premiere Ale never disappoints. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Donkerbruine kleur, weinig beige schuim. Aroma van fruit, perzik. Smaakt fantastisch, beetje zoet, fruitig en bitter. Topper.

A bit cloudy - maybe poured in the yeast....copper colour. Tastes as expected. Browny Belgium. Would drink again but not amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: alcohol, peach.
Appearance: hazy ruby color, nice beige head.
Taste: medium bitterness (alcohol), peach, roasted malts.
Palate: full body and high carbonation, bitter alcohol finish.
Overall: I am strongly disappointed. Only alcohol and nothing more.

750ml bottle from the LCBO. Hazy deep amber pour with a big tan head.Nose is quite fruity with notes of yeast and some spice. Sweet carame and honey l start with some bread and a hint of cloves. A bit of bitterness balnces things in the finish. Full creamy mouth with active carbonation.
Chimay per ora con me fa 3/3 (rossa, blu e bianca). Very Good and economic beer.

Bottle from The Crown (JDW), Berkhampsted on 16 March 2014. Poured a clear, deep ruby, with a very large, fluffy off-white head. Aroma of Belgian yeasts, redcurrent, spice and sweet malts. Initial flavours of berries, bready malt, caramel and candy sugar. Rich mouthfeel with lots of gentle carbonation. Finish is bitter sweet dry grains, toffee, yeast esters and coriander. Ubiquitous, but a classic for a good reason.
Bottle. Dark ruby. Great head on pour. Creamy, rich mouthfeel. Smells of yeast and candi sugar. Tastes of burnt sugar, caramel, bubblegum.

Syrupy copper aroma and interesting diamond like head pattern. Deep red brown in colour. Cloudy for me but probably because shaken in bag. Typical Belgian yeast flavour but with some copper darkness to it. Somewhat soft, good texture.
A sweet, fruity aroma. Pours cloudy brown. Coffee, lemon, and dark fruity flavors. Heavy carbonation
Bottle. Pours brown. Smells like caramel and dark fruits. Maybe grapes. Taste is dark fruit and caramel. Sweet and smooth.

BR5
Bottled. brown with a huge slowly disappearing head. Some malts and a lot of sweetness. Very smooth as the description says. Has a bit of caramel as well. No alcohol in the palate but a bit too much carbonation. Very pretty beer but there are much better Dubs, especially for the price. Prefer the Blu as per most people.

Dun brun trouble, son service fait penser au champagne.Belle mousse mais courte. Les arômes me rappelle les noix, la caramel, un peu la mélasse. La levure est bien présent. Bref, belle double qui met les bases au style!

11.20oz bottle from Winslows in Greenville, N.C. Dark brown hue, murky clarity with mostly diminishing off-white fizzy head. Lively body particles. Virtually no lacing. Dark fruit aroma (grapes), some malt as it warms. Bitter dark fruit up front with the same finish. Lively carbonation on the tongue. I thought this was pretty tasty.
Pours a clear ruby with a foamy white head. Has a fajntly sweet honey and fruit aroma. Flavor is also fruit and honey, but more dry than sweet, which gives it a nice taste.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 Buena cabeza, cremosa, se adelgaza rápidamente. Color cobre oscuro. Aroma frutal y maltoso, complejo, intenso y agradable. Aterciopelada en boca, sabor acaramelado y lijeramente metálico. Retrogusto medio-largo.
Hyvä alkujuoma. yksikseen voi yhden juoda. Eliittikisakokous ja ruuan jälkeen jälkiruokana.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014 Bouteille de 330ml de rousse. Arôme de fruit fraise abricot. Le goût est plus agréable de l?arôme on retrouve de l?amertume mais aussi des notes agréable de caramel, sucre d?orge et de cassis. Très bon produit
One of the greatest beer ever. Its a show stopper. With the flavour of caramel, yeast with a bit of spice. All beer geeks must try this one or drop your membership card on your way out.
Moins courante que sa grande soeur bleue, on reste dans un très bon produit. Très maltée, aux arômes de grillé. Tout ça avec un alcool bien dosé. Un régal.
Mörkbrun med stort ljusbrunt skum! Doftar malt, russin och jäst! Smakar lite söt och russin. Ganska tun med mycket kolsyra och lite smak av russin. Ok öl!
Bottle, pours a reddish brown with a tan head. Tastes sweet with caramel and yeast notes. Nice warming alcohol finish.

750ml bottle from Tallinn, hazy dark amber colour, small fully vanishing frothy off-white head, virtually no lacing. Aroma of caramel, hay, dough and floral hops with a bit of fruitiness. Taste is initially slightly sweet and acidic, turning into a moderately bittersweet finish with an astringent feel. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Quite a nice Belgian ale, though the aroma was simpler than I expected.

Colour: shiny copper with hints of brown. Beige head.
Nose: yeast, ripe dark fruit, candy sugar, caramel, spices.
Flavours: coffee bitterness, dry hops, spices, forest fruits. Not as mellow as the aroma would suggest. 
Finish: warming, dry and bitter. Sweetness has gone.
Verdict: fine trappist, but a bit too jumping the fences between bitter and sweet for my taste.

Kolor rubinowy. Po otwarciu wystąpił gashing, przez co po nalaniu wytworzyła się bardzo mała piana, drobnopęcherzykowa, jasnokremowa. Aromat owocowy, słodkawy, chmielowy. Smak cytrusów, potem karmel i lekko wyczuwalna goryczka. Dość wysokie wysycenie tak jak w Triplu i Bleue.
Decent rad ale, little foam, carbonated, not impressive. Aroma: malt extract. Taste is the same.not my type
Aroma: caramel malts, hay and bread. Appearance: dark hazy brown, medium head. Taste: light sweets. Palate: dry bitters, yeasty and sweety malts. Overall: decent. Bottle at The Champion, Bayswater.
Pours a hazy, red brown, with minimal tan foam. Aroma of bread, raisin, leaves, and alcohol. Taste is sweet and bready. Medium thick feel and medium carb.

Bottle from SuperBest Amar Foodmarket, Copenhagen - fuzzy amber/copper coloured pour with puffy beige head. Medium sweet fruity and yeasty aroma and taste, toasty malty caramel, slightly nutty. Nice.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours hazy, brown with a orange/red hue to it. Big, foamy, creamy and inviting beige head which leaves good lacing. Aroma comes off quite strong with sweet malt, apricots, (apple)fruits and yeast. Underneath darker dried fruits, spices, biscuits and bread. Flavour is caramelized malt sweetness, fruity and with some earthy bread as well, Taste is very well balanced, not being too sweet, with a fine full-bodied palate; creamy, soft carbonation and mouth-fell. No hobs at all. Very good.

Hazy golden orange pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, yeast, caramel and bready. Taste of bready dough, yeast, caramel, banana and spice. Full bodied, higher carbonation and a slightly dry finish. Very enjoyable beer
Hazy brown. Frothy offwhite head. Yeast, red apples and dried fruit. Taste the same, with soft toffee. Creamy mouthfeel, soft aftertaste.
bottle some time ago bought at the local supermarket. hazy amber pour with a off white head. caramel, dried fruits, yeast, raisins, bread. everage carbonated
Je nai pas vraiment aimé ceci et peut être du au condition bière chaude mais cela ma laisser un mauvais souvenir

Bottle. Pours red brown with fine tan head. Good retention and thin lace. Aroma is strong fruity, banana, fig, fairly sweet, spices. Flavor is fruity, plum, apricot, date, with a caramelized, malty, bread finish. Soft to moderate carbonation, medium body, and smooth texture.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.

Deep amber to ruby, slightly hazy. Beige, persistent head. Aroma of dark caramel, toffee, flowers and buscuits. Slightly fizzy mothfeel. Well balanced. Taste of caramel biscuits. Refreshing rather than sweet.

This beer is one of the great beer that is easy to get very in terms of distribution and cost-effective first. It is a taste of the basics of Trappist beer, but again surprised the good that it can try to return to drink also has a complex flavor. Fit very well in recipes and it is a thing which is easy to drink to people of beer novice.

Pours amber red with a small off white head. Smells nutty and caramelly, tastes the same and for me kind of one noted and quite boring. The trappist yeast flavors are not present and this is for me just boring lightly toasted malt with some earthy caramel nuttiness.

Dark amber color. Aroma is yeast, dried fruits. Taste is lightly roasted malt, spices and apple and raisins. Essentially no hops. I enjoyed the yellow a lot more, but this is obviously an excellent beer.
Fantastic! Smells and tastes like apples, dates, honey and walnuts. It has a beautiful almond color. Perfectly balanced.
Tap at Black Door. A: Red, cloudy. S: Malts, molasses. Some subtle citrus. T: Very malty up front, some acidneed. Continues malty, no hops to be found. M: Very heavy. O: Too sweet.
Bottle pour to Trappist glass. Hazy light brown-gold. Yeasty aroma. Tastes of dark fruit, a little caramel. Creamy and smooth palate.
Dark amber colored with a white head. Fruity aroma. High carbonation. Caramel and citrus taste with a slightly coffee undertone. Creamy aftertaste. Pretty decent dark trappist.

The first beer tasted in a delightful evening of stating and scoring Belgian Trappists beers. I dont read the beer notes above before marking which probably explains why my description differs greatly from what I am supposed to taste - maybe its my palate..? Anyway, I got some lovely rich velvety chocolate / coffee undertones which complemented perfectly the dark brown colour.
Drank in a drunker stupor but think fulfilled my belief im not too bothered about trappist beers - just not my thing.
Pours brown. Smells of dark fruits, caramel, and grapes. Taste is of dark fruits and caramel. Leaves a great lingering taste in your mouth.

Draught @ Black Door, Helsinki. Reddish brown with a thin off-white head. Yeasty, malty, sweetish aroma. Yeast, estery flavour with maltodextrose-like sweetness. Sweet, yeasty finish with a hint of Saaz-like hops.

DATE TASTED: February 10, 2014... GLASSWARE: Chimay 150th anniversary goblet...OCCASION: PSU/Illinois Sunday... APPEARANCE: dark mahogany body; thick, creamy off-white head that clings to the glass; cascading lacing... AROMA: bright, aromatic hops; some apple and pear bake in a soft, doughy aura; some ginger or allspice as well...PALATE: almost light-bodied, dry, and beguilingly drinkable presence; smooth and inviting...TASTE: grape, grapefruit, and soft pine resin--soft, pleasant, after-dinner cordial warmth; slightly acidic... OVERALL: revisiting the first beer to make me say, "Whoa," Keanu style--and the beer does not disappoint to create a drinking experience where the beer IS the moment...the Chimay family grows in strength, but the opener in the sampler outperforms most other breweries "first-ups by a long shot with drinkability and strength to spare...

Burnt orange/brown color. Bready toasted malt, faint roast malt, yeast, Belgian candy, and a hint of banana. Flavor is toasted biscuit with burnt edges, Belgian candy, and light fruity esters. Residual toast and roast. Heavy carbonation, prickly mouthfeel. Classic.
Ffffyvn chdufifjfkcjfkffifkfigivivkvkvjckccjcjcjcjcjjcjcjc via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Has a deep smell of caramel, grapes, roasted malts and dark fruits. Pours dark cloudy amber with a beige creamy head. Tastes of caramel, roasted malts, figs, dates and nuts. A very champagne-like body to it.

Looks good: hazy ruby with thin but persisten creamy white film of foam. Fresh, pure aroma is fruity with Belgian yeast, bit red berries, woody notes. Lively and nuanced. Medium to full body, soft and round feel, sweet with balancing woody notes, long tasty finish dries bit. I like it, I like it a lot. Classic beer in all areas, grest flavors, look, aromas, feel, balance. Lively and nuanced with lots of character.
Pours brown with some floating particles and a small white head. The aroma is fruity and the taste is a bland fruity bubble gum with moderate carbonation.
Cerveja escura com tonalidade avermelhada , complexa porém muito equilibrada. provada inúmeras vezes e aprovada todas elas. Está na minha opinião é uma das melhores cervejas do mercado.

Bière brune orangée, très voilée par une multitude de particules qui semblent former un brouillard au sein du breuvage, bonne effervescence, surmontée dun bon col beige, très mousseux, dense et persistant. Arômes surtout maltés, pain grillé, cassonade, caramel, cola avec présence de petits fruits foncés (surtout du raisin, mais aussi cerise noire, datte, prune), de levure belge et dune touche épicée (clou de girofle, muscade, piment de la Jamaïque). Le nez est assez agréable et complexe, mais il est bien trop timide. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue avec une belle onctuosité, cest soyeux au palais. Au goût, cest bien malté en entrée de bouche, pain grillé, noisette et saveurs de caramel, cassonade et cola, sans pour autant que cela soit très sucré. Cest suivi dun houblon légèrement herbacé et citronné qui apporte une petite amertume et une petite acidité fort intéressantes. Les petits fruits foncés accompagnent bien le tout, et on retrouve également la levure belge et les épices en trame de fond. Excellente intégration des saveurs entre elles, équilibre parfait, excellente bière! On laurait simplement aimé un peu plus intense, surtout au nez.

33cl Bottle from supermarket.
Beautiful red/brounish colour and a thick creamy head.
What strikes me most about this beer is the aroma, a brewers yeast feast!

Hace poco tomé la Chimay Triple de barril y me quedé con ganas. De las Chimay que he probado hasta ahora me gustan todas, aunque esta la veo un poco por debajo de la azul y la blanca. Aun así, me podría tomar medio barril si lo tuviera. Una de las buenas cosas de las Chimay es que la graduación casi ni se nota, a pesar de los 7 grados, pero pillas un puntito la mar de gracioso, como el que tengo ahora mismo mientras escribo esto. Al tomarla se nota cierto amargor que es lo que la hace parecer más fuerte, pero se disipa en poco tiempo, lo que la hace más fácil de beber que otras con menos alcohol. Muy buena cerveza, de las buenas belgas. Lo peor que tiene es el precio.
Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with quickly disappearing light brown head. Aroma is plums, dark fruit, cocoa, malt, hint of spices. Flavor is malt, cocoa, fruit, yeast. A bit faint in aroma and flavor.

Bottle in Kathmandu. Very hard to find anything else than pale lagers so was very happy to find this! Brown color with tan head. Aroma of dark fruits and some sweet caramel and dark sugars. Taste follows aroma with a nice mouth feel and small bubbles. Good and much appreciated in this dry beer desert :P

11.2 oz bottle poured into a goblet. Aromas of uncooked dough and grapes hit the nose first accompanied by a very minor astringent quality (just enough to give a warm tickle to the nose). Theres some other sweet fruit smells combined with the grapes which, half way through turn more towards raisins and other dried fruits. Its a very cloudy (foggy might be a better term) rusty orange liquid topped by an huge, thick, fluffy, off-white head that retains quite nicely. A medium sweetness balanced by a light / medium-light bitterness and light, pleasing sour hit the tongue with an umami quality to it. Its a full, creamy beer in the mouth that finishes with a light herby / hoppy taste. The astringency is present on the palate in very light tones along with the brief hinting of alcohol. It leaves a creamy fruity aftertaste.

from a 33 CL bottle to a Belgian glass. 
Aroma: A sweet malty aroma with well balance notes of cherry 
Appearance: A gorgeous cloudy amber tint with a well balanced tan head
Taste: A well Balanced carbonated beer. Bitter, Sweet, delightfulness, but not as good as the other Chimays. 
Ugami: a bright carbonated beer with an oily texture and a long lasting cherry finish. 
A little disappointed, but still very good. The other two were much better, but completely different styles too...
Date limite de consommation: octobre 2013. Déception, la bière se conserve assez mal. Peu ou aucune évolution dans le gout, au contraire, elle semblait même en avoir perdu.
Colour is hazy amber with brown head. Aroma sweet dried fruity esters, caramel and candi sugar. Taste sweet fruity esters, along with brown sugars, malty. Average carbonation. Great beer :)

Classic dubbel all the way. I think of this style as quad light. A bit less dark fruit, and a bit less ABV. And this one is quite good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rusty colour. A bit of bitterness but well balanced by the fruit. A hint of juniper berry, astringent. Medium body, lively in the mouth. Medium long finish. Nice beer.
Sparkling amber. Lukter parfyme og smaker friskt............................
Red color sour tast. Fruty caramel tast. Complex an exciting. Good beer. TWF. In sunde

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une jolie brune avec une mousse claire, en bouche elle commence sur les notes grilles avec de la noix noisettes et une fin caramel. Enfin on a une petite touche de banane qui fini la biere . Cest très bon

Dark red, slightly hazy colour. Fruity, dark cherry and blackberry aroma. Very full taste, fruityness again, pleasantly combined with a medium bitterness. carbonation is quite strong. Medium long finish with some hints of ripe banana. Very well composed.

Bottle. Pours mahogany with medium, nice head. Aroma of caramel, spices, dried fruits with light alcohol note. Rich and pleasant. Taste is sweet with bitter finish. Medium body. High carbonation. Very good, rich beer.

Clear red amber, cream head
Dry fruit, passito, raisins, sweet rum, apple
Sweet with a lightly astringent ending
Dry fruits, nuts, Caramelized apple, passion fruit

Nice amber head, but dissipated too quickly. Lovely rich deep brownish red, a bit hazy color and the smell is truly exquisite - rich and fruity at first, lots of yeast at the end. The taste is full-bodied, with sweetness first, then a bit fruity and, again, yeast as the grand finale. Not much bitterness in it, but thats just fine - a nice, mellow ale. Overall a very fine Trappist ale, I would give it a second tasting any day.

Bottle, 33 cL. Home. A clear mahogany beer with a light beige large head not very persistant. Aroma of spices, herbs, caramel, bread, apricot. First, medium sweet then light sour and bitter are getting stronger. Full body, lively carbonation. Sour sweet finish. Another nice dubbel with good hop and yeast aroma.

Bottle from the Albert Heijn. Beautiful copper colored beer with a creamy head, CO2 level is excellent. Soft aroma with fruity nuances. A silky taste with a slight bitterness. The finsh is soft and sweet which makes this beer complete. A very nice Dubbel, nearly as good as Westmalle Dubbel.
This is one of my new brother-in-laws favorites. Pretty good can definitely taste the Daniel ale.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 33cl in a Delirium Tremens glass. Pours a red almost ruby colour with a plentiful white head. Quite thin for a Belgian but perfectly suits the style. Very drinkable and the perfect partner for cured meats with cheese and bread. Wonderfully, balanced and one I shall revisit frequently. Marvellous.
Bottle. Clear brown pour with offwhite head. Sweet aroma. Taste is balanced with hints of malt and yeast. High carbonation.
UPDATED: APR 11, 2014 A Chimay red é um pouco mais suave em sabores do que a Blue. O teor alcoólico se equilibra bem com o malte torrado e adocicado.
Light brown/red. Some tan head. Pepper, yeast - typical belgian aroma. Some malt. Quite thin mouth feel. Balanced taste. Good, but not a favourite style. Quite warming.
Poured in a tulip glass. Good head retention and cloudy, caramel appearance. Slight yeast aroma and flavor. Consistency is a little thick. Tastes a little fruity. Nice but I prefer the Blue.

Pours a hazy brown colour with a white head that quicly disappears. Dough, typical yeastiness of the belgian yeast, som baking powder and a hint of caramel. Flavour is banana, belgian yeast, caramel and some candy sugar. Good body and medium carbonation. A quality beer indeed, but it doesnt manage to stick out that much between all the other dubbels.
Fruity explosion of dried fruits and caramel. Extremely malty and slightly creamy with soft foam sticking itself to the glass edge.

750ml bottle. Aroma: Smoked nuts and notes of peach.
Appearance: It pours a hazy brown colour with a small head which has a long lasting head retention. Taste: Traditional Belgian malt with a dried fruity taste which leads to a spicy finish. Very lively carbonation which takes away the overall enjoyment of this otherwise great belgian strong ale.

Pours a cloudy dark ruby color with light tan head that settles down to an uneven layer. Nose has notes of caramel, yeast, dark syrup and 
Taste is bittery sweet with a smooth and long dry finish. Carbonation is lively and the palate is quite rich and oily. The alcohol warms you up nicely. Overall quite nice but a little coarse in the flavor.
Pours a very dark copper with a creamy white head. Classic yeast smell with a hint of sweetness. Lovely taste.

Aromas of fruits, raisins, floral sweetness and sour. Milder than the "Blue" in a better way. Poured a very thick head dark copper. You can taste the fruits, malt, hops and a slight sourness or "astringency". Balanced overall beer.

Aroma: Licorice,toasty, caramel, vineous, hoppy, peppery, 
Appearance: Hazy copper/brown body. Large off-white, long lasting head. Lasting 
Flavour: Licorice, medium-high bitterness, medium-high sweetness. Lingering bitterness. Moderately dry finish, raisin, 
Palate: Highly carbonated. Medium body. Low alcohol warming
Overall: Nice. Easy drinking 

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
18B. Belgian Dubbel
Bottle to chalice. Dark brown red pour with a thin off white head. Nose is dark fruit, belgian yeast. Taste is medium carbonation, fig, yeast, sweet Brown sugar.
Sniffs of soapy spiced breads. Taste is chalky wheat and yeast. Mouthfeel is fizzy and light (the only part I didnt mind). Nothing here I really care for.
330ml bottle. Dark red beer. Metallic aroma. Taste of bitter toffee with fruit overtones. Quite strong. Perfect accompaniment to crisps or nuts.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2014 Very nicely balanced between the bitter hoppy and the sweetish caramel dry-fruit taste. A very enjoyable Belgian trapiste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Color is burgundy, frothy head, lacing. Aroma of cherries, banana, malt. apicot, yeast. Taste: caramel, banana, bread, dried fruits.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Mooie roodbruine kleur en perfect schuimkopje. Subtiel aroma. Volmondig e fruitig in de aanzet, evoluerend naar aangenaam bitter

Mist drifting out of the bottle is a nice effect. Pours auburn with a frothy head. Weak metallic aroma. Dried fruit flavors of apricot and raisin, sweet medium malt like caramel. Lively carbonation. Medium bodied. Very enjoyable to drink, but I dont get much out of the aroma; smell is the achilles heel of this beer in my opinion. I paired it with the Chimay beer cheese which was awful, but that may have been my fault because of poor temperature control.
Hazy amber body with a nice brown head. Aroma is sweet and fruity, raisins and caramel. Taste is fruity, grainy, sweet with the right amount of biterness. Very enjoyable beer.

Un peu moins bonne que la bleu, couleur cuivrée foncée avec un col plus résistant que la bleu. Nez de fruits rouges caramel et épices. En bouche elle se prend moins bien que la bleu mais elle tout aussi savoureuse avec le même mélange que le nez. Une bonne trappiste tout de même!

Pours a hazy coppery red with a nice thick and frothy light brown head. Aroma sweet dried fruity esters, apricot, caramel and candi sugar. Taste is grainy, figs, prunes, apricot with some light caramel and sugary sweetness on the finish. Mouthfeel is slick and silky smooth. Overall the beer is extremely well balanced & too easy to drink at 7 percent.

33 cl bottle. Hazy dark amber with a dense lasting tan head. Aroma has sweet raisins, figs, candi sugar, caramel, esters and a light mineral touch. Taste is light caramel and dried fruit sweetness up front with a crisp biscuity finish. Quite lively small bubble carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle.

A- Raisins, apricots, spices.

A- Reddish brown color, dark liquid, thick tan head.

T- Notes of apricots and raisins.

P- Medium body, smooth texture, average carbonation, spicy finish.

O- A good Trappist beer but not my favorite Chimay.

Deep, burnt orange colour, thin grey-white head that quickly evaporated; no big aroma, perhaps a little baked orange; first thing you notice on tasting is the high carbonation; then toasted malt, a sugary sweetness, oranges and strawberries; some spice and increasingly yeasty in the finish; accessible, and deserves to be as widely available as it is.

750 bottle, pours a nice reddish copper with a fluffy head. Mild sweet fruity aromas with caramels and raisins. Smooth well balanced and yet, soft complex flavors of sweet fruity esters, along with brown sugars, bananas, some mild spiceyness. Nice Belgian characters. Very pleasant with a dry finish.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2014 I have had this a number of times on draft and from the bottle. Wonderful sweet and fruity aroma. Somewhat reddish, brown with a nice thick head with lots of lacing in the glass. Somewhat hazy and thick with great carbonation and crisp bitter taste in the back of the mouth. This beer is never disappointing. Love to let it sit and warm in the glass as I sip.
Fruity apricot aroma. Pours cloudy brown with a thin white head. Good flavor, goes down smooth.
Lovely aroma, very fruity. Gorgeous lace. Nice as it warms, clearly Chimay. Lovely oil mouth.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 You know that some beers will be great before you even get the chance to drink them. With its copper shade and generous head, Chimay Red looks wonderful. The smell is also amazing with its grainy, fruity notes. The taste is truly reflective of the Trappist style - some caramel with playful touches of fruitiness. Carbonation is flawless. While this ale isnt completely perfect, its pretty damn close.

Review from notes on 05/27/10
Poured from bottle to New Belgium tulip.

Pours a foggy brown. Many ribbons accumulate into a small, thin top layer of silken tan foam. The nose on this screams classic dubbel. Nice marzipan, roasty, light molasses. This ale is complex with hints of marzipan, apple and burnt caramel on the tongue. The beer is light enough in carbonation to remain light on the tongue, but sediment leaves tongue remaining grainy. Overall, this beer is very drinkable and should be sampled by anybody who enjoys belgians, or is just wanting something new and dependable.

Serving type: bottle

12-22-2010

I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish-brown with a tan head. Taste sweet, fruity, lightly bitter. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle @ home. Orange color, average beige head. Aroma, biscuit, grapefruit notes, bread, malty notes, herbs, leather, rubber. Taste no sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, salty, umami. Light body, bit watery, lively carbon, long lasting moderated bitter finish. Interesting but not really my style.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Old rating rerated 25.12.2013, 0,33l bottle (best before end 2011) @ home:
Soft gusher. Big fizzy shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, caramel malts, raisins, sugar, butterscotch, dates, honey, dried fruits, hints of strawberry. Taste is caramel malts, dark sugar, butterscotch, raisins, honey, grass, nuts, burnt caramel, hints of licorice and coffee. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice aged.
Dark cloudy brown. Balanced fruits, primarily raisins and tropical. Taste is mild, fizzy and balanced.

A great looking beer with a cloudy reddish brown colour and a creamy off white head. Aroma of yeast with a hint of spice. Complex taste, of cloves, pepper, and dried fruit. With a slightly astringent palate of spice.

Slightly dark hazy brown amber pour with an Okay off white head. Malty smell with some caramalised sugars and some mild alcohol. Probably some spice in there too. Pretty spicy and bitter taste. Not overly sweet, peppery aftertaste. Medium bodied with easy going carbonation. Overall not a bad one but also not a favorite.

750ml bottle, poured into a Chimay Trappist glass. Appearance is opaque maroon red with a large thick beige head with good retention. Aroma of herbs, spices, bread, and a hint of banana and apricots. Taste of bread, caramel, herbs, spices, raisins and banana. Light-medium sweetness and medium-light bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall another good beer from Chimay, however I prefer the Tripel and Grande Réserve,

750 ml bottle from LCBO Barrie ON. Smooth pour with a very nice firm 2 finger head. Delicious modest flavour. 7% ABV is well hidden. I can not describe the flavour only can state delicious. Paired this with pan seared tuna and now wishing I could have this and the tuna more.

Der Geruch ist malzig-süßlich und leicht alkoholisch. 
Der Antrunk ist vollmundig mit cremigem Schaum. Insgesamt finde ich das Bier aber etwas Aromenschwach. Es ist zwar sehr schön vollmundig-cremig, aber mir fehlt die Aromentiefe etwas. Der Hauptteil ist mild-fuchtig-süffig mit Anklänge an Bananen oder Pfirsiche, aber im Nachgeschmack bleibt fast exakt der selbe mild-hefige Eindruck auf der Zunge - vielleicht noch zusammen mit einer leichten Süße. Herbe ist kaum wahrnehmbar. 
Das Bier ist sehr angenehm zu trinken, aber die Aromen könnten stärker ausgeprägt sein. 
Trotzdem sehr schön!


Test vom 18.3.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,10,13,11,12,12 - 11,70

The very first thing I notice was the colour, I have never in my life seen such a beautiful beer, the russet brown liquid seemed to glow from within with it own luminesance and it is capped with the most wonderful head of foam. The aromatics were a wonderful restrained mixture of black currents, malts and spicy yeast. It is a medium bodied beer with nice carbonation, but what makes this beer stand out for me was the flavour balance, you can really tell that the monks have had centuries to perfect this beer. The flavours are exactly what the aroma suggest with malts and dark dried fruits making sweet love on the tongue at the start and moving to a beautiful climax of well balanced bitterness and spicy yeast.

Bottle split with SP at the Merchants, Rugby, 16/12/13.
Dark reddish amber with a good sized ight beige head that retains well.
Nose is caramel, candied sugars, light spice, bread dough, fruit loaf, light metallic ring.
Taste comprises dark fruits, brown sugars, fruit loaf, cake mix, dates.
Medium bodied, light spritzy carbs affording easy drinkability, sweet closure.
Decent dubbel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Poured from 330mL bottle. Cloudy, copper brown with some sediment and an off off-white head. Dark red fruit, dates, yeast and some caramel. Sweet malt and yeast flavour, but only a light-medium body. Not nearly as complex as I would have hoped.

33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy copper with lots of off white head that lingers. Aroma of caramel, raisins and clove, floral. Taste is cherry and apricot fruit, caramel, raisin. Finish has a touch of spice.

Bottle: cloudy copper to brown. Light head. Massive malty nose. Very dense. Loads of grain. Dried fruit. Fig, raisin and date. Dry. Low to moderate bitterness. Almost sour feel due to acidity but clean. Medium weight and length. Caramel, cream, malt, dry fruit, dry citrus rind. Moderate bitterness and hop on the finish. 
Very solid. Not great.
Agree with the copper color description. Nice head with an almost creamy complexion. The taste, whilst magnificent, finding hard too characterise. Have to drink a fee more...

Bronse/kopperfarget med medium høyt skum. Gjær og tørket frukt i aromaen, samt noe vag sødme. Smaken er aprikos, tørket frukt og gjær. God i munnen, mye kullsyre. Frisk, men med en god bitterhet i ettersmaken. Ettersmaken sitter ikke lenge, men sitter ganske godt.

This beer has a frothy head. It's caramel in colour and taste with well balanced bittering hops . It tastes like what I'd expect from a Belgium Bruin. A very good commercial beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very fruity aroma with field berries, apricot, with sugar cane sub notes. Strength is medium with a slight fading out at the end. 

Appearance: Dark copper, hazy, with a good sparkling. Head is showing thick, rocky and long lasting. Head is not sticking very much on glass and lacing is fading rapidly.

Taste: Entering mouth with notes of caramel and rapidly developing a subtle lactic yeast profile. Finish is slightly hoppy. Licorice notes are mixing with caramel to give a candy impression. Mouth feel is sparkling, pleasant, his texture is semi oily. Flavor balance is good between malt / hop and yeast.
On ne peut se retenir de la comparer à la Chimay Bleue. Elle manque de saveurs explosives et de raffinement par rapport à sa grande sur. Elle demeure néanmoins excellente.
Semi hazy coppery body, offwhite head. Aroma has some darl bready malt, fruits, fruity yeast and some spiciness. Flavour is sweet and yeasty spicy. Nice one.

330ml bottle at home. Pours hazy dark brown, thin off white head. Aromas of plum, blackcurrant, mixed spice, Belgian yeast. Taste brings all these together wonderfully. Texture is creamy, finish is fruity and long. Great stuff.

One of my favorite beers. Smells like a nice beer. Non homogenous appearance throughout. Darker in the middle. Taste is complex. Multiple tastes required to put words to this delicate beauty. Palate similarly complex. I found this beer in a 750 mL bottle at my local Costco. Good beer to give as a gift for sharing and celebration. Would really enjoy drinking this whole bottle in one sitting myself.
Sampled side by side by side with the other chimays. Clearish amber pour with ample near white head. Toasted biscuits and raisins and floral. Classic dubbel. Really good. My favorite of the group.
Very high milky head, hazy brown color, malty aroma. Fruity notes plus some typical Belgian hops. Flat bitter finish, but indistinct. Quite balanced.
Classic belgian dubbel, nice and well balanced taste with a pleasant finish and just the right amount of alcoholic feeling. Easily available in a lot of supermarkets here in Italy. 33cl bottle.
On tap at Biercab. Hazy brown colour with tan head. Malt, dark fruits aroma. Sweet, dark fruits, raisins and malt taste. Medium body.

Dark copper, long lasting off-white head. Dark fruits, some gunpowder. Medium sweet, some dark fruits and alcohol. Very high drinkability. Medium to high carbonation, medium mouthfeel. Hard to describe, but very nice.

Bottle poured a murky orange-brown hue w/ small beige head creating a lasting cap. Moderate fruity aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are apricot, vodka, and straw. Medium bodied, average carbonation, and creamy mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Pours a reddish copper with a foamy amber head that lasts the whole time and laces. Aromas of malt, fruit, yeast and spice. Flavor is the same with a creamy lightly fizzy mouthfeel. Good balance.
One of the best dubbels I have ever had. I can sum up all the typical dubbel flavours (since this is a pretty standard dubbel) but what matters is the balance in it. Its great, no need to say more.

Pours a hazy brown with a medium offwhite head that leaves fair lacing. Aroma is of darker fruits, brown sugar. Taste is indeed sweet and full of raisins. A lightly bitter finish. Body is medium-full with a slightly aggressive carbonation at first (it even tried to gush). A classic, I thought Id enjoy it less now but it is still really good even if not sour or bourbon barrel-aged.
Great beer! Its quite reddish, almost brown... great beer, not better than the blue, but a excelent dubbel. I preffer the westmalle dubbel!
Quality blend of Belgium malts and yeast. Reddish brown color and average head. Aroma and taste were in the middle. Enjoyed it, but no reason to pay the premium price!
Perhaps I was waiting too much from this. This tastes more like an adult people drink, so its not for me, although quite close!

Pour leaves a rocky head which dissipates quickly leaving a hazy amber carmel looking beer in the glass. The nose is muted but with under tones of floral and citrus. The taste is of raisin and bread but not the body of other Trappist beers you may have had. Like the head, the initial flavour dissipates quickly leaving a pleasant after taste.

A: Browinsh/Mild Amber Hue, Passes Mild Light, Thick Off White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Bready, Raisins, Mild Dark Plums

T: Raisins, Sweet Bread, Plums, Mild Red Grapes

M: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet

Overall, a really solid drinking dubble that has stood the test of time for a reason.

Aroma: wheat, raisins, fruits, yeast. Appearance dark brown, with light tan head, head stays for some time. Taste sweet, raisins, caramel. Sweet aftertaste with very light hints of bitterness. Medium carbonation.
Overall: great dubbel, maybe little too sweet for my taste.

Aparência ocre, espuma não muito densa, mas que durou até o fim. Aroma me lembrou de champanhe, levemente cítrico. Bem carbonatada, preenchendo toda a boca. Ótima trapista, muito bem equilibrada e com boa drinkability.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brune aux teintes rougeâtres et trouble, avec un épais collet de couleur crème. Nez dagrumes, de fruits et de levures. Goût malté, légèrement caramélisé, dalcool et de raisins. Une amertume à la fin qui laisse une finale un peu sèche et métallique.

Poured with a massive thick light tan coloured head that slowly produced a virtually opaque brown liquid. The thick head retained well but laced poorly. Aroma sweet malt and a trace of spice. Taste caramel malt, spice and an awful bitter after-taste. Light to medium body. Rough bitter finish. Not my style.

33cl bottle. Poors a dark ruby color with brownish lasting head. Aroma of fruits, caramel. Smooth in the mouth, caramel, apples, slight bitter in the end. Not as great as expected, still perfect choice for Autumn season. A must try, along with Chimay Bleue.

Not a whole lot on the nose. Fruity, with a spice that comes after. Thin palate, decent carbonation. Not bad

Most supermarkets sell this beer in Belgium, but after drinking several times this beer.. I dont really like it.

Incredibly good ale. Lovely dark turbid beer with medium sticky foam. Aroma of fruits is strong and easy to define. Palate is extraordinary pleasant and mild. Carbonation as it should be. Slight bitterness in the aftertaste underlines its outstanding quality

Pours deep red. Lots of red beers tonight. Nose is yeast, dough, sweet caramel. Taste is sweet nuttiness, high carbonation matched with a dry bitterness but is a little metallic. Alcohol is lower in this chimay and I think this beer misses it.

Aroma frutado, coloração marrom turva, espuma branca e persistente. 
Sabor frutado, complexo, amargor nao muito forte e pouco adocicada. Excepcional trapista.

Appearance with reddish (dark) color and high, dense and persistent head of foam.
Fruity and sweet aroma.
In the mouth: caramel malt, grape and bitter sweet.
Belgian classic, very good!

(Bottle): Pours a dark red-brown, medium off white head. Aroma of dark fruits, belgian yeast, dough and malt. Flavour contains similar notes. Overall quite underwhelming, especially when compared to the white and blue chimays which are fantastic.

Bottle. Deep red, big off-white frothy head and heavy lacing. Aromas of malt, plenty of yeast, toffee, biscuit and just a hint of banana. Flavours of cherry, Christmas pudding, biscuit, toffee, prunes, yeast and banana. Incredibly smooth, long, rich palate.
strong, aroma, all kinds of flavours but overall not that good. red hazy beer. taste has notes of alcohol, and sweet fruits. fizzy carbonation. decent beer but the bad destroys the good.
A good looking dark reddish/brown beer. Poors out to a fine foamy head. Quite sweet in taste, a little too sweet for my taste though...

Once again, Chimay is fabulous. I think that the quality of the red, white, & blue are related to their alcohol content, with the highest content beer actually being the best. Nonetheless, all are worderful

Hazy copper pour. Very active carbonation. Nose is welcoming. Taste is tart and crisp, reminiscent of apples and berries. A refreshing malty backbone with a hint of hops to finish.

From bottle the The Old Monk. Fresh apple, malt aroma. Malty, yeasty, fig, raisin taste. Creamy and heavy body. Minimal alcohol presence. Good carbonation. Long finish leaving the taste of old apples. Overall a flavorful beer. Unique malt taste.

Brown in color. Taste of prune and bread. Balanced, but not my fav offering from Chimay.

Cor cobre com creme bege não persistente. Aroma de malte, passas, banana, toffe. Sabor com dulçor, baixo amargor, açúcar mascavo. Ao final, um calor alcoólico persiste na boca, baixo para médio amargor.

Poured from a 750ml bottle. Big malty, yeasty goodness. Dark stone fruits, prune, dried cherries, toffee, some floral notes. This is a great beer. I always forget how much I like it.

Excellent beer! Caramel, amber hue. Soft head. Fruity, sweet sensibility. Smooth was down. Brilliant and grand aftertaste. Unbashedly and unapologetically great brew! If you love your Belgian Ales like me this is a good starting and finishing point.

Appearance: a nice, deep burgundy body with an off white head. The head dropped by about half but remained constant throughput. 
Smell: a sweet, almost burnt caramel smell. With a hint of fig. 
Taste: enough fizz to hide the heavy alcohol content. A taste of sweet bread but quite malty and a bit bitter.
I had this from thr bottle and overall found it to be an incredibly enjoyable.

Bottle. Aroma has nut, malt and yeast. 

Taste has malt, some banana, sour fermented fruit. Drinkable but pretty dull and rounded on the corners. Makes for a solid regular choice but nothing special.
Good aroma,incresingly strong flavour, sweet with a dry aftertaste, woody at the end.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 Bottle: Murky brown with a weird tan tint; highly opaque with tiny sediment particles floating every which way. Gray-tinted head sits thin atop the muddled beer. Aroma consists of caramel malts, licorice, dates, figs, warming phenols, and a touch of Candi sugar. Pretty standard aroma for a dubbel, but a little mild. Taste is right there with toasted malts, dark fruits, burnt sugar, grape flavors, slight medicinal notes in the finish with the phenol. Not that spicy, some sweet ester-y aftertastes. Decent dubbel, though far from my favorite.

Tasting og this and rochefort 8 paired with gorgonzola. Dark amber with white foamy head. Aroma is malty, raisins, yeast, dough. Taste is dried apricot, malty, yeasty and some bread, Tasty. Appears a little thin compared to rochefort but a nice brew this
750 ml bottle pours a dark amber color with a nice white head. Aromas of bread, yeast sweet malt. Medium bodied, well balanced, very good.

Draft to goblet
Strawberry, raspberry, and wheat. Deep, somewhat opaque, reddish brown with a thin white head. Taste is orange rind, wheat, and yeast.
Belle couleur noire-rouge. Bon parfum fruité. Bière legerement malté fruité avec un peu de sucré qui prend le dessus. Pas mal, mais un peu moins bien que sa gde soeur chimay bleue.

Flaska från Der Beerkoonig Amsterdam. Tyvärr ett "fickljummet" exemplar jag testade men ändå OK. Tycker blue är godare,

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017 Bardzo szampańskie było to piwo, co w połączeniu z wytrawnym, łagodnym ale pełnym smakiem i kwiatowym aromatem tworzyło fascynujące połączenie. Bottle @ home. Pours with a dark amber, hazy colour. Large, quite diminishing, off-white frothy head. Aroma is moderately malty, with notes of bread and little notes of chocolate, coffee and licorice; little hoppy, with notes of herbs; little yeasty. Addional notes of wood.
