UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Pours a ruby brown with a thick off-white head. This is quite the tasty dubbel. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, some yeast, nuts, somewhat sugary. Ive been quite impressed with the Chimay beers.

Good traditional Dubbel. Bready malt aroma with yeast. Soft brown color with slightly tan head. The beer has some weight and was a little creamy. Carbonation at a good level. This was well balanced and had some fruity esters and a little yeasty. A good example of the style.

Bottle at campsite cafe in Spa. Hazed red chestnut brown with a thin cratered cream head. Aroma is yeasty with sweet cara and raisin. Flavour is rich malts. Dry finish. Palate is effervescent slightly thin.

330ml Bottle. This pours a clear brown body capped with a slightly off white head that disappears leaving virtually no lacing. It has a sweet fruity aroma with the slightest hint of caramel. As you would expect with a Belgian of this strength, its very sweet - it also has dark fruits, banana, wheat and malts which lead to a dry bitter finish. This is one of the few Belgian beers available in the uk and theres a lot better ones to be found over there.
Pours a ruby brown color with a thick off white head that lingers. Distinct Belgian smell. Taste is malty and dry. Good, not great

Chimay is an old classic that I've been drinking for 15+ years. It is still just as good as the first time! Bold but smooth. Great head and malty good. Chimay is the perfect belgian ale.

Dark brown, quick modest head. Raisins and caramel. Rather sweet, only slight bitterness towards the end. Fizzy carbonation.Tastes like a homebrew, really, prefer Chimays other stronger products.

25cl on tap into tulip. 

Overall: great to fially have this on tap. Really enjoyable drink. 

Appearnce: deep brown terrific head

aroma: furit, caramel, complex

Bottle from ambrosetti in Berlin. Murky copper colour, thick head. Pleasant, yeast aroma. A more restrained taste than the bleue, caramel, very pleasant. Palate is good, some fizz. Very pleasant beer, it is not as intense as the bleue, which makes it a good alternative.

Flaska från SB drucken på ölföreningen. En ung flaska som var väl söt och väldigt bubblig och stickig i munnen. Karamell, söta äpplen, fikon, russin och en hel del alkohol och brunt socker. Känns omogen och ofärdig, hade vunnit mycket på lagring men även nu riktigt bra.

750ml bottle. Pours a clear, dark ruby with a one finger, off-white head that quickly fades to a film and ring. Aroma is of spicy dark fruits, yeast, and sugar. Just perfect, little aroma tho, smooth taste, not terrible afters. Minimal bitters. White fluffy head,

Reddish brown with rocky head. Definite fruit aromas from yeast and malts: apricot and raisin. Some higher alcohols in the taste with the yeast making its presence known thru belgian malts. Finish is dry and a silky mouthfeel.

Pour is hazy (almost murky) brown with ivory head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, spices, candi sugar, light caramel. Taste is lightly sweet with some dark fruits, yeast, spices and biscuity malts. Medium body and good carb.
A foamy, bubbly head, dark amber and slightly cloudy aspect. Plenty of carbonation going on. A slight taste of hops and slightly fruity. A very enjoyable pint!
12oz bottle at Stark's. Pours a copper brown color without much head. Wonderful belgian yeast aroma and flavor.
An interesting brew with some definite sugar and belgian character with some biscuit and flavors. It is a reddish brown, color with a nice sized off white head. Very enjoyable.

OH YES, CHIMAY RED CAP! I love me some Belgian strong ales, and Chimay is at the top of my list for Beer-to-be-Quaffed. I have had the Red before, but I haven spent the time to actually rate it. I was probably too busy enjoying myself. REGARDLESS. Pours a nice, hazy amber colour, a bit deeper than usual because I like to have my lees mixed in prior to imbibing. The head is small and quite short-lived, leaving the barest trace of lacing. Scent is... not much of anything, really. Hmm. Yeasty, bready, thats about it. I wonder if maybe this bottle went wild, as it were. Given the nature of the Chimay method, I would not be surprised. Still, In for a penny, in for a pound. The taste is quite mellow, in a rich kind of way; the mouthfeel has that luxurious rich feeling without being cloying or overbearing. Flavours of hay and wheat, ripe fruit, late summer days. Finishes on the light side, which makes me frown, but then again, this is the Red and not the Bleue that I am used to. It is still a wonderfully good drink, and one that Id force onto lager suckers without hesitation.

Mild fruity aroma. Serves nice , amber , not clear , nice off white/ beige head. Caramel / minimal fruity taste , nice . Carbonation maybe a little too much for my taste . 
Would have it again
Bottle from Fakta, Hammel. Pours red/brown with a lasting beige head. Sweet malty and fruity aroma. Sweet malty taste with notes of caramel. Smooth palate. Medium bittersweet finish.

Deze Trappist heeft een zeer lichte bruine kleur met een identieke schuimkraag. De geur is zeer aangenaam en geeft een zoete indruk. De smaak is een aangename licht bittere smaak maar er zitten ook fruitige toetsen in die vooral in de afdronk naar boven komen.
Dark red beer, lasting creamy head. No noticable lacing. Light aromas of belgian yeasts, banana, sweet caramel malts and cherry. Taste is sweet caramel malts, ripe fruits, bananas. Good good.

Chestnut pour with a towering eggshell fizz that fills half the glass. Visuals reminiscent of a well shaken Coca-Cola. Caramel, honey, dark fruit, esters, Belgian yeast and biscuit. Lively carbonation is a bit too much. The effervescence sizzles on the tongue...not the biggest fan.

Awesome belgian ale, very sweet as well, bottle, nice foamy white head, very good ale

The Chimay Red is reddish brown with a modest head. There is an aroma of caramel and sour yeast. As I sip, I also taste a lambic-type yeast. The taste has sourness in what I think is a perfect balance. The palate is very smooth, and the body is full. This isnt a perfect beer, but its very, very good.

Pours cloudy pale brown, beige top, diminish fast, almost no lasing.
Aroma - toasted malt, dark fruity-yeasty, cherry, a bit sourish and a bit toffee.
Taste - light sweet with minimal sour and minimal bitter from darker malt.
Palate - medium bodied, medium dry finish, floury sticky texture, again flour in my mouth afterwards... starts to annoy me. Weak dubbel, weak fruity esters, could be sweeter. More reminds of some good fermented bock or dunkel.
My second choice amongst the Chimay Red White and Blue brews. Makes a nice compliment/contrast to the others.
33cl bottle. Pours a dark red/brown with a sizable lasting cream head. Tastes of fruit and yeast. Caramel undertones. Malty. Silky smooth on the tongue as Chimay claims.

Bottle, 33cl.
Chimay Rouge has a fruity and roasty aroma, with a hint of caramel. The dark coppery brown gets topped of with an off-white creamy head.
Very smooth and silky taste, with a subtle bitterness that gets overpowered by a caramel sweetness.
12oz bottle to chalice. Deep ruby color with nice active head. Fruity and yeasty. Beautiful dubbel.
One of my favorite dubbel beers. Its roasty with tones of caramel and dried fruit.
Pours dark red with off-white head. Aroma is sweet malty and fruity. Flavour is malty, yeasty and light caramel. My least favourite Chimay.

11.2 oz. bottle poured into Chimay chalice. Appearance is a dark copper with a thick tan head. Aroma is rich, fruity malt with a slight scent of Belgian yeast. Pretty much what I expect from a dubbel. Taste follows the nose, with a noticeable apricot taste as well. Its very good.

33 cl bottle. Hazy amber red color topped by a medium rocky beige head. Aroma of fruity sweet malt with a yeasty bouquet. Upfront flavor has notes of toasted malt and sweet fruit. Mouthfeel is creamy with medium carbonation and complex yeasty undertones. Finishes soft with flavorful with notes of caramel and light spicy hops.
Rooudbruine kleur, weinig schuim. Ruikt zoetig, met iets van caramel. Smaakt naar caramel/toffee, prettig zoet. Prima najaarsbier.

Red-brown color. Big beige head, with good retention. Aromas of red fruit, herbs/spices, with malty sweetness retronasal. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, herbal spicy. Medium bodied. Finishes, with spices, medium bitter.

Really nice hazy red colour with a large, though quickly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is pine, dark fruit, sweet malt. Taste is sweet with a light bitter and sour finish. Oily texture with medium carbonation. Good, but not life-changing.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2014 As Chimay Premiere. Pours reddish dark brown with a medium-sized white head that lasts very long. Aroma of dark fruits and sweet malts; caramel and raisin appear. Taste is medium sweet with dried fruitiness and caramel maltiness dominating the flavours. Palate is medium bodied and very smooth; soft, velvety texture. The blue Chimay is richer and fuller but this was a decent, standard dark Belgian too.
Pours an amber brown beer with a beautiful creamy white head. Smells pretty sweet. A bit like grapes. Tastes licorice and bit caramel. Bit too sweet. Weak carbo and watery texture.

11.2 fl oz / 330mL bottle into a tulip glass. Served cool.

Aroma: Kind of hoppy and bready.

Appearance: Reddish brown, kind of rusty, translucent body with a foamy, moderate off-white head.

Taste: Kind of malty, with a little bit of hop bitterness. Im not getting as much of that yeasty flavor thats present in Chimay Blue.

Palate: Medium bodied with a moderate-long slightly bitter finish.

Overall: Pretty good beer. I didnt like it as much as Blue, but it is still pretty good.

This is an outstanding and subtly complex beer with bready notes and flavors of caramel, bubblegum, pepper, and slight fruity esters. Quite good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Usual suspects of the dark fruit family present in the aroma...raisins, currants and dates. Also brown sugar. Light muddy brown with fine poofy head. Taste is a good balance of fruit elements against richer caramel sweetness. A palate warmer, soft and creamy. The classic, historic dubbel, even if not technically the biggest and baddest.

The first thing that strikes is just how silky it feels in the mouth, very light and refreshing. That works very well against the rich palate of dried fruits and moderate natural sweetness. This would probably be the perfect dinner beer for those reasons, but considering the price I would probably prefer to enjoy something this special on its own.
Dark tinged amber, medium head. Smells.. Stone and dark fruits, dates, and caramel malts. Tastes..like the classic balance of Belgian ale fruits and caramel, malts, slightest bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Pours a reddish brown with a mildly fruity aroma. Nice head and nice lacing. Very smooth beer with a light fruity finish. One of the best beers Ive had the pleasure of drinking. A

Sweet aroma of ripe fruit.
Full, round palate. Flavor is also sweet but not too much
Very subtle and balanced. Slighty sour and bitter in the end.

Bottle thanks to a trade! Pours a clear deep amber with a grayish head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of earthy grains with backing earthy fruits, raisins and a bit of musty grains. Flavor has a good amount of raisin and sweet dark grains with a bit of earthiness in the finish.

bottle shared by derek- thanks! pours a groady looking murky matte brown with a minimal soapy fily cram-colored beer. Not a pretty beer- but got the bottom pour ( top pour looks a lot better.) nose is faint raisins, wine, and malt. lighter and cleaner smell than i ecpected. teste is very belgian- light, carbonated, mats. clean and sharp, easy to drink but not revolutionary to me.

Poured from a .33L bottle into a trappist glass. Looks very nice with a pillowy white head on a reddish copper beer, the aroma is candied fruit, yeast, taste is some citrus, fruit, spice, very nice carbonation and mellow going down very nice

I enjoy this beer. Price at LCBO is pretty decent price as well which makes it even better. The beer gets better with age but i can never seem to keep beer around that long, always end up wanting to drink it right away.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 Is weird, i dont like this beer, aroma and taste for me are not good... Cloudy red color with fine head, fastidious plum notes and frizzy are my sensation when i drunk this beer

33 cL bottle. Hazy, reddish brown, with a medium, tan head. The aroma is caramel, figs, oak, resin, and cherries. The flavor is very sweet and grainy, with a little fruity tartness and light earthy hop bitterness. Medium body, lightly acidic, and effervescent. Overall, this is a lovely, complex, and delicious beer.
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2013 Bottle. Hazy reddish brown with a soapy, mostly disappearing, white head. Aroma is yeast, malt, hints of caramel. Not very complex. Mild sweet. Slightly dry bitter finish.

Van t fust met biergilde hoorn, robijnrood helder bier stevig crème schuim. Inde geur donkere mout en fruit tonen, cranberry en peer. In de smaak mahonie, laurierdrop en gebrande gerstemout. Bitterdroog mondgevoel, waarschijnlijk lekkerder uit de fles.

I broke out a 750ml bottle from my cellar and poured it into the official Chimay chalice. The cork indicates it was bottled in December of 2009. 

Appearance: Beautiful red hue, though seemingly light brown. Hazy but carbonation can be seen. Forms a small, white, soapy head which mostly dissipates and doesnt lace the glass. 

Smell: Noticeably vinous aroma plus some dark fruit and a hint of confectionery sweetness.

Taste: I havent had this beer since, ironically enough, 2009. Back then it seemed like carbonated red wine to me. Four years later it drinks like a true Trappist dubbel. Actually, its almost quad-like in its complexity and robustness. When it was fresh it was quite vinous and fruity, but with three years under its belt its become remarkably sweet. Lots of confectionery flavors, but retains the classic Trappist core to keep it quite familiar. 

The palette is confectionery in its introduction: sweet (but not cloying) flavors of chocolate, toffee and caramel - almost like a liquid candy bar. Some dry bitterness through the middle - not too intense, but bitter enough to notice and to transition to the fruit-like finish. I get hints of dry red wine, fig, prunes and plums on the back end. Not quite as robust and delectable as a vintage Chimay Blue, but this vintage Chimay Red is so much more refined coming out of the basement. 

Drinkability: When you drink a Chimay 750ml bottle fresh its quite spastic and energetic across the tongue and down the throat. With 3.5 years of waiting, Chimay Red has calmed down to an extent. The mouthfeel is noticeably calm, neither thick nor thin, but still effervescent enough that carbonation sticks in the throat a bit. It leaves a slightly yeasty aftertaste, though its easily tolerable. At only 7% ABV, Chimay Red was never all that big of a beer to begin with and after time the alcohol has virtually disappeared. It does not feel or drink like a heavy beer at all and there is no heat or warmth whatsoever.
33cl bottle at home. Hazy orange with an off-white head. Spicy, complex aroma with yeast, chocolate, hops, caramel and toffee. Spicy taste, hops, caramel and orange peel.

Schiuma beige chiaro meno abbondante di quella che ci si aspetterebbe da una dubbel e poco persistente. Colore ambrato scuro. Aroma non troppo particolareggiato e con poche sfumature: insoddisfacente rispetto alle aspettative. Amabile al palato, ha un ottimo gusto pieno e deciso di caramello e frutta secca.
Brown coloured beer with nice blonde head. Aromas of yeast and dark fruits. A slightly sweet taste with a light mouthfeel.
Nice pour, but a bit less pronounced head than the blue counterpart. Aroma is weak wheat. Taste is light caramel and bread. Smooth aftertaste.
Drinking from tulip.Apperance: good head with little lacing.Colour: dark redAroma: some sweetnes with apple, spicenessFlavour: papper, dark fruitsOverall good beer, balanced

The aroma is subtle yet reminiscent of sour fruit and bread malts, but the appearance is very enticing with its brownish red color, large off-white head, and light fine-grain sediment. The taste is nicely balanced with its mild sourness, slight sweetness, and touch of umami; furthermore, the palate combines a thick and slick texture, average carbonation, a medium-full body, and a slightly sour finish.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2014 25 oz bottle poured into a proper Chimay challace. Cloudy brown pour with a large tan frothy head that reduced to a lasting spoonful of foam in the center. Dark sugared fruit. Orange peels. Cloves. Celery. Cherries. Cardamom. Cinnamon. Walnuts. Dates. Prunes. Raisins. Milk chocolate. Nice creamy palate. Very pleasant Dubbel. A step below the blue, but wonderful in its own right. UPDATE: Surprised to find this finally on draft. Now comparing the draft to the bottle side by side. Draft feels lighter, plummier, less carbonated and presents subtle uneven clouds of caramel. Also a slight funk. The draft feels fresher (and is) than the 9th month old bottle in front of me - but there seems no way around the fact that the bottle is better. Darker fruit, darker fluid caramel flavors and no funk at all.

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy dark amber with a nice off-white head and good lacing. Fruity (banana, dark fruits)  and spicy aroma. Sweet, dark fruit and caramel flavors, mild bitter finish, perfectly balanced. Smooth and medium bodied. Great Dubbel.

Very nice beer

33 cl bottle (Long ago since I last had this). Red-brown color. Big beige head, with good retention. Aromas of red fruit, herbs/spices, with malty sweetness retronasal. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, herbal spicy. Medium bodied. Finishes, with spices, medium bitter. Quite good actually.

On tap @ The Knife and Fork (Atlantic City NJ). Pours a nice dark amber color with a light tan head. Aroma is malty, with notes of fig and dark fruits. Taste is similar. Some dark fruits, plum, bready yeast, some mild spice.

Pours copper and hazy with a big, tan head that dissipates slowly into a cap.  Toffee is the aroma that stands out, but there is also molasses, butterscotch, cranberries, raisins, and plum.  Taste is real sweet, and it drinks much bigger than 7% would indicate.  Thick and syrupy mouthfeel, and leaves a strong toffee aftertaste that lingers for a good while.  Im not a big fan of Dubbels, but this was decent to me.

Chimay Première (pas la même!): Ambrée claire, effervescence forte en fontaine de visu, légère au palais, col blanc cassé abondant. Principalement maltée, caramel, petit moka, légère amertume, alcool se fait un peu sentir.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Always one of my favs!! Never rated before though. Tulip style glass. Pours a very hazy, thick deep amber-brown with a very predominant white head. Peut-être lune des moins bonnes trappistes, la "rouge" de Chimay, avec ses fortes arômes de levure typique belge (qui peut rappeler les Unibroue) et son côté légèrement aqueux, est une excellente brune qui ne frappe toutefois pas au coeur de la cible ; en fait, il est assez facile de trouver de meilleures brunes sur le marché. Looks like it may be a slight low fill. Hazy dark red, slight brown color. Good thin off-white kind of creamy head. Got interrupted before I could rerate other categories besides appearance. Bottle stamped L12-317.
Appearance: The body is chestnut hued with poor clarity, the head is creamy and tall that settles rather quickly into a creamy coating covering the body.
Aroma: The aroma hints at cocoa, dark fruits, and some spices, but its faint.
Taste: The flavor is much better than the aroma in strength, but a very similar profile. The fruity, somewhat medicinal, esters dominate the palate with cocoa backing it and a touch of cloves on the finish. Not bad.
Palate: Medium thickness with a creamy texture.
Overall: Im not in love with this, I think there are many better dubbels, but this is solid. I cant say I would ever buy this again though, it is expensive compared to others.

It is a great beer. Complex taste, with light sweet and alcohol that you can feel. It is strong, but balanced.
Copper, with white head. Aroma is fruity and sweet. Taste is not as sweet as aroma, with a light bitterness.

Dark hazy reddish brown color, medium and long lasting beige head. Strong and pleasant aroma of malt, yeast, orange peel and raisin. Taste is malt, caramel, yeast, wheat, some dark fruits and spices. Sweet with gentle dry finish, hoppy bitter and a little alcoholic aftertaste. Full body, fizzy carbonation. Delicious, smooth and warming beer.
Nice amber brown colour, Complex spicy flavour with sweetness and yeast. Very delicious. reminds me of maudite by unibroue. Buy this one

Xmas present bottle from work they normally get wine so this was a result; dark mahogany pour with creamy off white head, caramel and bready malt aroma, sweet caramel taste slight hint of spice and malt. Im liking this.
On tap. Aroma of caramel and malt, a bit acidic. Taste is metallic, grainy with perfume notes.

Premiere eli 0,75 pullo reitattu. Kaatuu lasiin kuparinruskeana ja kirkkaana vaahdon ollessa Chimay-lasissa noin sormen paksuinen ja tiivis jättäen kerroksen oluen pinnalle, tulppaanissa taas muhkeampi. Haju on alkuun hyvin mausteinen, mutta heti perään tulee kuivattua hedelmää, tuoretta banaania ja marjaa. Pientä sitrustakin on mukana. Maku on dubbelmaisen mausteinen, lisälksi siinä on tukena sitrusta, kuivattua hedelmää ja ruohoisuutta. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen, mutta muuten hieman ohuen puolelle kääntyvä. Pirskahtelevuus kuitenkin pelastaa. Hieno dubbel, jossa mausteisuus pääroolissa, mutta sama kysymys nousee kuin R6 kohdalla, saako tästä tyylistä todella upeaa oikein millään?

12 ounce bottle consumed with a sea bass dinner. Im gonna go out on a limb here and say this one is overrated. The aroma was malt and sugar. Appearance was a highly appealing red with heavy amounts of streaming bubbles. No lacing. Taste was a mix of metal, grain, brown sugar and an acidic chaser effect. Palate was medium bodied and fizzy. Overall, this was a malt driven beer, little to no hop presence, and left me with a one dimensional, sweet grain impression. At least the sea bass was good.
Bottle at bar. Thick red color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, earthy notes, toast and fruits. Malty finish with citrus. Very nice dubbel.
Não tão boa quanto as demais, mas ainda assim excelente. Sabor mais pronunciado, com um que de caramelo.

A: Brown copper colored. Hazy and off white head.
S: Not too much. Some clove & caramel like with subtle sweetness and yeast. 
T: Watery, then mild bitter kicks in. Kinda creamy and bread like with clove and caramel. Suggests some sweetness which doesnt really seem to come. Light spicy finish. 
M: Good balance of thickness and carbonation. 

O: It kinda reminds me of a "Dunkelweis" beer. Like the Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier Dunkel. Its not as sweet as the smell suggest. Its similar somehow to St. Bernadus flavor types of the 8 and 12 etc, but without the sweet en depth. Making it refreshing. But theres something missing to give it that edge and uniqueness. Its nice, but not great.

Copper hazy. Fruity solvent aromas (ethyl acetate). Dry metallic with a little sharp finish. Tasty belgian. Lowest alc. of the chimay's.
Rarely drink this anymore since its so ubiquitous but it really is worth revisiting from time to time, especialy with a big pot of mussels.

look: 3  smell: 4  taste: 4  feel: 4.5  overall: 4.5

A - Poured into a Chimay goblet. Murky chestnut brown, nice head off the top but fades into a few islands of active bubbles, that stay until the end. Almost no lacing.

S - Sweet Belgian yeast, loads of fruit, honey, alcohol vapors, toasted brown sugar, spicy nutmeg.

T - Sweet malt, roasted fig, plums, cherry, caramel, the spice really comes out as it warms. Mouthfull is very nice. Medium to full body. No stickiness.

This is a solid Dubbel. Always a good choice for the style. For whatever reason the Chimay name seemes to be a more recognized Belgian beer than other ones in its class. It deserves it.

Dont drink this cold! It provides little taste or smell while cold. This beer as most should sit and warm to fully smell, taste, and sense everything thats going on.

Serving type: bottle

07-10-2010

Doftar intensivt av russin, frukter (mot apelsin och nektarin åt), sherry och karamell. Samma går igen i smakerna. Alkoholen värmer men ligger väl långt fram för att jag riktigt ska njuta. Naturligtvis ett gott öl, men jag hade högre förhoppningar på det.
Nice smell consisting of mainly caramel and alcohol. A sweet taste followed by a bitter bite, goes down smooth. Not bad at all.
Hazy brown colour with thick and lacey slightly off-white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Raisins, toffee and yeast. Quite light bodied. Mildly sweet, but actually quite a pleasantly dry taste.
If you find the Chimay Grande Reserve (blue) a little too robust try this. Pay big bucks. Great beer, and profits go to charity. That should assuage your liberal guilt.

Ambrée brune tirant sur le rouge, robe voilée.
Nez frais et agrumeux, odeur de malt, touche florale.
Attaque pétillante, arômes de caramels doux, peu damertume, persistance moyenne, très fruitée.

2013/02/08 - Pours a hazy brownish/ red with a small, off white head. Aroma is apricots, grape, sweet malts and dark fruits. Taste is similar to smell

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wasnt as impressed as most other people were on here.  Lots of caramel malts and molasses flavour.  Didnt get to much out of the bottle I had, but maybe Ill try it again.  Still a decent beer.
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2014 Chimay is always Chimay. From the colour, the way it pours and the flavour everything is near perfection. For a beer that suites better the cold weather.
For me, this is the beer that started it all... clean, flavorful, and leaving you wanting more...this beer brings out the drinker in you.

aroma: caramel, nuts, floral, alcohol, 
apparenza: red, cloudy, frothy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
palato: medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish, 
aspetto decisamente invitante..rosso/ambrata,bel cappello di schiuma,aroma decisamente maltato e fruttato intensamente,poco luppolato..carbonazione media e corpo tendenzialmente medio,"oleosa" in bocca,ricopre tutto molto prepotentemente..luppolata e maltata inizialmente,mentre il finale lascia più spazio al maltato con piacevoli punte amarognole! inferiore alla chimay bleu,ma comunque birra di grande stile e classe..mi verrebbe da dire che "sa di belgio",stile inconfondibile,birre di categoria superiore..

Bottle. Pours a not-so-deep red with a big tan head. Lovely noisy carbonation. :-) Smells malty. Feels complex for a Double. I taste lots of fruits, caramel, sugar and spices. Fresh and sweet with a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste. A really good double. Doesnt beat the Blue edition, but really good. One of my favourite doubles.
Smell and taste of caramel, fig, apricot, sweet bread. Very fresh and smooth with mild sweetness. Not my favorite Chimay (that would be Blue) but still way up towards the top of my all-time list.
Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Not the most flavorful beer. Gorgeous brown color, creamy head, stuff fruitiness, mildly sweet with a slight bitterness. Very fresh tasting.
Good delicious beer, get this instead of wine to drink, much more delicious!!!
Bread, nutmeg.  Brown sugar.  Silty brown color.  Taste is Sour fruit, caramel.  Not bad. Similar to the rochefort trappistes 8 I had earlier, but not as smooth.
Red-brown color with foamy collar. Fresh smell, sweet caramel. Taste of licorish, caramel and some stronger after-taste (with small bitterness).

Very nice beer with a fantastic contrast of southern fruits and carefully choiced hops. I really enjoy this beer until the last drop and last piece of foam. This is best possible food drink with Mulles frites.
Available only in big bottle, taste good, strong but not too bitter, right texture, high soda

Light brown color with nice 1 finger white foam.  Aroma of  malts, caramel, apricote, butter. Taste is sweet with some sourness and fruitiness. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation.  Nice trappist beer
Bottle. Poured brown, hazy, thick white head. Nice yeast and malts aroma, strong fruit notes. starts sweet (candy like) with a light bitter finish. Very enjoyable  very drinkable.

From an 11.2 oz bottle it pours a cloudy amber color with a 1+ inch bubbly head that dissipates over several minutes to a thin film on top of the liquid.  It was a sudsy head with no lacing at all.  Aroma is distinctly fruity, and its taste is medium sweet with no bitter at all.  Medium body with a creamy texture and fizzy carbonation.  Long mellow finish.  A nice brew that would go well with a sandwich or other bread based snack / meal.

330ml bottle served in Chimay glass. Hazy brown colour, bubbly tan head and aroma of spicy malt, fruits & meaty yeast. Taste is sweetish malt caramel, a tangy grassy earthiness, some yeast & fruitiness, through to a light hop dry bitter finish, Medium body and carbonation, smooth but complex mouth feel, quite drinkable.

La Chimay rouge a une couleur brun foncé bien cuivré, et une mousse couleur crème onctueuse. Assez opaque, elle offre un nez de levure et dépices, auxquels sajoute une touche de pêches et dagrumes. En bouche,  le goût dagrumes est assez subtil. Acidulé et empreint damertume, il amène vers une finale sèche bien équilibrée. Rien de bien sucré dans cette bière quil est bien de laisser tempérer avant de la boire. Il ne sagit pas de ma bière trapiste favorite, mais elle mérite certainement un essai. Le verre Chimay, que je nai jamais eu loccasion de me procurer, par ailleurs, est particulièrement joli. Cheers!

Experienced some varying quality with chumay. This one was in 33cl bottle, fresh not cold, in his own glass. Nice hops aroma. Spicy and grassy. Bread and caramel taste. Cloudy, with gold head, wich stay long.  Well distinguishable bitterness (which is fine but slightly aggressive for me). Tick body, l would expect a little more salinity.

Bottle at platos. Was served way way way too cold though and I had to wait ages before I could drink this. Pours a nice dark dark brown, with a little foam, which disseminates fairly quickly. Slightly sweet initial taste but with a dry finish. Very good beer. Forgot hoe enjoyable this one was.
Dark brown, white foam. Medium carbonation. Starts light sweet (candy sugar) with bitter and dry aftertaste. Balanced.

Chimay Chimay Yah, Chimay Yay Chimay Red,
The Crow flies straight, straight to bed,
Whiskey chaser may cause trouble,
This is a truly delightful dubbel.
Pronunciation isnt really my thing,
But its grade A compared to how I sing.
Pours hazy brown red.  Nose slightly sweet.  I Italy taste Belgian candy, followed by fruit and a little spice. Very smooth to drink.
Cool bottle not much on the label beer is ok but has a funk to the taste and after taste wouldnt recomebend to my friends

ok beer that doesn't match so much to me but ok prob would not get again unless a winter beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance was cloudy root beer with creamy lasting off white 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are fruits of date, fig, apricot, plum and raisin with hints of sweet bready malts. No alcohol present. Taste are sweet  toffee yeasty malty backbone then deep fruits of fig, date, plum and spice, alcohol hidden well. Palate was creamy smooth CO2 with medium body, lasting slightly off yeasty finish. Needing a better finish for me.

Much fizzier and thinner.emptier from when I first drank this in 84. Temporary reasonably foamy head.Slight metallic quality. Trademark complex yet soft firm finesse backbone is long gone & theres vey little interplay between its elements.
Cant see why this beer gets so much love. Surely the mark of the Emperorss new beer.

Aroma ligero y tenue donde destacan las maltas y levaduras. No se perciben esteres frutales caracteristicos en el estilo.

Cerveza con muy buena apariencia. Color obscuro, tonos cafes con destellos rubpi y muy turbia. Carbonatación alta y cuerpo completo. Cerveza muy densa con una corona de espuma media de larga duración.

En boca suave, cremosa y con un final ligeramente amargo.

Al paladar es rica, con buena estructura y densa. Cerveza compleja con un excelente equilibrio entre el dulzor del azucar agregado y el amargor del lupulo, Presenta un final seco.

En general hablamos de una biena cerveza, agradable y con caracteristicas peculiares, aun que para mi gusto un tanto seca y carente de dulzor. Al final, agradable y buena para acompañar una platica relajada.

Bouteille 750ml. De couleur ambrée-brune et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (prunes, notes dagrumes et de raisins) et épicées (clou de girofle, léger de poivre),  moyen de sucre brun avec des notes dalcool et de houblon floral.  Rondeur moyenne en bouche et assez pétillante avec une texture aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées très légèrement terreuses (prunes, léger dabricots, notes de raisins, traces de pommes) et épicées (clou de girofle, notes de coriandre, de poivre et de muscade) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût de sucre brun avec des notes de pain grillé puis en finale se rajoute un goût légèrement amer de houblon floral et une chaleur dalcool moyenne. Post-goût moyen-long, léger-moyen amer de houblon floral et dalcool doux avec un léger goût de levures fruitées (pelures de prunes et de raisins) aux notes épicées (poivre doux).

Poured from a bottle. Amber/brown colour with a lingering head. Aroma of fruit and sweetness. Strong taste of fruit and spices with some hops. Fizzy carbonation on the tongue. Overall a very good beer.

A deep amber in colour, a sharp hop aroma with hint of citrus, a gentle and refreshing hop flavour with a citrus finish, full bodied beer with a 7% rating

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2013 First drank a 33cl bottle in a little pub in Luxembourge after the best meal of my life. Fruity taste with a nice balance. Lovely creamy head with an amber/copper color to the beer. A classic.

Slight floral sent. Caramel color.  Carbonated slight alcohol taste sweet undertone.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Coppery color with good head retention.  Smells of peaches and wheat.  Tastes the same.  One my favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its no where near as good as the blue Chimay. It has a light yeasty & sour aroma and the taste is pretty much the same. It is quite full bodied with an oily mouthfeel & low carbonation. Its slightly watery & flat. Not bad but not great.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 Caramel met oranje noten, getinte, verdwijnende schuimkraag. Aroma van caramel, rood fruit, beetje mint. Niet veel body, ook geen sterke smaken. Wel goede balans tussen zoet, zuur, bitter.

Pours a caramel brown with a quickly disappearing head to a nice cap. Little yeast floating on top. Light fruit and spice on the nose with a lot of bready malt up front.  Good lacing, medium carbonation.  The body of the beer is a little heavy.  The toffee malt and fruit esters combine for a pronounced sweetness.
Bouteille de 330ml, robe amrée, arôme de levure Chimay et goût de fruits et caramel.
0.33l bottle. Dark orange body, off-white head. Lots of caramel and brown sugar in the aroma with some banana and dark fruits. Flavor of caramel, banana, dark fruits and some roastyness. Awesome.

It pours copper with orange highlights, very musty with lees; the head is off-white and soapy (quickly dissipated). The aroma has notes of: prunes, alcohol, bubblegum, and cloves. The taste is light sweet that finishes lightly spiced; peppercorns, bubblegum, and cloves. The palate is light-heavy body, medium carbonation, and a short finish. Overall, far too dainty for a dubbel.
Has an aroma of almost a cider, with a cloudy auburn appearance. Yeasty flavors, with a nice full body.

Bottle at The Libertijn, Den Haag. Poured a cloudy orange brown colour. There is very little life at all and the head was short-lived. The aroma is a little yeasty, but weak. The flavour is all yeast, alcohol and slightly bitter.  A nice beer from Chimay. It's refreshing, but not their best.

Into my chalice, it poured a dark red and leaves the same color body. A small, half centimeter white head appeared and immediately died. No carbonation was seen rising. The smell was the Brett and very powerful yet as the beer warmed the clove and spices came out a bit. The taste was pretty much the same with some plum coming out a bit. The palate was about a medium with a hard crispness all around except for the tongue. Overall, this is good for the style, but decent for me.
330ml bottle. Bottle had been aged for about 18 months. Excellent, strong taste of malts and slightly bitter. Also slight after taste of nut and bread. Pretty decent.

Bottle, 33 cl. Hazy copper with a rocky tan head, super retention, nice lacings. Sweet malty, very spicy yeasty aroma with dry abricot notes and a tangy whiff of something resembling cloves and star anise. Taste is surprsingly dry, and - again - tangy spicy, with a medium body and an almost fizzy mouthfeel with a light to medium bitter finish. Very tasty and easy drinkable for a Belgian Dubbel.

Drank in 2012 with a bottle that says best before 2015 so to me that means that it was probably fairly young. Ruby copper almost brown with a thin, off-white, lacy, lasting head. Smells of dark berries like cherries, roasted malt, and fruity malt. Slight hop bitterness. Caramel with yeast. Medium oily thin body. Tastes of sweet malt with light roast and alcohol. Some dried fruit like figs with leathery nutty characters. Fairly complex.  The alcohol and bitterness really detract from a young bottle such as this. I would think that two years would really clean it up and add a depth that Trappist beers are good for.
Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with thick creamy head. Distinct aroma of malt and apricot. Pleasant, bittersweet taste of malt with a fruity finish. Enjoyable, lingering dryish aftertaste. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Very pleasant aroma of wood, berries, cherries, fruit, basement. Malt based beer, with subtle bitterness, spiciness, yeast and alcohol. I fell in love with this color.  One of my most favorite beers, i will try to make some dubbel.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Sweet malty aroma with decent foam. Taste is delightful. I can taste it a little bit bready with very nice dried-appricot ending.

Dark brown beer, nice head, quitte malty tasting, altough it also has a medium bitterness and a medium sweetness. I dig this one pretty hard, because it is so very very balanced: excellent beer! It does kind of taste like a weaker version of the blue chimay.

dn une belle couleur cuivrée on resent des notes de petit fruits elle est douche en bouche et pas trop aggresive bien equilibré par son cote fruite et elle a un petit touche amertume a la fin elle liquoreuse et et tres douche je trouve pour une de ce type (rate 31)

I wasnt incredible impressed with this beer the first time or two I had it. This last time, however was a little different. I had a bottle that I had been aging for about three years. I took it to a beer release with a buddy of mine. Wow, what a difference three years made. It was incredibly smooth and had some real depth of flavor. I think I will pick up a couple more of these to age. I love the Chimay Blue fresh...but after tasting this aged...might have to try aging the Blue also.

Bottle from saq A: bready, spicy, a touch of caramel, grappy App: copper with white head. T/P: full body medium long sweet finish. High carbonation. Some hotness from the alcohol. O: great. Such a threat. A unique Belgium classic.

Excellent caramel color, smooth with mild flavor and top shelf taste, would love to drink it again but it?s too pricey at $9 per 12 oz. bottle from local bars, over $100 per case from distributors, it?s just not that good.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 reddish brown, opalic body with moderate head; harmonic taste of spices, sweetness and alcohol with fruity signs; a bit too fizzy for me, otherwise perfect

Pours a rich brown color with a couple fingers of off white foam that sticks nicely. Aromas are sweet caramel, date, fig and a touch of earthy belgian yeast. On the palate the mouthfeel is lighter than the nose leads you to believe with nice carbonation bringing out the date flavors nicely, brown sugar, touch of dark fruit and some yeasty goodness to make it a beautifully balanced beer !

Cloudy dark amber with a beautiful white head and great lacing. Aroma is apricot and spice. Perfectly balanced taste. Flavors of fruit, caramel, spice.
Wonderful beer.
Ambrée très foncé avec une mousse moyenne. Un peu sucré, un goût des fruits sec, mais pas très fort. Très facile a boire pour une bière trappiste.
red,browish in color with much delicate white foam. taste of roasty caramell and some nice tasty herbs
According to Cees, interesting palate, unique taste and not too fruity. Original beer, lets have more.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Dark ale brown colour; Big head and frothy, with fragment smell of caramel and vanilla; full body, has the typical taste of dark beer but only slighty; hop bitterness is on the low side, which quickly give way to strong caramel, banana and fruity sweetness, a very enjoyable feeling!

Comments: This is what I call quality stuff! As Chimays entry Trappist beer, the Red is definitely a joy and itll go easy with any beer taster. At 7% abv, it doesnt shot to the head as fast as other low abv cheapo lager. The only way is up, so bring on the Chimay White!
Bottle.  I love drinking this beer - i love cooking with this beer - i think it might be the best widely available beer around.  nuough said.
Deep tasting Belgian strong ale. Very well balanced with the high alcohol content well hidden. Complex yet smooth at the same times.

I Poured this beer for the first time in a signature Chimay glass. Head was not as clean or neat as I prefer but the aroma was sweet and nutty. Tastes are crisp, bold and fruity. Hints of lemon, sweetberry and cinnamon were left on my palette. A fantastic winter beer !

330ml bottle. What to say about this beer.... because of this  and some other classics my beer addiction took form decades ago. Very well balanced, tasty and enjoyable. Nice sweet, fruity and rose aromas. Pours amber, with creamy tan head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation, smooth texture. Taste is sweet, caramel, fruity, with a warming aftertaste.

Bottle of 330 ml, served in a Chimay glass at home.
Colour is of honey, still very dark when hold against the light.Head is beige in color, thin and didnt stay for long. I would have given it an even higher grade if it wasnt for the head, but even so, its beautiful.
Very sweet aroma of fruits, maybe plums, or prunes.
Taste is also sweet, fruits such as apricots but sort of caramelized, very close to dadels. Unique.
Thick on the body with average carbonation.
Overall, a great beer, great quality and great value for money.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2013 33 cl bottle. Dark reddish brown, lasting but thin head. The taste is very balanced, creamy, a little sweet at the beginning and a little bitter at the end. Medium body, medium carbonation and lasting bitter and sour finish. Delicious and easy drinking. Not as magnificent as the blue but great in any event.
Bottle from Market District, actually liked this more than blue label, smoother and not as bitty, with the alcohol not as prevalent.  of course nice head over light golden color.

Aroma: caramel, some fruit, malt

Appearance: very thick dark and creamy head, dark brown color with a hint of transparency

Taste: caramel, malt, light hop bitterness, a bit dry, grass 

Palate: dry, not much aftertaste, 

Overall: nothing bad about this beer, not as good as blue

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I get lots of woody notes, very faint brandy, and a barely noticable Belgian yeast taste. Good beer, like all Chimay.

Dark reddish brown, with foamy white head, about half-finger thick. Little bit of lacing, not much.

Very sweet nose of banana,apricot, other fruits, caramel, nuts. Very soothing and pleasurable. Very tropical.

Very sweet flavors of tropical fruits, chewy caramel, with a smooth as silk body. Average carbonation level. Im loving it. Maybe a little tango in there as well. Nice.

Again, the only real setback is the price. This is an outstanding brew that is worth a four-pack or single bottle purchase.
Dark reddish brown, lasting soapy head.  Dark fruit. Nice hop. A bit thin.
Nice copper color and good head.  Very smooth, delicious, and easy to drink.  Light fruity taste mixed well with a tiny bit of bitterness.  Malt.
Strong hoppy aroma, pretty orange-brown pour. Malt and hops flavour, kind of light bodied. Good in all aspects but not particularly strong in any of them.

Bottles shared with McTapps. A quality one with a nice brown colour and deep in aroma. Something like caramel and coffee maybe. Taste is kind of thick but very drinkable. A good one for some good points.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Six pack bought in Belgium and shared with MichaelBruch. Dark ruby red-brown colour with steady and big head. Quite smoothy texture of the beer. Taste of rich malt, rich yeast, ripe berries and fresh grains. Very easy and delicious to drink.

I cant understand the renown of this beer (not Chimay, but Chimay Rouge). Its very correct in all aspects, the look is perfect and the aromas are very well integrated. But the mouthfeel is too light, watery and, in my opinion, very bland for its style. Biscuit, malts, caramel, even species, but all so tiny, with such short development, that I think that is one of the most flat beers in its style. Maybe the problem is mine...

Beautiful dark ruby color with a light tan head. Little to no lacing in the the chimay goblet. Nose is arromatic of sweet malt and citrus. Tingly mouthfeel with good sweet malt and floral hop flavor. Aftertaste is pleasant and dissipates quickly with hints of apple cider. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chimay really can do no wrong in my book and while this is no "blue," the red is a close second.  Complex with a variety of dark fruits, vanilla, bread, and a slight acidity that leaves the mouth wanting more than is probably healthy.

0.33 L bottle @ Beer OClock, Bucharest.

Dark and clear  burgundy liquid, short white head.

Aroma is very well balanced, with notes of roses, soy syrup, orange peel, raisins, brown sugar, vanilla, fresh wood, dried soil, bitter cherries, quince.

Full body, fresh bittersweet taste, astringent, low carbonation, extraordinary!

Pours an average creamy off-white head that diminishes mostly. Body is hazy and copper colored. Aroma contains caramel, orange, lemon, dough, brown sugar and pepper. Flavor is initially light acidic, followed by moderate sweetness and light bitterness. Carbonation is soft. Texture is creamy with a light astringent finish. All flavors are very well balanced. I love this one!
After rating combined this beer with Chimay cheese a la biere, a cheese that  has a fruity taste with a light bitter finish. The combination reduced the bitterness in both the cheese and the beer, making the cheese softer and more fruity and the beer more fruity and sweeter. A nice variation, but the complexity is reduced, which is a bit a pity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Nice spicy peppery aroma. Pours a cloudy deep copper color.  Taste is a peppery yeasty slightly dry finish.   Heavy pear flavor.   A little too dry to be one off favorites but it does get a little better with some heavy bread. Definitely gets better as it warms. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a cloudy reddish amber colour with a tall foamy off white head and nice lace. Complex aromas of pears, raisins, caramel, clove, toffee and yeast. Flavours follow the aroma. Nice warming alcohol. Can never tire of Chimay.

#557
Die 0,75 L Flasche mit Schampuskorken geöffnet und munter eingeschenkt. Viel Schaum aufgrund ordentlicher Kohlensäure-Perlung. Im Glas dunkel und reichlich trübe. Das Aroma empfinde ich als gelungen. Malzige Süße mit Hefe und eine würzige Fruchtigkeit. Erinnert an ein Hefe-Weißbier, nur vergleichsweise herberer Einschlag. Der Geschmack ist leider nicht so ausgeprägt wie das Aroma erwarten läßt. Neben den Frucht-, Hefenoten auch herbere Kakaonoten. Im Abgang ist aber nur noch eine alkoholische Note. Interessantes Bier, aber nicht überragend. Vielleicht hätte ich es auch nicht so gekühlt servieren sollen. Daher wird dieses Bierchen demnächst einer B-Probe unterzogen ;)
	
Test vom 3.12.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,12,11,9,9,9 - 9,75

Not sure how I missed this one before. Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown-gold with a very high, cinnamon-colored, large-grained head. Nose is candy sugar, apricots, and toast. Clean on the tongue, with bitterness and a very very faint sourness playing off the essential Belgian character. I can taste the wheat. Finishes long and a little dirty. Good and reliable.

Pours a cloudy deep reddish amber color with a decent off white head that dissipates rather quickly. Smells of caramel and chocolate up front with a fair amount of fruity and sweet maltiness. Light pepper and yeasty esters provide balance as the hop aroma is just about non existent. The flavor is sweet with lots of caramel and dark sugars with a fair amount of dark dried fruits. Prunes and raisins mixed with a bit of pepper and other assorted yeastiness. Medium body with a spirited level of carbonation and a sweet bubbly mouthfeel. I love the flavor, and the aroma isnt half bad either. For my personal taste the carbonation level is a bit high and makes the mouthfeel a bit too bubbly. Minor annoyance to my palette in an otherwise fantastic beer.
33 cl bottle at Melkebaren. Although not the most exciting beer, this is a well made and perfectly drinkable belgian double, with all the characteristics you would expect from such a beer.
Bè una delle birre che mi ha avvicinato allartigianale....disponibile nel bar di fiducia è sempre una garanzia...

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2013 Great palate with fruit, caramel & raisin notes that are also in the aroma, perfectly balanced bitterness and appetizing dark pour with thick head that sticks to the glass.  Finally got around to trying this and im not dissapointed, I doubt I will be buying any again though because im sure there are some cheaper alternatives.

Medium red-brown body, moderate sized off-white head, spotty lacing.  Nose is fruity malts with raisins, prunes, caramel.  Flavor is similar with a nice semi-sweet character.  Medium to full bodied, smooth carbonation, classic Belgian dubbel finish.
Pleasantly fruity aroma and cloudy brown in color. Lightly bitter and moderately sweet. Medium bodied and noticeably acidic.  Minimal head on a straight pour.

Pours dark with a thick creamy head. Aroma of dark fruits, fig, plum, belgian yeast. Flavor folloes with a burst of fruit and a heavy mouthfeel. Bit of booze, but in a good way that accents the heavy fruit nicely. World class brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml. Brown/red with light head.  Aroma is teast with some figs and dried fruit.  Taste is sweet with some malt.  Complex.  High carbonation.  Good, not great.

Like all Chimay brews Ive sampled, this beer is exceptionally smooth without being thin or weak. Excellent aroma, beautiful copper color and smooth on the palate. I enjoy the blue label more, but would never turn this down.

Bottle. Yeast, brown sugar, light fruit. Dull cloudy brown, huge off-white rocky head. Very nicely balanced initial; some tart fruit in mid -- overripe raisins and cherries; finish is smooth and sweet and then has a bit of acidity. Thin-medium body with a touch of astringency. A well-made beer, but not the most exciting dubbel. I do, however, have a soft spot for Chimay Red because (thanks to Richard H.) it was one of the first that got me into craft beer.
Probably my least favourite of the three flagship Chimay beers, but still a very good Dubbel. Probably because of all the Belgian styles, this one is not at the top of my list.

Absolutely gorgeous beer, nice thick head which sticks around and leaves great lacing. Aroma is funky, spicy yeast with hints banana and some breadyness. Taste is brown sugar, some dark fruit, with a spicy finish as well as some alcohol taste as it warms.  Very good beer, but there are so many other great dubbels out there.
Big beige head, cloudy amber color. Scent is dark and fruity. Fruity, a bit hoppy and good. Worth enjoying.

cloudy amber with large beige head. Quite lasting, leaving laces
Aroma very pleasant malts, sweet, fruity. I would describe as mild
Taste.. roasted malt sweets, light bitter
Finish is bit dry and bit bitter, not much, but decent
Overall.. Cant judge theese.. maybe something is lacking to be perfect, thou with something else, it would be a different beer,
thou this one is great.

Perfect head, thick and lasting. Beautiful copper reddish brown colour. But the taste is disappointing, not distinctive. Good but not remarkable. Cant help to think that Chimay is the least remarkable trappist of the trappists I have tasted so far (all but Westvleteren). Still a nice beer though, of course.

Backlog...late 2011/early 2012...pours a murky brown/ruby color with a medium tan head...very nice retention and lacing.  Aroma has notes of fig, raisin, and an earthy spice.  Flavor has fruity notes...plum, fig...some breadiness, and some earthy/spicy/leathery notes.  Mouthfeel is medium/full and the finish is dry and leathery/fruity.

Bouteille acheté à la SAQ. Servie dans un verre trappiste. Belle apparence, dun brun ocre surmonté dun collet beige pale. Arome de banane et de caramel. Petite touche dalcool dans le goût. Bonne bière pour les amateurs du Dubbel.

Bottle at CJ Muggs (St. Louis, MO). Pour is deep copper with a big off-white head and great lacing. Plums, yeast, dark fruits, light pepper, and anise in the aroma. Taste is dark fruits, licorice, bread, spice, biscuit, clove, yeast, and tannin with a nice crisp bite on the finish. Medium body with medium carbonation. Definitely an approachable Belgian and highly drinkable. Tasty stuff.

750ml bottle.  Pours a hazy garnet colour with a large beige head.  Aroma is red fruit, yeast, raisin, dark sugars, with faint citrus.  Delicious.  As for taste, its suprisingly dry, and much thinner bodied that expected.  Plum and earth notes, light fruit, with yeast, light molasses, red wine, black tea, and a bitter sour finish.

Deep brown-reddish body is capped by a large but dissipating cream head. Stewed fruit and some apple juice on the nose. Taste is plum, dark fruit and floral tones. Hops add a medium bitterness with a bit of a metallic tang at the end. Plenty of body, with some alcohol apparent. Good palate. A well rounded Belgian dubbel with oomph.

Pours reddish purple, moderate head, leaves lot of lacing.  Smell is sweet dark fruit, plum, yeast.  Palate is lighter than expected, dry, with yeast and fruit.  Finish is quick and dry.  Exceptionally easy drinking and flavorful.  Goes well with rich foods.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 0.75 bottle. The liquid is cloudy, dark red mixed with brown, head is khaki, small and disappears quickly. Very nice fruity aroma composed mostly of apples, apricot and some berries. Sweet taste with a subtle hint of hop bitterness and a bit of fruity sour tones. Body is medium, texture creamy with a slight slick sensation following when swallowed. Carbonation is average, somehow does not fit the beers temperament but quickly subsides. Finish is medium in length, follows the taste and the best way to describe it would be consummate. Overall this is a great beer worthy of all the praise it gets, magnificent.
Bottle. Reddish brown color with a creamy beige head. Aroma of toast, yeast and caramel. Dry sour taste of caramel with some berry notes. Slightly sugary bitter finish.

Pour from bottle into Chimay Chalice

A: Pours a dark brown color. Pretty cloudy and light is unable to pass through due to this. Light tan, 1.5 finger head that disappears pretty quickly leaving no lace behind.

S: Dried out fruits, apples mostly, with a musky, hoppy smell that follows. The malt really comes through. There is some yeasty notes in there as well.

T: Creamy orange peel and other dried fruits come through, little sour and bitter end note that doesnt sit for very long. The maltiness gets highlighted through middle which is nice.

M: clean mouth fell. Medium bodied. lots of carbonation but subsides quickly.

O: Overall a good dubbel. Some of the flavors arent as pronounced as I would like them to be, Mainly some sweeter notes, but overall I enjoyed it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-05-2011 00:50:01

A hazy dark amber pour with a khaki head. Incredible dark fruit and spice notes on the aroma. Great toasted malt, toffee, and caramel. Some yeast, molasses, and plenty of banana. There is a really great sweetness to the flavor. Tons of caramel, brown sugar, and toasted bread. Sweet banana and dark fruits work well with the strong clove spice flavor. Really great stuff.
Bottle. Caramel, malts, yeast esters. Plums, candi sugar and all that. Feels a bit lighter on the body than the blue version. Otherwise in the same general direction.

As far as Trappist beers are concerned, this is one of the best ones out there! Do yourself a favor if by some chance you haven't had this beer and try it! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of the best breweries in the world. This one is kind of fruity, but still has the great bitter caramel tint that the other trappisten-beers have.
330ml bottle. One of the very best. Mild, with fruity undertones and aroma.

Bottled, 0.75l. Hazy amber brown color with mid-sized creamy tan-like head and average carbonation. Aroma of yeast, spicy hops, fruits and honey. Tastes sweet and rich malty, then followed with dry fruits and honey taste. This beer is great balanced with pleasant bitterness in the aftertaste. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Almost flawless beer...

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2012 Shared 750 ml bottle to oversized snifter. Looks solid; a cloudy brown with off-white head that dissipates into lacing. Smells decent; dark fruit, dough, and yeast. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Decent, but nothing like the Blue.

Bottle. Dark brown with medium brown head. Typical abbey ale. Aroma sweet malts, dried fruits, flowers. Taste sweet and malty, sugar, very nice. Alcohol very well hidden, it´s a dangerous beer, as it´s easy to drink a lot of it. By my opinion the best one of the three ordinary Chimays.

I havent reviewed this despite having it many times. 75CL in a snifter. Dark amber, lots of sediment, 2 finger head that fades almost instantly. Ive had this in the cellar for  a year or so. Huge candied sugar and brown sugar with some heavy raisins scent. Maybe cherries. Spicy taste. Clover and coriander and more brown sugar. Nice balance and not all that bitter. Has sort of a metallic finish.

caramel, citrus, grass, raisin, orange, red, (almost ruby), hazy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, lightly bitter in the finish.

Pours a very nice copper/dark ruby with tight bubbled tan head.  Aromas of dried fruit with grassy citrus and Belgian yeast.  Flavour of dark caramel and roast malt combine with surge of carbonation on the tounge.  Some darker flavours of cocoa come through in the latter part as the beer warms.  Mouthfeel is creamy/slick with growing bitterness in the aftertaste.  Bitterness does not last but ends with a pleasant sweetness that lingers until the next sip.  A very satisfying beer to savour slowly.
One of my favourite Trappist Beer, red color, full aroma and flavour. Medium sweetness, tan foam, medium body, soft carbonation.
33cl. Pours hazy brown with a generous head. Fruity aroma with hints of alchool. Good aftertaste. Very good beer

750mL bottle from LCBO.  Pours clear dark ruby with a half-inch beige head.  Aroma is spicy, with some alcohol.  Brown sugar and spice taste, hints of chocolate, and a clean finish.  Enjoyable but not as good as I remember it.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Im beginning to think there is nothing that comes from Chimay that is anything less than delicious. Pours a dark copper, obviously unfiltered into the glass with a generous off white head. Dried fruit and malt on the nose. The flavor follows with wonderful malt character and just the right touch of hops at the finish. So good. That being said, I prefer the White and Blue Chimays to this one but this beer is still delicious and I would easily drink it again.

Right...its got the right chestnut colour, the right opacity and a generous, reasonably creamy head that will reduce to a lumpy centre. Aromas of sileage, yes, but also of malts and a wet barn, perhaps with an old cupboard with ciders and where a decadent brandy-drenched Christmas cake is slowly decaying. This is all packed within a sombre trappist simplicity. Flavours follow the trend. Syrup, decaying fruits, sileage, malts and honey, cookies...gives the beer a complexity that is not well rounded and harmonious as I would like it to be. The sileage, particularly, comes out too strong. Palate is pleasant and perfectly balanced, dry, with bitterness and mellow malts equally distant and subtle.

Dark ruby tinted brown. The nose carries dates and figs with some slight florals. Full bodied, this carries more pit fruit and other sweeter character before showing hints of grape on the back of the palate. Highly carbonated with a lively mouthfeel.

Dark copper pour with large head.

Aroma is slightly fruity with a yeasty note
Flavor has notes of fruit with a opening sweetness tart drys out.  A, little oily but tasty

Bottle. Pours a ruby-like body, with a huge light brown head that diminishes very quickly, leaving a very ood lace and a rocky mass of foam in the center of the glass. A little bit disappointed with the aroma. Recognised only the malts, also some notes of caramel, nothing too special. Exceptional taste though. Some light to medium sweetness at the start, with notes of caramel, nice roastiness as you swallow, then comes the medium bitter aftertase. Very complex, wonderful. Medium body, soft carbonation level, oily texture. Overall, a good beer, maybe a little overated, but a very pleasant experience.

Bottle at home. Color is dark red/copper. Flavor very yeasty, small bubbles make the beer feel thicker. Feels a bit dry on the palate, perhaps a bit too much so for me. The body is not as full as I expected. Dryness lingers. I prefer Chimay Blue (maltier and sweeter). Have to try this again some day, though.

Light sweet honey apricot smell. Bitter carbonated mouth. Honey bitter taste. Not a great after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bruin met rode tint en licht bruine kop. Schuim verdwijnt rap en laat aardig laagje over. Geur en smaak zijn vooral (gedroogd) fruit, appelsiroop en caramel. Licht koolzuur aanwezig. Prima bier, maar niet om te vaak te drinken. Te zoet voor mijn smaak.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at Hotel Regina, Madrid. Pours deep amber with an off-white head. Fruity aroma with Belgian yeast, malt, caramel and some dried fruit. Hints of alcohol. Sweet and fruity with a nice, lightly bitter finish. Well balanced. Nice and refreshing. (2012-08-17)

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2014 33cl. Bottle. 
Pours cloudy brown with almost white head. 
Aroma dried fruit, yeast, sugar, malts, spice. 
Taste nice bittersweet taste, well balanced, some pepper/spice in the finish? 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Good trappist.
Dark brown with a high grey-ish top. A fruity sweet syrup taste with a bitter, hot aftertaste. Overall a very enjoyable beer but not for any day.

0,33 flaske fra Polet. Like elegant smakfull, kompleks og velbalansert som Chimay blå, men litt lysere og "bare" 7%. Vanskelig å si hvliken jeg foretrekker - egentlig begge. Et herlig øl - hva skulle vi gjort uten de belgiske trappister?

11.2oz bottle.  Unfiltered amber-red body, creamy off-white head.  Mellow amber malt aroma.  Quite simple, not as good as I recall it from years back.  The upfront astringent bite really stands out, but then it fades into a smooth clean malt finish.  The odd ingredient list is a real bummer.  Good, but not on par at all with its Trappist brethren.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 Brown dark chestnut clear colour, malt sweet smell, like brewing smell, sweet syrop appel like with a bitter nice carbonation, creamy fruity

A - Copper red hues with a small amount of sediment at the bottom. Fluffy off white head that turned to a film quickly and left little lacing.

S - Sweet malts, hint of candied fruits and a bit of hops but overall just little hints of all this nothing overpowering, but I am not complaining.

T - Again I find a lot of the tastes subdued but still very nice and refreshing. Dryer than I remember it being. Still some fruits and malt but a nice slightly hoppy bitterness that balances it out beautifully.

M&D - Like I said, drier and easier to drink than I remember. I know it is made for sipping but I was thirsty and it was tasty and now its gone. I want another one!

Bottiglia 33 cl.
Bel colore ramato con schiuma beige chiaro abbastanza persistente.
naso non molto intenso con note di marmellata di albicocca e malto tostato.
entra abboccata, poi bilanciata da una lieve amarezza e acidità......finale corto....discreta.

Unclear brown with a reddish hue, lively beige foam.
A soft nose with some hops but not too bitter nor sharp, a little sweet; pleasant but quite soft.
Fortunately enough the taste is much more outspoken, in fact positively surprising. Its a combination of roasted malts, hop, decently carbonated mouthfeel, a subtle touch of alcohol which you wouldnt expect in a 7% beer.
The aftertaste is quite malty, less roasted than the actual taste itself, still good but less powerful.
A good lighter brother to the excellent Chimay Bleu, without its sour hint, less roasted but with a bit more spices and hoppiness. While less stronger, it still makes for a good choice.

Bottle (330 ml). Dark brown/amber with a medium creamy off-white head and nice lacing. Aroma of belgian yeast, spices, malt, fruits and candy sugar. Taste of malt, spices and fruits. Very good dubbel. A softer/less complex version of the Chimay Bleue.
0,33l bottle. A dark red beer with a good pink head. The aroma is soft with notes of fruits, caramel and malts. The taste is bitter with fruity notes. The finish is slightly dry.

Wonderful floral hop aroma immediately after pouring. Thick dense head (for this style) perfect balance of hops, carbonation and malt.  Not at all thin, but a very good drinking beer.  clove or spice esters.  No dactyl, banana, butter or other off flavors.  very clean taste.

330mL bottle. Pours deep red with a nice creamy off white head and an apricot/lemon curd aroma. I had yeast might overpower the taste of this beer but i couldnt of been more wrong. The bitterness is light yet there is so much flavour from start to finish. The malt/yeast flavour mix very well, nice beer.

Pours a reddish brown with a moderate head. Interesting sweetness to it. Im normally not a fan of the Belgian styles, but I really appreciate this one. The sweetness is muted and balanced by the malts in the beer. Very interesting.
Bottle from Global Wines, Bearwood. Reliable Belgian class from the rather well established Trappist lot. Smooth brown nutty Dubbel, with unmistakeable Belgo yeast taste. Like it.
330ml bottle. Hazy brown red color. Small white thick head. Malty, sweetish, raisins in aroma. Sweet, alcohol, yeast, malty flavor.
Fruit nutes in beginnig. After a short time you can feel good bitter palate, but fruit nutes stays on your tongue. Dark-white foam, stays short. Copper colour.

Bottle enjoyed at home
A slow gusher, pours dark brown with a nice looking beige head. Smells of caramel, yeast esters, dried fruits and malts. Medium sweet, quite dry, some dark and dried fruits. Medium bitter finish, some hops. Lively carbonation, medium body, watery texture. Quite nice, comparable with Rochefort 6 which i had the same evening. This is actuallty a bit better. The Rochefort yeast has a tiny edge but the hops and malts in the Chimay fights back, and in the end the look is what makes Chimay Rouge win. This is a very very good beer

A-- Poured a dark plum color that was cloudy due to yeast floaties in the over excited pour. A light brown half finger head and no lacing on the glass.

S-- Plum, apricot, spice and bread. Very rich hearty smell and also earthy as well. Just a touch of alcohol in this but it is soft and accentuates the fruit and spice even more.

T-- Hearty and a bit chewy. Big apricot and plum taste. Very stone fruit. Bread is there but it is a big hearty bread taste not the biscuit taste as more common. 

M-- Pretty thick and chewy. Little carbonation and as said a very earthy taste and feel in mouth. Spice driven, not sugar driven. A little tartness in this also.

D-- Feels bigger than ABV really is. Dark, warm and inviting and a great sipping beer.
Tmaví pivo dělané Trapistickými mnichy s homosexuální láskou. Moná proto mělo dost nepříjemný vocas. Lahváč z Makra.

Poured from 11.20 oz glass to tulip glass. Creamy off white head quickly dissapates to little or no head. No lacing left on glass after each sip. Aroma of roasted malts, cherries, dough, clove and a little floral hops. Taste is similar with a creamy, bubbley champagne finish that lingers on the palate. Overall a good beer, but not in the class of big brother Blue.
